analyzed: gal te dngos po stong gyur na //
translated: If things were empty,

original: gzhig byar 'gyur gyi 'jig pa min //🔽ri rab tsam gyis gang zag dang // bdag tu lta ba gnod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhig byar 'gyur gyi 'jig pa min // ri rab tsam gyis gang zag dang // bdag tu lta ba gnod mi 'gyur //
translated: they would be destroyed, but they are not destroyed.🔽The view of the person and the view of self

original: zhes kyang gsungs so //🔽de bzhin du gzugs stong zhes bya bar mi mthong //
analyzed: zhes kyang gsungs so // de bzhin du gzugs stong zhes bya bar mi mthong //
translated: would not be harmful even if they were the size of Mount Meru.🔽Similarly, it says, “One does not see form as empty or as not empty.”

original: mi stong zhes bya bar yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las de skad gsungs te /
analyzed: mi stong zhes bya bar yang mi mthong ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las de skad gsungs te /
translated: This is stated in the Perfection of Wisdom.

original: de'i phyir stong pa nyid dang / dngos por mngon par zhen par byar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir stong pa nyid dang / dngos por mngon par zhen par byar mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to cling to emptiness and to things.

original: da ni dbu ma pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du smra ba la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa tha snyad thams cad 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dbu ma pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du smra ba la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / dkon mchog gsum la sogs pa tha snyad thams cad 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that for the Mādhyamika, who advocates that things are empty of intrinsic reality, all conventions such as the four noble truths and the three jewels are tenable, it is said:

original: gzhan yang / gang la stong pa nyid rung ba //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gang la stong pa nyid rung ba //
translated: Moreover, for one for whom emptiness is tenable,

original: de la thams cad rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de la thams cad rung bar 'gyur //
translated: everything is tenable.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “ Everything” refers to arising and so on.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni bden pa bzhi dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi dang / zhugs pa bzhi dang / dkon mchog gsum dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni bden pa bzhi dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi dang / 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi dang / zhugs pa bzhi dang / dkon mchog gsum dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang / chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang /
translated: The term “and so on” includes the four noble truths, the four fruits of the spiritual practitioner, the four abiders in the fruits, the four enterers, the three jewels, mundane fruits, virtue and nonvirtue,

original: tha snyad thams cad bsdu'o //
analyzed: tha snyad thams cad bsdu'o //
translated: and all conventions.

original: de dag ji ltar rung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate how these are tenable, it is said:

original: ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can they be?

original: mig la sogs pa sgyu ma'i skyes bu la skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid stong pa bzhin du yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid stong yang /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa sgyu ma'i skyes bu la skyes bu'i ngo bo nyid stong pa bzhin du yod pa dang / med pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid stong yang /
translated: The eye, etc. are like the illusory man, who is empty of the nature of a man, and empty of the nature of existence, nonexistence, etc.

original: rkyen gyi tshogs pa mtha' dag yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni skye ba ste /
analyzed: rkyen gyi tshogs pa mtha' dag yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba ni skye ba ste /
translated: When the totality of conditions exists, they arise, i.e., are produced.

original: de ni sdug bsngal lo //🔽de sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal lo // de sdug bsngal ba la sogs pa /
translated: That is suffering.🔽The seeing of that suffering, etc.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / mi rtag pa dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i rnam pa dag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: as suffering, impermanent, empty, and insubstantial is the truth of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu ni sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba ste /
translated: The cause of suffering is the origin of suffering,

original: de la kun 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la kun 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the origin of that.

original: de kun 'byung ba la sogs pa kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu @239b skye ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi rnam pa dag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de kun 'byung ba la sogs pa kun 'byung ba dang / rab tu @239b skye ba dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi rnam pa dag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: The seeing of the origin of suffering, etc. as origin, intense generation, cause, and condition is the truth of origin.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu 'gog pa ni 'gog pa ste /🔽de 'gog pa la sogs pa /🔽'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa dag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu 'gog pa ni 'gog pa ste / de 'gog pa la sogs pa / 'gog pa dang / zhi ba dang / gya nom pa dang / nges par 'byung ba'i rnam pa dag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni 'gog pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: The cessation of the cause of suffering is cessation.🔽That is seen with the aspects of cessation,🔽peace, excellence, and definitive release.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu 'gog pa /🔽'thob pa'i thabs ni lam ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu 'gog pa / 'thob pa'i thabs ni lam ste /
translated: The cessation of the cause of suffering is the truth of cessation.🔽The method for attaining that is the path.🔽That is seen with the aspects of path,

original: de lam la sogs pa lam dang rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa dag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni de'i lam gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: de lam la sogs pa lam dang rigs pa dang / sgrub pa dang / nges par 'byin pa'i rnam pa dag gis mthong ba gang yin pa de ni de'i lam gyi bden pa'o //
translated: reason, practice, and definite release.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yod na chos kyang 'grub la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yod na chos kyang 'grub la /
translated: Therefore, in that way, if the four noble truths exist, then the Dharma is established.

original: rang byung gi ye shes kyis de rnams thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i phyir nyan thos la bstan pa dang rjes su mthun pas sangs rgyas kyang 'grub ste zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rang byung gi ye shes kyis de rnams thams cad du thugs su chud pa'i phyir nyan thos la bstan pa dang rjes su mthun pas sangs rgyas kyang 'grub ste zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: And because the self-arisen gnosis comprehends all of those, then the Buddha is also established because it is in accordance with the teaching to the śrāvakas.

original: de nyid kyi khungs nyan thos la grags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs nyan thos la grags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of that, which is renowned to the śrāvakas, he says:

original: ji skad du dge slong dag ngas sngon 'di ni sdug bsngal lo zhes rjes su ma thos pa dag ni mig dang / shes pa dang / shes rab dang / blo skyes so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji skad du dge slong dag ngas sngon 'di ni sdug bsngal lo zhes rjes su ma thos pa dag ni mig dang / shes pa dang / shes rab dang / blo skyes so zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: “Monks, I have not heard before, ‘This is suffering,’ and so on, and the eye of wisdom, knowledge, insight, and understanding arose.”

original: bden pa bzhi char la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi char la yang de bzhin du ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all four noble truths.

original: da ni theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis bden pa bzhi la sogs pa ji ltar rung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis bden pa bzhi la sogs pa ji ltar rung bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate how the four noble truths and so on are tenable according to the Mahāyāna, he says:

original: de bzhin du don dam par dngos po sgyu ma lta bu'i ngo bo nyid dag skye ba med pa la sogs par mthong ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong ba yin te zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par dngos po sgyu ma lta bu'i ngo bo nyid dag skye ba med pa la sogs par mthong ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa mthong ba yin te zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: “In the same way, seeing that ultimately things, which are like illusions, are unborn and so on is seeing the noble truths.”

original: de nyid kyi khungs theg pa chen po las grags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs theg pa chen po las grags pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of that, which is renowned in the Mahāyāna, he says:

original: ji skad du 'jam dpal gang gis chos thams cad skye ba med par mthong ba des sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //
analyzed: ji skad du 'jam dpal gang gis chos thams cad skye ba med par mthong ba des sdug bsngal yongs su shes so //
translated: Manjushri, whoever sees all phenomena as unproduced has thoroughly known suffering.

original: gang gis chos thams cad mi gnas par mthong ba des kun 'byung spangs so //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad mi gnas par mthong ba des kun 'byung spangs so //
translated: Whoever sees all phenomena as non-abiding has abandoned the origin.

original: gang gis chos thams cad gtan du mya ngan las 'das par mthong ba des 'gog pa mngon sum du byas so //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad gtan du mya ngan las 'das par mthong ba des 'gog pa mngon sum du byas so //
translated: Whoever sees all phenomena as utterly beyond suffering has actualized cessation.

original: 'jam dpal gang gis chos thams cad bsgom du med par mthong ba des lam bsgoms so zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gang gis chos thams cad bsgom du med par mthong ba des lam bsgoms so zhes gsungs pa lta bu ste zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Manjushri, whoever sees all phenomena as not to be cultivated has cultivated the path.

original: 'phags pa ye shes gsangs ba bsgom du bcug pa'i mdo las de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ye shes gsangs ba bsgom du bcug pa'i mdo las de skad gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the Arya-jnanalokalankara-sutra.

original: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa grub na /🔽chos dang @240a * //
analyzed: theg pa chen po'i tshul gyis kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa grub na / chos dang @240a * //
translated: If the four noble truths are established by the Mahayana,🔽then all phenomena and all buddhas are established.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyang 'grub pas thams cad rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyang 'grub pas thams cad rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion.

original: da ni rang gi sde pa la sogs pa stong pa nyid ma yin par smar ba gang dag dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mthar lhung ba dag la 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa thams cad mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /🔽stong pa nyid ma yin par smra ba /
analyzed: da ni rang gi sde pa la sogs pa stong pa nyid ma yin par smar ba gang dag dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i mthar lhung ba dag la 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa thams cad mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir / stong pa nyid ma yin par smra ba /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate to those of our own Buddhist schools who do not accept emptiness that all of the noble truths and so forth are untenable for those who fall to the extremes of existence and nonexistence,🔽it is said:

original: gang la stong nyid mi rung ba //
analyzed: gang la stong nyid mi rung ba //
translated: For those to whom emptiness makes no sense,

original: de la thams cad mi rung 'gyur //
analyzed: de la thams cad mi rung 'gyur //
translated: nothing makes any sense.

original: gang stong pa nyid ma yin par smra ba la ji skad bstan pa thams cad mi rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gang stong pa nyid ma yin par smra ba la ji skad bstan pa thams cad mi rung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: For those to whom emptiness makes no sense, all of the above explanations make no sense.

original: da ni rang gi sde pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mi 'dod pa rnams la 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa thams cad mi rung bar 'gyur ba'i skyon rang la yod pa rnams dbu ma pa la yongs su sgyur bar byed pa
analyzed: da ni rang gi sde pa dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mi 'dod pa rnams la 'phags pa'i bden pa la sogs pa thams cad mi rung bar 'gyur ba'i skyon rang la yod pa rnams dbu ma pa la yongs su sgyur bar byed pa
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the unreasonableness of the way in which those of our own Buddhist schools who do not accept that things are essenceless attribute to the Madhyamikas the fault that all of the noble truths and so forth are untenable,🔽it is said:

original: mi rigs pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rigs pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not right for you to attribute

original: khyod nyid rang gi skyon rnams ni //
analyzed: khyod nyid rang gi skyon rnams ni //
translated: to us the faults that you yourself have.

original: nga la yongs su sgyur byed pa//🔽rta la mngon par zhon bzhin du //
analyzed: nga la yongs su sgyur byed pa// rta la mngon par zhon bzhin du //
translated: You attribute to me🔽what is your own fault,🔽just like someone who has mounted a horse

original: rta nyid brjed par gyur pa bzhin //
analyzed: rta nyid brjed par gyur pa bzhin //
translated: and forgotten that very horse.🔽You attribute to me those faults that are your own, just like someone who has mounted a horse and forgotten that very horse.

original: khyod nyid rang gi skyon gang dag yin pa de dag kho bo la yongs su sgyur bar byed pa ni dper na rta la mngon par zhon bzhin du rta de nyid brjed par gyur pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: khyod nyid rang gi skyon gang dag yin pa de dag kho bo la yongs su sgyur bar byed pa ni dper na rta la mngon par zhon bzhin du rta de nyid brjed par gyur pa bzhin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the logical correctness of the statement,

original: da ni gang la stong nyid mi rung ba //
analyzed: da ni gang la stong nyid mi rung ba //
translated: “For whom emptiness is not possible,

original: de la thams cad mi rung 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la thams cad mi rung 'gyur // zhes bya ba de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: everything is not possible,”

original: ji ltar stong pa nyid mi 'dod pa la thams cad mi 'thad pa de ltar 'di bshad par bya ste /🔽gal te dngos rnams dngos nyid las //
analyzed: ji ltar stong pa nyid mi 'dod pa la thams cad mi 'thad pa de ltar 'di bshad par bya ste / gal te dngos rnams dngos nyid las //
translated: it should be explained how, for one who does not assert emptiness, everything is not tenable.🔽If you view things as existing

original: yod par rjes su lta byed na //🔽de lta yin na dngos po rnams //
analyzed: yod par rjes su lta byed na // de lta yin na dngos po rnams //
translated: through their own intrinsic reality,🔽then for you, things would

original: rgyu rkyen med par khyed la'o //
analyzed: rgyu rkyen med par khyed la'o //
translated: lack causes and conditions.

original: ngo bo nyid las yod pa ni rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las yod pa ni rgyu dang rkyen la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The meaning is that it would not depend on causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen med par lta ba de'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /🔽'bras bu dang ni rgyu nyid dang // byed pa po dang byed dang bya //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen med par lta ba de'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir / 'bras bu dang ni rgyu nyid dang // byed pa po dang byed dang bya //
translated: In order to demonstrate the way in which that view is untenable, he says:🔽The effect, the cause, the agent, the instrument,🔽The object, the result, and the time,

original: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang // 'bras bu la yang gnod pa byed //
analyzed: skye ba dang ni 'gag pa dang // 'bras bu la yang gnod pa byed //
translated: The effect, the cause, the agent, the instrument, the object, the result, and the time,🔽are all undermined.

original: rgyu dang rkyen la ma ltos par 'bras bu la sogs pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen la ma ltos par 'bras bu la sogs pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The meaning is that the effect and so forth are not established without depending on causes and conditions.

original: da ni pha rol po dag stong pa nyid kyi don yongs su brtags nas /
analyzed: da ni pha rol po dag stong pa nyid kyi don yongs su brtags nas /
translated: Now, having examined the meaning of emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid des skrag ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid des skrag ste /
translated: the opponent is frightened by emptiness.

original: de mi rung ngo zhes skyon 'dogs shing spong bar byed pa'i stong pa nyid de gang @240b yin pa de brtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de mi rung ngo zhes skyon 'dogs shing spong bar byed pa'i stong pa nyid de gang @240b yin pa de brtag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to examine that emptiness which is rejected with the claim that it is untenable, he says:

original: khyod re zhig stong pa nyid kyi don yongs su brtags nas /
analyzed: khyod re zhig stong pa nyid kyi don yongs su brtags nas /
translated: First, having examined the meaning of emptiness,

original: byis pa gnod sbyin gyi gzugs 'jigs su rung ba mngon par bris nas skrag ste /
analyzed: byis pa gnod sbyin gyi gzugs 'jigs su rung ba mngon par bris nas skrag ste /
translated: It is like a child who, having seen a terrifying demon drawn in a picture, cries out in fear, saying, There is a demon!

original: 'jigs pa'i sgra 'byin par byed pa lta bu de gang yin zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'jigs pa'i sgra 'byin par byed pa lta bu de gang yin zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: What is that?

original: stong pa nyid de'i don rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ngo bo nyid med cing stong pa sgyu ma lta bu la bya grang na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid de'i don rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ngo bo nyid med cing stong pa sgyu ma lta bu la bya grang na /
translated: If the meaning of emptiness is dependent origination, which is essenceless and empty like an illusion,

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: then

original: de la skrag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la skrag par mi bya'o //
translated: one should not be afraid of it.🔽In order to teach this,

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it says,

original: gal te de'i don gzugs dngos po med cing stong pa sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid lta bu yin na ni skrag pa thong shig ces bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gal te de'i don gzugs dngos po med cing stong pa sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid lta bu yin na ni skrag pa thong shig ces bya ba smras so //
translated: If the meaning of that is that form is essenceless and empty, like the nature of an illusion, then give up your fear.

original: de la ji ltar skrag par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar skrag par mi bya zhe na /
translated: How should one not be afraid of it?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin pas /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni ngo bo nyid stong pa yin pas /
translated: Since dependent origination is empty of essence,

original: de skrag pa'i gnas ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de skrag pa'i gnas ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that it is not a basis for fear,🔽it says,

original: 'di ltar / rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'di ltar / rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is dependently originated

original: de nyid stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de nyid stong pa nyid du bshad //
translated: That is explained to be emptiness.

original: mig dang myu gu la sogs pa //
analyzed: mig dang myu gu la sogs pa //
translated: Eyes, sprouts, and so on🔽Things such as eyes and sprouts do not exist in their causes, such as the eyes’ causes, the semen and ovum, and the sprout’s cause, the seed, and so on, in terms of their own entities, whether as existent or nonexistent, as the same or different, or as both.

original: dngos po rgyu dang sa bon la sogs pa rkyen rnams la rang gi dngos po yod pa dang med pa dang / gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa dang / gnyis kar yod pa ma yin pa ni don dam par rkyen rnams las rten cing 'brel par ngo bo nyid kyis 'byung ba med ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po rgyu dang sa bon la sogs pa rkyen rnams la rang gi dngos po yod pa dang med pa dang / gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa dang / gnyis kar yod pa ma yin pa ni don dam par rkyen rnams las rten cing 'brel par ngo bo nyid kyis 'byung ba med ces bya ba smras te /
translated: In terms of the ultimate, it is said that things do not arise inherently in dependence on conditions.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen rnams la brten nas ;
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba gang yin pa de ni kun rdzob tu rgyu dang rkyen rnams la brten nas ;
translated: That which is dependently arisen arises in dependence on causes and conditions in the conventional.

original: sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid tsam du 'byung bas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen rnams la 'byung ba yang med pa de ni skrag pa'i gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid tsam du 'byung bas ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir rgyu dang rkyen rnams la 'byung ba yang med pa de ni skrag pa'i gnas ma yin te /
translated: Since it arises merely as an illusion, it is devoid of inherent nature. Therefore, it is not the case that it arises from causes and conditions. That is not a basis for fear.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it was said:

original: 'gro ba gnas ma yin la skrag pa gdung byed pa //
analyzed: 'gro ba gnas ma yin la skrag pa gdung byed pa //
translated: The world is not a basis for fear, but it frightens the fearful.

original: rigs med grogs ngan dge sngon ma bstsags blo ma sbyangs //
analyzed: rigs med grogs ngan dge sngon ma bstsags blo ma sbyangs //
translated: Lacking potential, with bad friends, not having previously accumulated virtue, and not having trained the mind,

original: bsod nams ma yin phung po cher 'phel yun ring du //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin phung po cher 'phel yun ring du //
translated: and the mass of demerit increases for a long time.

original: chos 'di la ni skrag 'gyur don chen 'di las ltung zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //🔽mig la sogs pa'i skye ba ni tha snyad kyi bden pa la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid tsam du skye ba'i tshul bstan te //
analyzed: chos 'di la ni skrag 'gyur don chen 'di las ltung zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // mig la sogs pa'i skye ba ni tha snyad kyi bden pa la brten pa yin no zhes bya ba ni kun rdzob tu sgyu ma'i mtshan nyid tsam du skye ba'i tshul bstan te //
translated: “ Frightened by this teaching, they fall from the great goal.”

original: de yang skrag pa'i gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang skrag pa'i gnas ma yin no //
translated: The arising of eye, etc. is based on conventional truth. This shows the way of arising as mere illusion in the relative, and that is not a basis for fear.

original: de stong pa nyid du bshad pa ni ngo bo nyid sdang bral pa'i phyir te zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de stong pa nyid du bshad pa ni ngo bo nyid sdang bral pa'i phyir te zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The explanation of that as emptiness is because of the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen

original: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
translated: is explained as emptiness.

original: ces bya bas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bden pa gnyis kyi tshul du rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de stong pa nyid du bshad @241a * //
analyzed: ces bya bas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bden pa gnyis kyi tshul du rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de stong pa nyid du bshad @241a * //
translated: This shows that whatever is established as dependent arising in the mode of the two truths is explained as emptiness.

original: pa ni rkyen gzhan la brten te byung bas bden pa gnyi ga'i tshul du yang ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: pa ni rkyen gzhan la brten te byung bas bden pa gnyi ga'i tshul du yang ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it arises in dependence on other conditions, it is devoid of essence in the manner of both truths. Therefore, it is the emptiness of essence.

original: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the source of that,

original: 'phags pa klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: 'phags pa klu'i rgyal po ma dros pas zhus pa'i mdo las /
translated: it says in the sutra requested by the noble Naga King Anavatapta:

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: It says:

original: gang zhig rkyen las skye ba de ma skyes //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen las skye ba de ma skyes //
translated: That which arises from conditions does not arise.

original: de la ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med //🔽gang zhig rkyen la ltos pa de stong gsum //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med // gang zhig rkyen la ltos pa de stong gsum //
translated: It does not arise inherently.🔽That which depends on conditions is empty.

original: gang gis stong nyid shes de bag yod yin //
analyzed: gang gis stong nyid shes de bag yod yin //
translated: One who knows emptiness is heedful.

original: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du 'phags pa lang kar gshegs pa'i mdo las /
translated: And similarly, the noble Sutra on Entering Lanka says:

original: blo gros chen po ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa la dgongs nas chos thams cad stong par bshad do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: blo gros chen po ngo bo nyid kyis skye ba med pa la dgongs nas chos thams cad stong par bshad do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: “Mahamati, intending that they do not arise inherently, I have explained that all phenomena are empty.”

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa //
translated: Whatever is dependently arisen

original: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid du bshad //
translated: That is explained as emptiness.

original: ces bya ba de nyid kun rdzob tu nye bar len pa dag la brten nas gdags par bya ba dang / de nyid kyi bden pa gnyis gang ngo bo nyid med pas dbu ma'i lam yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba de nyid kun rdzob tu nye bar len pa dag la brten nas gdags par bya ba dang / de nyid kyi bden pa gnyis gang ngo bo nyid med pas dbu ma'i lam yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very dependent origination is to be imputed in dependence upon the appropriated aggregates in the relative and that it is the middle path because it is devoid of essence in both truths,🔽it is said:

original: de ni brten nas gdags pa ste //
analyzed: de ni brten nas gdags pa ste //
translated: That is dependent imputation.

original: de ni dbu ma'i lam yin no //🔽zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de ni dbu ma'i lam yin no // zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: That is the middle path.

original: brten nas gdags pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brten nas gdags pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the mode of dependent imputation,🔽it is said:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni brten nas gdags pa ste zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba stong pa nyid gang yin pa de ni brten nas gdags pa ste zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: That which is called dependent origination is emptiness. That is dependent imputation.

original: brten nas gdags pa de yang kun rdzob tu 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pas rang rang gi nye bar len pa dag la brten nas gdags pa yin pas ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brten nas gdags pa de yang kun rdzob tu 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pas rang rang gi nye bar len pa dag la brten nas gdags pa yin pas ngo bo nyid med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: That dependent imputation is also imputed in dependence upon their respective appropriated aggregates because it is conventionally designated as mundane and supramundane conventions in the relative. In order to demonstrate that it is devoid of essence,🔽it is said:

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tha snyad 'dod pas nye bar len pa dag la brten nas gdags pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tha snyad 'dod pas nye bar len pa dag la brten nas gdags pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because they assert mundane and transcendent conventions, they say that things are imputed in dependence on the appropriated aggregates.

original: dngos po gang dag brten nas gdags par bya ba mig dang / myu gu dang / bum pa dang / snam bu dang / so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa de dag ni so so'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang rkyen mig ni mer mer po la sogs pa dag la brten nas gdags /
analyzed: dngos po gang dag brten nas gdags par bya ba mig dang / myu gu dang / bum pa dang / snam bu dang / so so'i skye bo dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa de dag ni so so'i nye bar len pa'i rgyu dang rkyen mig ni mer mer po la sogs pa dag la brten nas gdags /
translated: Those things that are imputed in dependence on the appropriated aggregates—the eyes, sprouts, pots, cloth, ordinary beings, sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, tathagatas, and so on—are imputed in dependence on the causes and conditions of their respective appropriations. The eyes are imputed in dependence on the kalala and so on.

original: myu gu ni sa bon la sogs pa /🔽bum pa ni 'jim pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: myu gu ni sa bon la sogs pa / bum pa ni 'jim pa la sogs pa /
translated: Sprouts are imputed in dependence on seeds.🔽Pots are imputed in dependence on clay.

original: snam bu ni rgyu spun la sogs pa /
analyzed: snam bu ni rgyu spun la sogs pa /
translated: Cloth is imputed in dependence on thread.

original: so so'i skye bo ni @241b las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo ni @241b las dang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa /
translated: Ordinary beings are imputed in dependence on karma and afflictions.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas ni tshogs kyi lam dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas ni tshogs kyi lam dang / nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spong ba la sogs pa byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa ni sa dang pha rol tu phyin pa dang / stobs dang mi 'jigs pa dang /
translated: the strengths, fearlessnesses,🔽unique qualities and so forth and the tathagatas on the levels, transcendent perfections, strengths, fearlessnesses,🔽unique qualities and so on.

original: ma 'dres pa la sogs pa dag la brten nas gdags pa yin pas 'jig rten pa'i mig dang / myu gu dang / bum pa dang / snam bu dang / so so'i skye bo la sogs pa dag kyang ngo bo nyid med pas stong pa nyid du bshad la /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa la sogs pa dag la brten nas gdags pa yin pas 'jig rten pa'i mig dang / myu gu dang / bum pa dang / snam bu dang / so so'i skye bo la sogs pa dag kyang ngo bo nyid med pas stong pa nyid du bshad la /
translated: So the mundane eye, the sprout, the pot, the cloth, ordinary beings and so on are also explained as being empty of inherent existence.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa bden pa gzigs pa rnams kyang ngo bo nyid med pas stong pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la sogs pa bden pa gzigs pa rnams kyang ngo bo nyid med pas stong pa nyid du bshad do //
translated: And the supramundane, the listeners, solitary realizers, bodhisattvas and tathagatas who have seen the truth are also explained as being empty of inherent existence.

original: don dam par ni de dag rkyen rnams las kyang rnam pa thams cad du skye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par ni de dag rkyen rnams las kyang rnam pa thams cad du skye ba med pa'i phyir /

analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pas stong pa nyid du bshad do //

analyzed: de nyid dbu ma'i lam yin pa'i tshul bstan pa'i phyir /

translated: If you apply it because you are smeared with the mud of conceptualization, then your application is dependent.🔽If you were to attach a crest jewel to someone’s foot, the wise would not be offended, but they would say, “The one who attaches it is attaching it in the wrong place.”

original: 'on kyang 'dogs par byed pa de gnas ma yin par 'dogs par byed do zhes mkhas pa rnams kyis khrel bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du khyod de skad smra bas kyang tshigs su bcad pa 'di la ni gnod pa med mod kyi 'on kyang khyod kyi 'dod pa'i🔽don 'grub par mi 'gyur te /
