translated: In the same way, although you have not damaged this verse, you have not established the point you wanted to prove by saying this.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba yin par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya @242b ba smras te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba yin par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya @242b ba smras te /
translated: Because it is not established that dependent origination does not occur if intrinsic reality exists.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ngo bo nyid yod pa dang 'brel par mi 'grub pa'i phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa 'di'i don log par ma 'dren cig ces bstan to //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ngo bo nyid yod pa dang 'brel par mi 'grub pa'i phyir slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis mdzad pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa 'di'i don log par ma 'dren cig ces bstan to //
translated: Because it is not established that dependent origination is related to intrinsic reality, do not misinterpret the meaning of this treatise composed by the master.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /🔽gang phyir rten 'byung ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / gang phyir rten 'byung ma yin pa'i //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:🔽Because no phenomenon

original: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin pa //🔽de phyir stong pa ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin pa // de phyir stong pa ma yin pa'i //
translated: Exists that is not dependently arisen,🔽No phenomenon exists

original: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not empty.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because dependent origination is devoid of intrinsic reality, like an illusory person.

original: nang dang phyi rol dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol dang / 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos thams cad ni ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: All phenomena, whether inner or outer, mundane or supramundane, are devoid of essence.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i phyir dper na sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that all phenomena, internal and external, mundane and transcendent, are essenceless because they are dependently arisen, like, for example, an illusory person.🔽If you say that since space and so on are not dependently arisen, the reason is faulty because it is not established in part of the similar class,

original: gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin pa dag la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'thun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin pa dag la rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs 'thun pa'i phyogs kyi phyogs gcig la ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod do zhe na zhes bya ba ni
translated: the opponent might say,

original: pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pas /🔽gang phyir rten 'byung ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: pha rol po dag na re dbu ma pas / gang phyir rten 'byung ma yin pa'i //
translated: “The Madhyamikas say:🔽Because there are no phenomena

original: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin pa /🔽de phyir stong pa ma yin pa'i //
analyzed: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin pa / de phyir stong pa ma yin pa'i //
translated: That are not dependently arisen,

original: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: chos 'ga' yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There are no phenomena🔽That are not empty.

original: zhes bya bas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa'i gtan tshigs rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba de ma khyab pa yin te /🔽'di na nam mkha' la sogs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin pa dag la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir khyod kyi gtan tshigs rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba de gzugs la sogs pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs nam mkha' la
analyzed: zhes bya bas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni sgyu ma'i skyes bu bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa'i gtan tshigs rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba de ma khyab pa yin te / 'di na nam mkha' la sogs pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin pa dag la rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba med pa'i phyir khyod kyi gtan tshigs rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba de gzugs la sogs pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs nam mkha' la
translated: This passage explains that dependent origination lacks intrinsic reality because it is like an illusory person.🔽The reason “because it is dependent origination” is not included in the subject, because space and so on are not dependent origination.

original: sogs pa'i phyogs gcig la ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: sogs pa'i phyogs gcig la ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon yod pas mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The reason “because it is dependent origination” is not established in the similar class, space and so on, because it is not established in one part of the similar class.

original: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to this, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni lan btab zin pa'i phyir klan kar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ni lan btab zin pa'i phyir klan kar mi rung ngo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is not a proper objection because it has already been answered.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la ma khyab kyang gtan tshigs su rung ba dper na sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la ma khyab kyang gtan tshigs su rung ba dper na sgra ni mi rtag ste /
translated: Although the reason is not pervaded by the concordant side, it is still suitable as a reason. For example, sound is impermanent

original: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de /
translated: because it arises as soon as it is sought.

original: glog dang nags kyi me tog dag la ma khyab kyang sgra mi rtag pa'i gtan tshigs su rung bas skyon med do zhes lan btab zin pa'i phyir klan kar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: glog dang nags kyi me tog dag la ma khyab kyang sgra mi rtag pa'i gtan tshigs su rung bas skyon med do zhes lan btab zin pa'i phyir klan kar mi rung ngo //
translated: Although that reason is not pervaded by lightning and fireflies, it is still suitable as a reason for the impermanence of sound. Therefore it is not suitable to be criticized.

original: de'i phyir don dam par dngos @243a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par dngos @243a * //
translated: Therefore, ultimately,

original: po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /🔽'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i rjes su 'gro ba yang med la mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la mthong ba'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad
analyzed: po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te / 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i rjes su 'gro ba yang med la mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la mthong ba'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang tshad
translated: things do exist by their own intrinsic reality.🔽Because they possess the attributes of origination and destruction.

original: ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: The response to that is that the reason is not only seen in the discordant side, but it is also contradictory because it is not concomitant with the predicate. This is the conclusion and the result of the argument.

original: pha rol pos smras pa'i gtan tshigs de la don dam par dpe med pas ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: pha rol pos smras pa'i gtan tshigs de la don dam par dpe med pas ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: The reason stated by the opponent is not established, because ultimately there is no example.

original: kun rdzob tu don dam pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la mthong ba'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub po//
analyzed: kun rdzob tu don dam pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la mthong ba'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma grub po//
translated: And it is contradictory because it is seen only in the ultimate, which is the opposite of the conventional. Therefore, things are not established as having intrinsic reality.

original: da ni de ltar rjes su dpag pas don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bstan du zin kyang rang gi sde pa dag gis de ma bzod cing dngos por lta na /
analyzed: da ni de ltar rjes su dpag pas don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid bstan du zin kyang rang gi sde pa dag gis de ma bzod cing dngos por lta na /
translated: Now, although the absence of intrinsic reality of things in the ultimate has been taught by means of inference, if those of our own Buddhist sect cannot bear that and view things as having intrinsic reality,

original: de dag la gsor mi rung ba'i gnod pa chen po 'di lta bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes sngar pha rol pos dbu ma pa la tshur skyon btags pa de dag thams cad skyed dang bcas te phyir dbul ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag la gsor mi rung ba'i gnod pa chen po 'di lta bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes sngar pha rol pos dbu ma pa la tshur skyon btags pa de dag thams cad skyed dang bcas te phyir dbul ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: then the following great incurable harm will befall them. In order to show that all the faults that the opponent previously ascribed to the Madhyamaka are in fact generated by the opponent himself, the root text says:

original: ji ste rjes su dpag pas bstan du zin kyang rjes su dpag pa'i mthus dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mi bzod na /
analyzed: ji ste rjes su dpag pas bstan du zin kyang rjes su dpag pa'i mthus dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mi bzod na /
translated: If, despite being taught by way of inference, you still cannot accept that things are essenceless by the power of inference,

original: de lta na khyod la gsor mi rung ba'i gnod pa chen po 'di lta bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na khyod la gsor mi rung ba'i gnod pa chen po 'di lta bu dag 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: then this great incurable harm will come to you.

original: ji ltar zhe na ;
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na ;
translated: How so?

original: gal te 'di kun mi stong na //
analyzed: gal te 'di kun mi stong na //
translated: If all these were not empty,

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //🔽'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med // 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi po rnams //
translated: There would be neither arising nor ceasing.🔽It follows that for you

original: khyod la med par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: khyod la med par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: The four noble truths would not exist.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus he says.

original: re zhig de nyid bden pa bzhi po rnams med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba spyir bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de nyid bden pa bzhi po rnams med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba spyir bstan to //
translated: First, he generally teaches the error that the four noble truths would not exist.

original: da ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: da ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Now, in order to teach the error that the truth of suffering would not exist, he says, “How so?”

original: gal te sdug bsngal mi stong bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal mi stong bar gyur na /
translated: If suffering were not empty,

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir de rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir de rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Because the characteristic of an existent is not fabricated, it would not be dependently arisen.

original: gang de lta bur gyur pa de ni tha snyad du yang yod par shes par mi nus na don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: gang de lta bur gyur pa de ni tha snyad du yang yod par shes par mi nus na don dam par lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: That which is like that cannot be known to exist even conventionally, so what need is there to mention its ultimate existence?

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /🔽rten cing 'brel 'byung ma yin na //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa / rten cing 'brel 'byung ma yin na //
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽How could suffering exist

original: sdug bsngal yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: If it were not dependently arisen?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa la mi rtag pa nyid med pas sdug bsngal nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ma yin pa la mi rtag pa nyid med pas sdug bsngal nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Since that which is not dependently arisen is not impermanent, it is untenable that it is suffering. This is the intended meaning.

original: de nyid @243b kyi phyir bshad pa /🔽mi rtag sdug bsngal gsungs pa de //🔽ngo bo nyid la yod ma yin //
analyzed: de nyid @243b kyi phyir bshad pa / mi rtag sdug bsngal gsungs pa de // ngo bo nyid la yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽The statement that the impermanent🔽Is suffering does not apply to that which exists essentially.

original: mdo sde las gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa de ngo bo nyid yod pa la med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: mdo sde las gang mi rtag pa de sdug bsngal lo zhes gsungs pa de ngo bo nyid yod pa la med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The statement in the sutra that whatever is impermanent is suffering does not apply to that which exists essentially.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the error of the non-existence of the truth of the all-India origin of suffering,🔽he says:🔽When suffering exists inherently,

original: gang gi tshe de ltar sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid las yod pa yin pa de'i tshe /🔽ngo bo nyid las yod min na //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid las yod pa yin pa de'i tshe / ngo bo nyid las yod min na //
translated: then🔽what all-origin

original: ji zhig kun du 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji zhig kun du 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: would there be?

original: kun 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: kun 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that it would not all-originate.

original: dper na ji 'phags pa rdzun gsung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ji 'phags pa rdzun gsung bar 'gyur ram zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like saying, “Would the noble one tell a lie?”

original: de phyir stong nyid gnod byed la //
analyzed: de phyir stong nyid gnod byed la //
translated: Therefore, since emptiness is not refuted,

original: kun 'byung yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the all-India origin of suffering does not exist.

original: ngo bo nyid yod pa ni rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod pa ni rgyu la mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because that which exists inherently does not depend on causes.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the error of the non-existence of the truth of the cessation of suffering,🔽he says:

original: gzhan yang sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid yod la //
analyzed: gzhan yang sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid yod la //
translated: Moreover, if suffering existed inherently,

original: 'gog pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: cessation would not exist.

original: ngo bo nyid ni yongs gnas phyir //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni yongs gnas phyir //
translated: Because an essence would remain

original: 'gog pa gnod pa byed pa yin //
analyzed: 'gog pa gnod pa byed pa yin //
translated: cessation would be refuted.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis byas pa ma yin par gnas pa la 'gog pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis byas pa ma yin par gnas pa la 'gog pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because it is untenable to refute that which is not intrinsically produced.

original: lam gyi bden pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the error of the nonexistence of the truth of the path,🔽he says,

original: de bzhin du lam ni ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: de bzhin du lam ni ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: Similarly, if the path existed intrinsically,

original: bsgom pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsgom pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: cultivation would be untenable.

original: bsgom pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa yang dang yang du bskyed par bya ba yin na lam ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub pa la skye ba mi 'thad pas bsgom pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bsgom pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba la sogs pa yang dang yang du bskyed par bya ba yin na lam ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su grub pa la skye ba mi 'thad pas bsgom pa 'thad par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Cultivation is the repeated generation of right view and so on, but if the path were intrinsically real, it would be untenable to cultivate it, since its arising would be untenable.

original: bden pa bzhi med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba de dag mi 'dod na ni ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma 'dzin cig ces bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bden pa bzhi med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba de dag mi 'dod na ni ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du ma 'dzin cig ces bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that if one does not accept the error of the nonexistence of the four truths, one should not grasp them as having intrinsic reality,🔽he says,🔽Those who wish to completely avoid the errors

original: ji skad bstan pa'i skyon yongs su spong bar 'dod pas /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i skyon yongs su spong bar 'dod pas /
translated: as they have been presented

original: ji ste lam de bsgom bya na //
analyzed: ji ste lam de bsgom bya na //
translated: should not cultivate the path.

original: khyod kyi dngos nyid yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyod kyi dngos nyid yod ma yin //
translated: Your intrinsic reality does not exist.

original: skye ba yod na bsgom pa rab tu 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba yod na bsgom pa rab tu 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if arising existed, meditation would be fully accomplished.

original: skye ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: skye ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Arising does not occur if intrinsic reality does not exist.

original: de ltar bden pa bzhi med na lam gyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bden pa bzhi med na lam gyis mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, if the four noble truths do not exist, the error of attaining nirvana through the path would occur.

original: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: In this way, as it has been taught,🔽If the origin of suffering and

original: gang tshe sdug bsngal kun 'byung dang // 'gog pa yod pa ma yin @244a * //🔽na ; / lam gyi sdug bsngal 'gog pa ni //
analyzed: gang tshe sdug bsngal kun 'byung dang // 'gog pa yod pa ma yin @244a * // na ; / lam gyi sdug bsngal 'gog pa ni //
translated: cessation do not exist,🔽What path do you assert

original: gang zhig thob par 'gyur bar 'dod //🔽sdug bsngal ma skyes pa la 'gog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gang zhig thob par 'gyur bar 'dod // sdug bsngal ma skyes pa la 'gog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: will attain the cessation of suffering?🔽Because there is no cessation of suffering that has not arisen.🔽Now, in order to demonstrate the error that if suffering is said to exist intrinsically, the thorough knowledge of suffering does not exist,

original: da ni ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba la sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba la sdug bsngal yongs su shes pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says:

original: gzhan yang khyod kyi tshul gyis sdug bsngal /🔽gal te ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyod kyi tshul gyis sdug bsngal / gal te ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
translated: Moreover, according to your system, suffering

original: yongs su shes pa ma yin na //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ma yin na //
translated: If suffering is not intrinsically fully understood,

original: de ni ji ltar yongs shes 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar yongs shes 'gyur //
translated: how could it be fully understood?

original: dngos nyid gnas shes ma yin nam //
analyzed: dngos nyid gnas shes ma yin nam //
translated: Isn’t its intrinsic reality just as it is?

original: gal te sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su shes pa ma yin na de ji ltar yongs su shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su shes pa ma yin na de ji ltar yongs su shes par 'gyur te /
translated: If suffering is not intrinsically fully understood, how could it be fully understood?

original: khyed kyi gzhung las ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur bar gnas pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: khyed kyi gzhung las ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur bar gnas pa yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because in your scriptures you assert that intrinsic reality abides without changing.

original: kun 'byung spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / lam bsgom pa dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun 'byung spang ba dang / 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba dang / lam bsgom pa dang / dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the error that the origin of suffering would not be abandoned, cessation would not be manifested, the path would not be cultivated, and the four fruits of spiritual practice would not exist,🔽he said:

original: de ltar sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su shes pa ma yin na skyon yongs su ma shes pa de'i rgyu sred pa ngo bo nyid kyis ma spangs pa la spangs pa mi 'thad pa dang / sred pa ngo bo nyid kyis ma spang pa la spangs pa mi 'thad pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid kyis yongs su shes pa ma yin na skyon yongs su ma shes pa de'i rgyu sred pa ngo bo nyid kyis ma spangs pa la spangs pa mi 'thad pa dang / sred pa ngo bo nyid kyis ma spang pa la spangs pa mi 'thad pa dang /
translated: As such, if suffering is not thoroughly cognized by its very essence, then the faults of not thoroughly knowing the cause of suffering, craving, which is not abandoned by its very essence, cannot be abandoned.🔽And if craving is not abandoned by its very essence, then the cessation of that which is not abandoned cannot exist, and thus the actualization of cessation is untenable.

original: sred pa ngo bo nyid kyis ma spangs pa la de 'gog pa med pa'i phyir 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba mi 'thad pa dang / 'gog pa med na 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam ngo bo nyid kyis ma bsgoms pa la lam bsgom par mi 'thad pa dang /
analyzed: sred pa ngo bo nyid kyis ma spangs pa la de 'gog pa med pa'i phyir 'gog pa mngon sum du bya ba mi 'thad pa dang / 'gog pa med na 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam ngo bo nyid kyis ma bsgoms pa la lam bsgom par mi 'thad pa dang /
translated: And if cessation does not exist, then the path that leads to cessation, which is not cultivated by its very essence, cannot be cultivated.

original: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi med na dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi dag kyang yongs su shes pa bzhin du mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi med na dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi dag kyang yongs su shes pa bzhin du mi 'thad pas /
translated: And if the four noble truths do not exist, then the four fruits of the spiritual practitioner cannot be thoroughly cognized.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: de bzhin du ni khyod nyid kyis //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni khyod nyid kyis //
translated: You yourself have said

original: spang dang mngon sum bya ba dang // bsgoms dang 'bras bu bzhi dag kyang //
analyzed: spang dang mngon sum bya ba dang // bsgoms dang 'bras bu bzhi dag kyang //
translated: Abandonment, realization,

original: yongs su shes bzhin mi rung ngo //
analyzed: yongs su shes bzhin mi rung ngo //
translated: meditation, and the four fruits would be impossible.🔽Abandonment by its intrinsic reality, realization, and nonmeditation are impossible.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis spang ba dang mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa ma yin pa la de dag mi 'thad pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu mngon sum du ma byas pa la mngon sum du bya ba mi 'thad pas rgyun du zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis spang ba dang mngon sum du bya ba dang / bsgom pa ma yin pa la de dag mi 'thad pa dang / ngo bo nyid kyis 'bras bu mngon sum du ma byas pa la mngon sum du bya ba mi 'thad pas rgyun du zhugs pa dang /
translated: Since the fruit not realized by its intrinsic reality is impossible to realize, the four fruits of stream enterer,

original: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba 'bras bu bzhi po dag mngon sum du bya ba yang yongs su shes pa bzhin du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba dang / dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba 'bras bu bzhi po dag mngon sum du bya ba yang yongs su shes pa bzhin du mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: once-returner, nonreturner, and arhat would be impossible to realize, just like the thorough knowledge.

original: ji ste 'bras bu 'thob par yang 'dod la /
analyzed: ji ste 'bras bu 'thob par yang 'dod la /
translated: If you assert that the fruits are obtained,

original: ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba yang mi gtong na de la brgal @244b zhing brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni de gnyis char 'gyur bas 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis thob pa yin na ni thob par bya ba mi nus la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba yang mi gtong na de la brgal @244b zhing brtag par bya ste zhes bya ba ni de gnyis char 'gyur bas 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis thob pa yin na ni thob par bya ba mi nus la /
translated: If you do not abandon the assertion of intrinsic reality, then you should be open to this objection:🔽Since both of these are possible, if the effect were to be obtained by its intrinsic reality, then it would be impossible to obtain it.

original: ji ste thob par byar nus na ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba gtang bar bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: ji ste thob par byar nus na ni ngo bo nyid du smra ba gtang bar bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: But if it is possible to obtain it, then you should abandon the assertion of intrinsic reality.

original: de'i phyir / ngo bo nyid ni yongs 'dzin pas //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ngo bo nyid ni yongs 'dzin pas //
translated: Therefore:

original: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
translated: If the effect were to be obtained by its intrinsic reality,🔽what effect could be obtained

original: thob pa min pa gang yin te //🔽ji ltar thob par nus par 'gyur //
analyzed: thob pa min pa gang yin te // ji ltar thob par nus par 'gyur //
translated: that is not obtained by its intrinsic reality?🔽If the effect were to be obtained by its intrinsic reality, what effect could be obtained that is not obtained by its intrinsic reality?

original: ngo bo nyid yongs su 'dzin pas 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis ma thob pa gang yin pa de thob par mi nus so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yongs su 'dzin pas 'bras bu ngo bo nyid kyis ma thob pa gang yin pa de thob par mi nus so //
translated: That which is not obtained by its intrinsic reality cannot be obtained.

original: ji ste dngos po ma thob pa yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dbang gis thob par rung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste dngos po ma thob pa yang rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i dbang gis thob par rung ngo zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is possible to obtain an effect that is not obtained,🔽then you should not assert that it is obtained by its intrinsic reality.

original: de lta na ni ma thob pa la thob pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas ngo bo nyid du smra ba gtsang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de lta na ni ma thob pa la thob pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin pas ngo bo nyid du smra ba gtsang bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: But if that is so, since the non-acquisition of the fruit does not have the nature of acquisition, the proponent of intrinsic reality should be purified!

original: da ni de ltar dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi med pas 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi dang / lam la gnas pa bzhi med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de ltar dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi med pas 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi dang / lam la gnas pa bzhi med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the error that the four abiders in the fruit and the four abiders in the path do not exist since the four fruits of the spiritual practitioner do not exist,🔽he says:

original: de'i phyir de lta ba /
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta ba /
translated: Therefore, in that case,

original: 'bras bu med na 'bras gnas med //
analyzed: 'bras bu med na 'bras gnas med //
translated: if the fruit does not exist, the abiders in the fruit do not exist.

original: zhugs pa dag kyang yod ma yin //🔽zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhugs pa dag kyang yod ma yin // zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: And the enterers also do not exist.🔽In order to demonstrate the error that the jewel of the Saṅgha does not exist since they do not exist, he says:

original: de dag med pas dge 'dun dkon mchog med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir des na skyon 'dir yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag med pas dge 'dun dkon mchog med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir des na skyon 'dir yang 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore this error also arises:

original: gal te skyes bu gang zag brgyad //
analyzed: gal te skyes bu gang zag brgyad //
translated: If those eight beings

original: de dag med na dge 'dun med //
analyzed: de dag med na dge 'dun med //
translated: do not exist, the Saṅgha does not exist.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i lam dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas 'thad pa'i skyes bu gtso bo de dag med na dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa la sogs pa'i lam dang 'bras bu'i dbye bas 'thad pa'i skyes bu gtso bo de dag med na dge 'dun dkon mchog kyang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: and since there are no principal persons who are posited by way of the divisions of the paths and fruits of stream-enterer and so forth, the Jewel of the Saṅgha does not exist.

original: des na chos dkon mchog kyang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med na dge 'dun med pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
analyzed: des na chos dkon mchog kyang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med na dge 'dun med pa 'ba' zhig tu yang ma zad de /
translated: In order to demonstrate that thereby the fault of the non-existence of the Jewel of the Dharma also ensues, he says, “Not only is there no Saṅgha when the Āryan Truths do not exist,”

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: but what, then?

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med pa'i phyir /
translated: “Because the Āryan Truths do not exist,

original: dam pa'i chos kyang yod ma yin /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyang yod ma yin /
translated: the excellent Dharma also does not exist.”

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med na lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos kyang yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so ;
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa rnams med na lung dang rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos kyang yod pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras so ;
translated: If the Āryan Truths do not exist, the Dharma which has the nature of scripture and realization also would not exist.

original: / des na sangs rgyas dkon mchog kyang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / des na sangs rgyas dkon mchog kyang med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that thereby the fault of the non-existence of the Jewel of the Buddha also ensues, he says,

original: de ltar // chos dang dge 'dun yod min na //
analyzed: de ltar // chos dang dge 'dun yod min na //
translated: “Thus, when the Dharma and the Saṅgha do not exist,

original: sangs rgyas ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
translated: How could a Buddha exist?

original: sangs rgyas nyid ni chos thugs su chud pa dang / slob ma rtogs par mdzad pas 'grub pa yin na @245a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ni chos thugs su chud pa dang / slob ma rtogs par mdzad pas 'grub pa yin na @245a * //
translated: If Buddhahood is established by the realization of the Dharma and by the realization of disciples,

original: de dag yod pa ma yin na sangs rgyas kyang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de dag yod pa ma yin na sangs rgyas kyang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: if those do not exist, then Buddhahood does not exist.

original: da ni ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid med pa dang yod pa nyid yin par gyur na de gnyi ga la sangs rgyas dkon mchog med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gzhan yang ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid med pa yin nam /
analyzed: da ni ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid med pa dang yod pa nyid yin par gyur na de gnyi ga la sangs rgyas dkon mchog med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir / gzhan yang ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs la sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid med pa yin nam /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that in the position of the proponents of intrinsic reality, if the Bhagavat Buddha has no intrinsic reality or has intrinsic reality, both are erroneous in that there is no Buddha Jewel,🔽it is said:

original: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa yin //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid yod pa yin //
translated: Moreover, in the position of the proponents of intrinsic reality, does the Bhagavat Buddha have no intrinsic reality or does he have intrinsic reality?

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the consequence of that?

original: gal te sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid med par 'dod na ni grub pa la bsgrub pa yin no //🔽gal te sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod na ni de lta na sangs rgyas byang chub la brten nas sangs rgyas pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid med par 'dod na ni grub pa la bsgrub pa yin no // gal te sangs rgyas kyi ngo bo nyid yod par 'dod na ni de lta na sangs rgyas byang chub la brten nas sangs rgyas pa ma yin pas /
translated: If you assert that the Buddha lacks intrinsic reality, then you are proving what is already established.🔽If you assert that the Buddha has intrinsic reality, then in that case the Buddha is not enlightened in dependence on awakening.

original: khyod kyi sangs rgyas byang chub la //
analyzed: khyod kyi sangs rgyas byang chub la //
translated: In that case, it follows that your Buddha

original: ma brten par yang thal bar 'gyur //🔽khyod kyi byang chub sangs rgyas la //
analyzed: ma brten par yang thal bar 'gyur // khyod kyi byang chub sangs rgyas la //
translated: is not dependent on awakening.🔽In that case, it follows that your awakening

original: ma brten par yang thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ma brten par yang thal bar 'gyur //
translated: is not dependent on the Buddha.

original: ngo bo nyid ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The intended meaning is that intrinsic reality is not created.

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the logic of that,

original: des byas pa ma yin pa'i rgyu bstan par bzhed pa nyid kyis bshad pa /🔽khyod kyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: des byas pa ma yin pa'i rgyu bstan par bzhed pa nyid kyis bshad pa / khyod kyi ngo bo nyid kyis ni //
translated: he explains that the cause is not created by that very assertion.

original: sangs rgyas min pa gang yin des //🔽byang chub byang chub spyod pa la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas min pa gang yin des // byang chub byang chub spyod pa la //
translated: By that which is not a Buddha through intrinsic reality,🔽even if one strives at awakening and the conduct of awakening,

original: brtsal kyang byang chub 'thob mi 'gyur //
analyzed: brtsal kyang byang chub 'thob mi 'gyur //
translated: awakening will not be attained.

original: 'ga' yang chos dang chos min pa //
analyzed: 'ga' yang chos dang chos min pa //
translated: No one would ever perform

original: nam yang byed par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: nam yang byed par mi 'gyur te //
translated: Dharma or non-Dharma.

original: mi stong pa la ci zhig bya //
analyzed: mi stong pa la ci zhig bya //
translated: What would be the point of non-emptiness?

original: ngo bo nyid la bya ba med //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la bya ba med //
translated: There is no activity with respect to intrinsic reality.

original: ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma byas pa la byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma byas pa la byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because it is untenable that an existent not made from intrinsic reality is made.🔽If here the Sāṃkhya and others say, “Intrinsic subtle-ness and the nature of non-clarity exist previously, and later conditions make them coarse-ness and clarity,”

original: gal te 'dir grangs can la sogs pa gzhan dag na re ngo bo nyid kyis cha phra ba nyid dang mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid du snga na yod pa phyis bya ba'i rkyen gyi sa rags pa nyid dang gsal ba nyid du byed do zhes zer ba'i phyogs
analyzed: gal te 'dir grangs can la sogs pa gzhan dag na re ngo bo nyid kyis cha phra ba nyid dang mi gsal ba'i bdag nyid du snga na yod pa phyis bya ba'i rkyen gyi sa rags pa nyid dang gsal ba nyid du byed do zhes zer ba'i phyogs
translated: in order to refute that position,

original: dgag pa'i phyir rags pa nyid dang gsal ba nyid du yang mi byed de /
analyzed: dgag pa'i phyir rags pa nyid dang gsal ba nyid du yang mi byed de /
translated: it is said, “Coarse-ness and clarity are also not made,”

original: gnyi ga'i lan kyang btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i lan kyang btab zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because the response to both has already been given.

original: gang dag 'di skad ces khyed cag gang ngo bo nyid las yod pa'i skye ba la sogs pa dgag pa smra zhing ngo bo nyid med pa nyid sgrogs par byed nam byas pa la ngo bo nyid yod pa de'i dpe ji lta bu yin pa brjod par bya
analyzed: gang dag 'di skad ces khyed cag gang ngo bo nyid las yod pa'i skye ba la sogs pa dgag pa smra zhing ngo bo nyid med pa nyid sgrogs par byed nam byas pa la ngo bo nyid yod pa de'i dpe ji lta bu yin pa brjod par bya
translated: Some say: You Proponents of Entitylessness who refute arising from self and so on, you who proclaim that things lack entityness, you must state an example of that which has an entity that is not produced.

original: dgos so zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba dag na re khyed dbu ma pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa ni ma byas @245b pa yin pa'i phyir de la skye ba la sogs pa mi 'thad do zhes kho bo cag🔽la skyon 'dogs shing /🔽ngo bo nyid med pa ni rkyen gzhan gyis byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgos so zhes zer na zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba dag na re khyed dbu ma pa dag ngo bo nyid yod pa ni ma byas @245b pa yin pa'i phyir de la skye ba la sogs pa mi 'thad do zhes kho bo cag la skyon 'dogs shing / ngo bo nyid med pa ni rkyen gzhan gyis byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who propound the existence of entityness say: You Followers of the Middle Way impute faults to us by saying that arising and so on are untenable in that which exists by way of its own entity because it is not produced.

original: de la skye ba la sogs pa yang 'thad do zhes rang gi gzhung sgrub par byed na /
analyzed: de la skye ba la sogs pa yang 'thad do zhes rang gi gzhung sgrub par byed na /
translated: You Followers of the Middle Way then affirm your own position by saying that arising and so on are tenable in that which lacks entityness because it is produced by other conditions.

original: 'o na de lta na ma byas pa la ngo bo nyid yod pa de'i dpe ji lta bu yin par brjod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na ma byas pa la ngo bo nyid yod pa de'i dpe ji lta bu yin par brjod par bya dgos te /
translated: Well then, you must state an example of that which has an entity that is not produced.

original: de ma brjod du zin na tshul gsum pa'i rtags las mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma bstan pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs snga ma dag mi 'grub bo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no /
analyzed: de ma brjod du zin na tshul gsum pa'i rtags las mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa ma bstan pas khyed kyi gtan tshigs snga ma dag mi 'grub bo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no /
translated: If that is not stated, then because the opposite of the discordant side is not shown from the sign having the three modes, your previous reasons are not established.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: kho bos mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su brtags na ni gtan tshigs ldog pa yang brjod par bya dgos na /
analyzed: kho bos mi mthun pa'i phyogs yongs su brtags na ni gtan tshigs ldog pa yang brjod par bya dgos na /
translated: If I were to examine the discordant side, then I would have to state the reversal of the reason.

original: kho bo ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ston pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir 'di la gang dang gang byas pa de dang de ngo bo nyid med par mthong ste /
analyzed: kho bo ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ston pa'i gtan tshigs bstan pa'i phyir 'di la gang dang gang byas pa de dang de ngo bo nyid med par mthong ste /
translated: But I say that because I teach the reason that shows the absence of intrinsic reality, whatever is seen to be produced is seen to be without intrinsic reality.

original: dper na sgyu ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma bzhin no //
translated: For example, like an illusion.

original: de bzhin du nang gi dngos po rnams kyang byas pa yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi dngos po rnams kyang byas pa yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, because internal things are also produced,

original: de dag kyang ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes smra'o //
translated: therefore I say that they also are without intrinsic reality.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na de ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir ma byas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig ngo bo nyid yod par gyur na de ni de las bzlog pa'i phyir ma byas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: If something were to exist due to its own intrinsic reality, then because it would be the opposite of that, it would be a non-produced intrinsic reality.

original: ngo bo nyid yod par smra bas ni 'bad pa chen pos ma byas pa la ngo bo nyid yod de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod par smra bas ni 'bad pa chen pos ma byas pa la ngo bo nyid yod de /
translated: Therefore, those who advocate intrinsic reality must make a great effort to say that the non-produced exists due to its intrinsic reality,🔽and that it is like this.

original: dper na 'di 'dra'o zhes brjod par bya dgos pas de'i phyir de ni phyi na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na 'di 'dra'o zhes brjod par bya dgos pas de'i phyir de ni phyi na'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “That is impossible.”

original: kho bos dngos po thams cad byas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma byas pa la ngo bo nyid yod de //
analyzed: kho bos dngos po thams cad byas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma byas pa la ngo bo nyid yod de //
translated: Because we say that all things are produced, we do not say that the opposite of that, the non-produced, exists due to its intrinsic reality.

original: dper na 'di 'dra'o zhes bya ba zhig yongs su brtags na ni /
analyzed: dper na 'di 'dra'o zhes bya ba zhig yongs su brtags na ni /
translated: If we were to imagine that the non-produced exists due to its intrinsic reality,

original: de las gtan tshigs ldog pa yang brjod par dgos pa zhig na kho bo cag dbu ma pa la dngos po thams cad byas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba la de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma byas pa la ngo bo nyid yod de
analyzed: de las gtan tshigs ldog pa yang brjod par dgos pa zhig na kho bo cag dbu ma pa la dngos po thams cad byas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba la de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma byas pa la ngo bo nyid yod de
translated: then we would have to state a reason that is the opposite of that, but we Followers of the Middle Way do not say that all things are devoid of intrinsic existence because they are produced.

original: / dper na 'di 'dra'o zhes bya ba med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la gtan tshigs rang bzhin gyis mi 'jug pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa'i tshul yang yin la /
analyzed: / dper na 'di 'dra'o zhes bya ba med pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la gtan tshigs rang bzhin gyis mi 'jug pa nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa'i tshul yang yin la /
translated: For example, since there is no such thing as “like this,” the reason does not apply to the absence of a discordant factor. The mode of the reversal of the reason from the discordant factor is also the case.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod par ma brtags pa la gtan tshigs ldog pa yang brjod par bya mi dgos so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod par ma brtags pa la gtan tshigs ldog pa yang brjod par bya mi dgos so //
translated: But when the existence of a discordant factor is not examined, it is not necessary to state the reversal of the reason.

original: kho bo cag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ston pa'i gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med de sgyu ma bzhin no /
analyzed: kho bo cag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ston pa'i gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med de sgyu ma bzhin no /
translated: We teach that because the reason that demonstrates essencelessness is produced, it is essenceless, like an illusion.

original: @246a * // zhes ston pa de las bzlog pa ma byas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod de /
analyzed: @246a * // zhes ston pa de las bzlog pa ma byas pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod de /
translated: Since we do not reverse that, it follows that there is essence.

original: dper na 'di 'dra'o zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni de khyod kyi phyogs yin pas ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba khyed kyis ni 'bad pa chen pos ma byas pa la ngo bo nyid yod de dper na 'di 'dra'o zhes brjod par bya dgos na
analyzed: dper na 'di 'dra'o zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod na ni de khyod kyi phyogs yin pas ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba khyed kyis ni 'bad pa chen pos ma byas pa la ngo bo nyid yod de dper na 'di 'dra'o zhes brjod par bya dgos na
translated: If there were something that could be said to be “like this,” then that would be your position. Therefore, you who advocate that there is essence must make a great effort to state that there is essence, and that it is “like this.”

original: / de lta bu'i rjes su 'gro ba yang khyed la med pas de'i phyir khyed kyi tshig de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: / de lta bu'i rjes su 'gro ba yang khyed la med pas de'i phyir khyed kyi tshig de ni gyi na'o //
translated: Since you do not have such a concomitance, therefore your statement is nonsense.

original: da ni ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba dag gi phyogs la 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dag med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gzhan yang / chos dang chos min rgyus byung ba'i //
analyzed: da ni ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba dag gi phyogs la 'jig rten pa'i 'bras bu yod pa dang / chos dang chos ma yin pa dag med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir / gzhan yang / chos dang chos min rgyus byung ba'i //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the error of the existence of worldly effects and the nonexistence of virtue and vice would ensue in the position of those who advocate the existence of intrinsic reality,🔽Candrakīrti states,🔽Moreover, for you, effects

original: 'bras bu khyod la yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu khyod la yod ma yin //
translated: arising from virtue and vice do not exist.

original: ngo bo nyid las yod pa ni rgyu las mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las yod pa ni rgyu las mi ltos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: That which exists by virtue of intrinsic reality does not depend on a cause.

original: de lta na 'bras bu rgyu med pa las 'byung bar lta bu'i skyon du yang 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /🔽de'i phyir / chos dang chos min med par yang //
analyzed: de lta na 'bras bu rgyu med pa las 'byung bar lta bu'i skyon du yang 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir / de'i phyir / chos dang chos min med par yang //
translated: In order to demonstrate that in that case the error of the view that effects arise without a cause would ensue,🔽Candrakīrti states,🔽Therefore, for you, effects

original: 'bras bu khyod la yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'bras bu khyod la yod par 'gyur //
translated: would exist even without virtue and vice.

original: de lta na 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smra so //
analyzed: de lta na 'jig rten dang bstan bcos dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smra so //
translated: In that case, it would contradict the world and the treatises.

original: ji ste de dag dang 'gal bar 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas /🔽chos dang chos min rgyus byung ba'i //
analyzed: ji ste de dag dang 'gal bar 'gyur na mi rung ngo snyam pas / chos dang chos min rgyus byung ba'i //
translated: If you think it is not suitable to contradict them,🔽then

original: 'bras bu gal te khyod la yod //
analyzed: 'bras bu gal te khyod la yod //
translated: if you have effects

original: chos dang chos min las byung ba'i //
analyzed: chos dang chos min las byung ba'i //
translated: arising from virtue and nonvirtue,

original: 'bras bu ci phyir stong ma yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu ci phyir stong ma yin //
translated: why are the effects🔽arising from virtue and nonvirtue not empty?🔽Because what is arisen is empty, like, for example, an illusory elephant.

original: skyes pa ni stong pa yin pa'i phyir dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i glang po che bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu rgyu las byung bar 'dod na ngo bo nyid stong pa yin par khas blang bar bya dgos so zhes bstan
analyzed: skyes pa ni stong pa yin pa'i phyir dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i glang po che bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bas ni 'bras bu rgyu las byung bar 'dod na ngo bo nyid stong pa yin par khas blang bar bya dgos so zhes bstan
translated: This teaches that if you assert that effects arise from causes, you must accept that they are empty of intrinsic reality.🔽Now, in order to demonstrate that if you assert that intrinsic reality exists, you commit the error of undermining all mundane conventions, he says:

original: to // da ni ngo bo nyid yod par smra na ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad thams cad la yang gnod pa byed pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir de ltar rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la gnod pa byed pa 'ba' zhig du yang ma zad de /
analyzed: to // da ni ngo bo nyid yod par smra na ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad thams cad la yang gnod pa byed pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir de ltar rang gi grub pa'i mtha' la gnod pa byed pa 'ba' zhig du yang ma zad de /
translated: Not only do you undermine your own tenets in this way,

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad ni /
translated: mundane conventions

original: kun la'ang gnod pa byed pa yin //
analyzed: kun la'ang gnod pa byed pa yin //
translated: It also contradicts all conventions.

original: bum pa gyis shig / khang pa rtsigs shig / lhas byin pa dkar mo khrid de shog shig / mchod sbyin glegs bam chings shig / khyab 'jug gyi na s'a lu'i 'bras tshan khar tsang bzhos pa'i ba mar dang zo shig ces bya ba la sogs pa 'jig🔽rten pa'i tha snyad thams cad la yang gnod pa byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bum pa gyis shig / khang pa rtsigs shig / lhas byin pa dkar mo khrid de shog shig / mchod sbyin glegs bam chings shig / khyab 'jug gyi na s'a lu'i 'bras tshan khar tsang bzhos pa'i ba mar dang zo shig ces bya ba la sogs pa 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad thams cad la yang gnod pa byed pa yin te /
translated: It contradicts all mundane conventions, such as “Make a pot,” “Build a house,” “Bring the white cow,” “Bind the sacrificial victim,” and “Eat the rice pudding made with ghee and milk.”

original: bum pa la sogs pa ngo bo nyid las yod pa la @246b bya ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ngo bo nyid las yod pa la @246b bya ba don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: It also contradicts all conventions, because it is purposeless for a pot and so on to exist essentially.

original: da ni ngo bo nyid du smra na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang mi 'grub la bya ba dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po la yang gnod pa byed pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ngo bo nyid du smra na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang mi 'grub la bya ba dang / byed pa dang / byed pa po la yang gnod pa byed pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that if one asserts intrinsic nature, dependent origination is not established and the error of contradicting action, agent, and activity is incurred,🔽it is said:🔽Since dependent origination is not established,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang mi 'grub pas de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yang mi 'grub pas de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: therefore it is said:

original: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa'i //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel 'byung gang yin pa'i //
translated: And whatever is dependently arisen🔽

original: stong pa nyid la'ang gnod pa byed //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la'ang gnod pa byed //
translated: And also to emptiness,🔽Which is dependently arisen.

original: de la gnod pa byed pas na //🔽bya ba ci yang med 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la gnod pa byed pas na // bya ba ci yang med 'gyur zhing /
translated: And by refuting that,🔽All activity would be nonexistent.

original: bya ba rtsom pa 'ang med par 'gyur //
analyzed: bya ba rtsom pa 'ang med par 'gyur //
translated: And the undertaking of activity would be nonexistent.

original: bya ba dang byed pa med na //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa med na //
translated: And if activity and the agent do not exist,

original: stong pa nyid la gnod byed na //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la gnod byed na //
translated: If you refute emptiness,

original: mi byed pa yang byed par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi byed pa yang byed par 'gyur //
translated: Then even non-activity would be activity.

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Thus he says.

original: da ni ngo bo nyid yod par smra na 'gro ba rnams gnas skabs sna tshogs dang bral zhing skye 'gag med par ther zug tu gnas pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni ngo bo nyid yod par smra na 'gro ba rnams gnas skabs sna tshogs dang bral zhing skye 'gag med par ther zug tu gnas pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that if one asserts that entities have intrinsic reality, the error would ensue that migrating beings would be devoid of various states and would be statically unchanging without arising or ceasing,

original: gzhan yang / dngos nyid yod na 'gro ba rnams //
analyzed: gzhan yang / dngos nyid yod na 'gro ba rnams //
translated: he says: Moreover, if entities existed,

original: gnas skabs sna tshogs bral 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gnas skabs sna tshogs bral 'gyur zhing //
translated: Migrating beings would be devoid of various states,

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags dang // ther zug tu yang gnas par 'gyur //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags dang // ther zug tu yang gnas par 'gyur //
translated: And would be unarisen and unceased, And would be statically unchanging.

original: kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / rigs dang / bong tshod la sogs pa'i gnas skabs sna tshogs dang bral zhing rtsig pa la bris pa'i ri mo bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / rigs dang / bong tshod la sogs pa'i gnas skabs sna tshogs dang bral zhing rtsig pa la bris pa'i ri mo bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: It would be devoid of various states such as color, shape, type, size, and so on, and would be like a drawing on a wall.

original: byas pa ma yin pa la 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: byas pa ma yin pa la 'jig pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because that which is not produced does not disintegrate.

original: da ni stong pa nyid mi 'dod pa'i phyogs la thob par bya ba dang / sdug bsngal mthar byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa spang ba dag med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni stong pa nyid mi 'dod pa'i phyogs la thob par bya ba dang / sdug bsngal mthar byed pa dang / nyon mongs pa spang ba dag med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the error that for the position that does not accept emptiness, there would be no attainment, no end to suffering, and no abandonment of afflictions,

original: gal te stong pa yod min na //
analyzed: gal te stong pa yod min na //
translated: If emptiness does not exist,🔽There would be no attainment of what is not attained,

original: ma thob thob bar bya ba dang // sdug bsngal mthar byed las dang ni //
analyzed: ma thob thob bar bya ba dang // sdug bsngal mthar byed las dang ni //
translated: No end to suffering,

original: nyon mongs thams cad spong ba'ang med //
analyzed: nyon mongs thams cad spong ba'ang med //
translated: And no abandonment of any affliction.

original: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i thob par bya ba'i khyad par dang sdug bsngal mthar 'byin par byed pa'i las dang de'i gnyan po dag byar med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i thob par bya ba'i khyad par dang sdug bsngal mthar 'byin par byed pa'i las dang de'i gnyan po dag byar med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Because there would be no difference between mundane and supramundane obtainment, and there would be no function of putting an end to suffering and its antidote.

original: de dag ni glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir de ltar ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir skabs kyi don rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bden pa gnyi ga'i tshul du ngo bo nyid med pa nyid khas blang pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni glags yod pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir de ltar ni mi 'dod pas de'i phyir skabs kyi don rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bden pa gnyi ga'i tshul du ngo bo nyid med pa nyid khas blang pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But since those are words that can be disputed, we do not accept that. Therefore, in order to demonstrate the meaning of the context, the acceptance of dependent origination as the absence of intrinsic reality in the mode of the two truths,

original: de ltar mi 'dod pas de'i phyir ma dad bzhin du yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ngo bo nyid las skye ba med pa sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu lta bu'i bdag nyid du skye ba khas blang @247a * //🔽bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dod pas de'i phyir ma dad bzhin du yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ngo bo nyid las skye ba med pa sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu lta bu'i bdag nyid du skye ba khas blang @247a * //🔽bar bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: we say that since we do not accept that, we must accept dependent origination as the absence of intrinsic reality, arising like an illusion or a mirage, even though we do not believe it.

original: da ni rnal 'byor ba dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba la sogs pa'i skyon gyis rab rib dang bral ba'i blo gros kyi mig can gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mthong ba des 'phags pa'i bden pa
analyzed: da ni rnal 'byor ba dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba la sogs pa'i skyon gyis rab rib dang bral ba'i blo gros kyi mig can gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mthong ba des 'phags pa'i bden pa
translated: Now, those yogis who have eyes of intelligence free from the cataracts of faults such as the views of things and nonthings see dependent origination as devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: bzhi mthong ba yin no//
analyzed: bzhi mthong ba yin no//
translated: They see the four noble truths.

original: zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes mjug bsdu ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate the summary, the treatise states:

original: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba la sogs pa lta ba'i skyon gyi rab rib dang bral ba'i blo gros kyi mig can /🔽gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dngos po dang dngos po med par lta ba la sogs pa lta ba'i skyon gyi rab rib dang bral ba'i blo gros kyi mig can / gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung //
translated: Therefore, those who have eyes of intelligence free from the cataracts of faults such as the views of things and nonthings🔽See dependent origination

original: mthong ba de ni sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung dang ni 'gog pa dang // lam nyid de dag mthong ba yin //
analyzed: mthong ba de ni sdug bsngal dang // kun 'byung dang ni 'gog pa dang // lam nyid de dag mthong ba yin //
translated: See suffering, origin, cessation, and the path.

original: tha snyad dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul la ltos pas mthong ba dang / mthong ba med pa'i tshul gyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid mthong ba des bden pa bzhi po de dag nyid skye ba dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa sngar ji skad bstan pa dag gis mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: tha snyad dang don dam pa'i bden pa'i tshul la ltos pas mthong ba dang / mthong ba med pa'i tshul gyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ji skad bstan pa'i mtshan nyid mthong ba des bden pa bzhi po de dag nyid skye ba dang / skye ba med pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa sngar ji skad bstan pa dag gis mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: By that seeing, one sees those four truths themselves with the aspects of production, nonproduction, and so on, as previously explained.

original: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo //
translated: It is said: Whoever sees dependent origination sees the Dharma.

original: gang gis chos mthong ba des sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang gis chos mthong ba des sangs rgyas mthong ngo zhes gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: Whoever sees the Dharma sees the Buddha.

original: gal te sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag ma gtogs par gzhan du mthong ba ni bden pa mthong ba ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag na re /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag ma gtogs par gzhan du mthong ba ni bden pa mthong ba ma yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni rang gi sde pa dag na re /
translated: If one does not see the aspects of suffering and so on, one does not see the truth.

original: bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu drug tu dbye ba ma gtogs par gzhan du mthong ba ni bden pa mthong ba ma yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu drug tu dbye ba ma gtogs par gzhan du mthong ba ni bden pa mthong ba ma yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that apart from the sixteen aspects of the four truths, there is no other seeing of the truths.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that statement, the author of the commentary says:

original: bden pa mthong ba zhes bya ba'i sgras de'i don gang yin zhes brtags pa smras so //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba zhes bya ba'i sgras de'i don gang yin zhes brtags pa smras so //
translated: What is the meaning of the term “seeing the truths”?🔽If it is the non-erroneous seeing of the internal sense bases along with reality,

original: gal te nang gi skye mched rnams phyin ci ma log pa de kho na dang bcas pa nyid mthong ba'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag na re bden pa mthong ba zhes bya ba'i sgra de'i don ni nang gi skye mched rnams
analyzed: gal te nang gi skye mched rnams phyin ci ma log pa de kho na dang bcas pa nyid mthong ba'o zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te pha rol po dag na re bden pa mthong ba zhes bya ba'i sgra de'i don ni nang gi skye mched rnams
translated: if the opponent says that the meaning of the term “seeing the truths” is the non-erroneous seeing of the internal sense bases along with reality,🔽from seeing forms with the eye up to apprehending phenomena with the mind,

original: mig gis gzugs mthong ba nas yid kyis chos 'dzin pa'i bar du phyin ci ma log pa bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu drug tu rnam par dbye ba'i de kho na dang bcas pa nyid mthong ba'o zhe na'o //
analyzed: mig gis gzugs mthong ba nas yid kyis chos 'dzin pa'i bar du phyin ci ma log pa bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu drug tu rnam par dbye ba'i de kho na dang bcas pa nyid mthong ba'o zhe na'o //
translated: if it is the seeing of the internal sense bases along with reality, which is the non-erroneous sixteen aspects of the four truths,🔽then it is not tenable to say that apart from the sixteen aspects of the four truths, there is no other seeing of the truths.

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Because arising is refuted in the manner that has been taught,🔽the view that suffering is nonarisen and so on is established as the noble truth.

original: sdug bsngal skye ba med pa la sogs @247b par mthong ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don nyams so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal skye ba med pa la sogs @247b par mthong ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don nyams so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore your assertion is undermined.

original: kho bos ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis don dam par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir /🔽sdug bsngal skye ba med pa la sogs par mthong bas ni 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par grub pa'i phyir khyed nang gi skyi mched rnams mig gis gzugs mthong ba nas yid kyis chos 'dzin pa'i bar du phyin ci ma log pa bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu
analyzed: kho bos ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis don dam par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir / sdug bsngal skye ba med pa la sogs par mthong bas ni 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par grub pa'i phyir khyed nang gi skyi mched rnams mig gis gzugs mthong ba nas yid kyis chos 'dzin pa'i bar du phyin ci ma log pa bden pa bzhi rnam pa bcu
translated: Because arising is refuted ultimately in the manner that has been taught,

original: drug tu rnam par dbye ba'i de kho na dang bcas pa nyid mthong ba 'phags pa'i bden pa yin par 'dod pa'i don nyams so //
