translated: The phrase “in order to refute that” should be connected with the phrase “the twenty-fifth chapter is begun.”

original: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu lnga pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ba'i don gyi dbang du byas nas mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa nyi shu lnga pa brtsam mo zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In terms of the meaning of the text that will be presented below, the twenty-fifth chapter is begun in order to demonstrate that nirvana is essenceless.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu lnga pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa brtag pa'i rab tu byed pa nyi shu lnga pa'i gzhung 'og nas 'byung ba 'di'i don mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin pas de'i dbang du byas nas de skad smras so //
translated: The meaning of the text of the twenty-fifth chapter, “Examination of Nirvana,” which will be presented below, is the demonstration that nirvana is essenceless. Therefore, it is said that the twenty-fifth chapter is begun in order to demonstrate that.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di'i 'bras bu ni gang yin /
translated: What is the point of this chapter?

original: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis ni 'bras bu de 'thob ce na /
translated: By what mode does one attain that fruition?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa ni 'di'i 'bras bu yin la /
translated: The teaching of the realitylessness of nirvana is its fruition.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa'i rnam pas ni 'bras bu de 'thob pas /
translated: And one attains that fruition by the mode of the refutation of the distinctions of the resistances to emptiness.

original: de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i 'tshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'grel pa byed pas rab tu byed pa'i 'tshams sbyar ba'i skabs 'dir thabs dang thabs las byung ba'i 'bras bu dang po kho nar bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the author of the commentary, in this context of the connection with the chapter, first taught the means and the fruition of the means.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i @249b phyir ;
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par zhes smos pa de nyid bstan pa'i @249b phyir ;
translated: In order to teach just that, he said, “the distinctions of the resistances to emptiness,”

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: khyod 'dod pa ltar /
analyzed: khyod 'dod pa ltar /
translated: “According to your belief,

original: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
translated: if all these are empty,

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //
translated: there would be neither origination nor cessation,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: because of the absence of intrinsic reality,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no zhes bya bar bsams so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no zhes bya bar bsams so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: like the son of a childless woman.”

original: des ni rang gi sde pa dag na re khyed dbu ma pa 'dod pa ltar /
analyzed: des ni rang gi sde pa dag na re khyed dbu ma pa 'dod pa ltar /
translated: This shows the words of our own Buddhist schools who say,

original: gal te dngos po 'di dag kun stong na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'di dag kun stong na /
translated: If all these things are empty,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig bstan te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i tshig bstan te /
translated: then emergence and destruction would not exist.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are to be applied in order to the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, and the example.🔽For example, because the son of a barren woman has no intrinsic reality, emergence and destruction do not exist for him.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa de bzhin du gal te 'di dag kun stong na de yang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med do zhes
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa de bzhin du gal te 'di dag kun stong na de yang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir de la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med do zhes
translated: Likewise, if all these things are empty, then because they also have no intrinsic reality, emergence and destruction do not exist for them.

original: bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: bya bar bsams so //
translated: This is the thought.

original: de ltar 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the error that, in that case, because emergence and destruction do not exist, nirvana would not be attained,

original: de dag med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med la /
analyzed: de dag med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med la /
translated: Because they do not exist, the afflictions also do not arise or disintegrate.

original: de dag dang ldan pa'i ming dang gzugs la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pas /🔽gang zhig spangs dang 'gags pa las //
analyzed: de dag dang ldan pa'i ming dang gzugs la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pas / gang zhig spangs dang 'gags pa las //
translated: And because they do not exist, name and form that possess them also do not arise or disintegrate.🔽Therefore, it is said:🔽What is nirvana, which you assert,

original: mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //
translated: is the cessation and abandonment of that?

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi dbang gis so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa dang / phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi dbang gis so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: It is said that nirvana is due to the power of nirvana with and without remainder of aggregates.

original: 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa de dag med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pas gang zhig spangs pas phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings 'thob par 'dod //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa de dag med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa rnams la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pas gang zhig spangs pas phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings 'thob par 'dod //
translated: Because arising and disintegration do not exist, the afflictions also do not arise or disintegrate. Therefore what is nirvana, which you assert, is the attainment of nirvana with remainder of aggregates through the abandonment of that?

original: nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi phung po la yang 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa med pas gang zhig 'gag pa phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings 'thob par 'dod de /🔽nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / phung po 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'das pa rnam gnyis 'thob pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag dang ldan pa'i ming dang gzugs kyi phung po la yang 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa med pas gang zhig 'gag pa phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings 'thob par 'dod de / nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / phung po 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'das pa rnam gnyis 'thob pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: The aggregates of name and form associated with those afflictions would also be without origination and destruction.🔽Therefore, the error would ensue that the two types of nirvana—the nirvana that is the abandonment of the afflictions and the nirvana that is the cessation of the aggregates—would not be obtained.

original: de ltar dbu ma pa stong pa nyid du smra ba la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / phung po 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'das pa rnam gnyis 'thob pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar @250a * //
analyzed: de ltar dbu ma pa stong pa nyid du smra ba la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa med pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / phung po 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'das pa rnam gnyis 'thob pa med pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar @250a * //
translated: Thus, it has been demonstrated that for the Madhyamaka, who advocates emptiness, the error would ensue that the two types of nirvana—the nirvana that is the abandonment of the afflictions and the nirvana that is the cessation of the aggregates—would not be obtained because origination and destruction would not exist.

original: bstan nas / da ni dngos po yod par smra ba dag las 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan nas / da ni dngos po yod par smra ba dag las 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in response to those who advocate the existence of things, the following is said:

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / phung po 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'das pa rnam gnyis 'thob pa yod par bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gang zhig spangs pas sam /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / phung po 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'das pa rnam gnyis 'thob pa yod par bstan pa'i phyir / gang zhig spangs pas sam /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one attains the two types of nirvana through the abandonment of the afflictions and the cessation of the aggregates, he says:

original: 'gags pas mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'dod de zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: 'gags pas mya ngan las 'da' bar yang 'dod de zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Or, do you assert that one attains nirvana through the abandonment of something or the cessation of something?

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pas phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pas phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for the attainment of nirvana that is the remainder of the aggregates through the abandonment of the afflictions, he says:

original: ji skad du dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa de zad cing bral ba gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes kyang gsungs la zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ji skad du dga' ba'i 'dod chags dang ldan pa'i sred pa de zad cing bral ba gang yin pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o zhes kyang gsungs la zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: It is also said, “The exhaustion and separation of craving that is associated with the delight and passion for is nirvana.”

original: phung po 'gags pas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phung po 'gags pas phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the scriptural source for the attainment of nirvana that is the non-remainder of the aggregates through the cessation of the aggregates, he says:

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Similarly,

original: ma zhum pa yi sems kyis ni //
analyzed: ma zhum pa yi sems kyis ni //
translated: with a mind that is not faint,

original: tshor ba dang du len pa na //
analyzed: tshor ba dang du len pa na //
translated: one endures feelings.

original: de yi sems ni rnam grol ba //
analyzed: de yi sems ni rnam grol ba //
translated: The mind of one who does so is liberated.

original: mar me shi bar gyur pa bzhin //
analyzed: mar me shi bar gyur pa bzhin //
translated: Like a butterlamp that has gone out.

original: zhes kyang gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes kyang gsungs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what he said.

original: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na /
translated: When the Bhagavan passed into parinirvana,

original: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen pos /🔽'phags pa kun dga' bo la /
analyzed: 'phags pa 'od srungs chen pos / 'phags pa kun dga' bo la /
translated: the arya Mahakasyapa🔽asked the arya Ananda

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ji 'dra zhes dris pa dang / 'phags pa kun dga' bos tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi mya ngan las 'das pa ji 'dra zhes dris pa dang / 'phags pa kun dga' bos tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsungs so //
translated: what the Bhagavan's parinirvana was like and the arya Ananda spoke this verse.🔽Thus, the attainment of the two kinds of nirvana, the abandonment of the afflictions and the cessation of the aggregates, occurs through the existence of things.

original: de ltar nyon mongs spang ba dang / phung po 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis thob pa de yang ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa yod pas 'thob pa'i phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa de yang ngo bo nyid yod pa 'di ma gtogs par gzhan gyis mi 'thob pas de'i phyir dngos
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs spang ba dang / phung po 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis thob pa de yang ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba la 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa yod pas 'thob pa'i phyir dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du khas blang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa de yang ngo bo nyid yod pa 'di ma gtogs par gzhan gyis mi 'thob pas de'i phyir dngos
translated: Since this is so, you should accept that things exist inherently because their attainment occurs through the existence of their origination and destruction.

original: po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and the aggregates are asserted to exist inherently.

original: des ni rang gi gzhung gzugs pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni rang gi gzhung gzugs pa bstan to //
translated: This is the presentation of his own position.

original: da ni pha rol po'i gzhung sun dbyung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni pha rol po'i gzhung sun dbyung ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the refutation of the opponent’s position,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba rnams la ni gang ngo bo nyid med pa de la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba rnams la ni gang ngo bo nyid med pa de la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med de /
translated: it is said: For those who advocate essencelessness, that which is essenceless is not attained in nirvana,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it neither arises nor ceases, just like the son of a barren woman.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / @250b sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / @250b sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu la ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu la ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, because the son of a barren woman neither arises nor ceases,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: he is not attained in nirvana.

original: gang ngo bo nyid med pa de la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med do //
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid med pa de la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med do //
translated: cease, nirvana is not attained.🔽Since the subject, nirvana, is sought in the thesis that it is to be inferred as

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la chos can mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par 'thob pa brtsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la chos can mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par 'thob pa brtsal ba'i skyon yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: lacking entityness, the error of the subject is shown.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas /
translated: Since it is to be inferred as lacking entityness,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa brtsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir / mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa brtsal ba'i phyir /
translated: since it does not arise or cease,🔽since nirvana is not attained, nirvana is sought in the thesis that it is to be🔽inferred as lacking entityness.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la chos can mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par 'thob pa brtsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bar smras so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la chos can mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par 'thob pa brtsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya bar smras so //
translated: Since the subject, nirvana, is sought, the error of the subject is shown.

original: re zhig de dag ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par yin te ;
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par yin te ;
translated: These are the specific counter positions to emptiness.

original: phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gzhung yin no //
analyzed: phyogs snga ma smra ba'i gzhung yin no //
translated: This is the position of the opponent.

original: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par de dgag pas mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that nirvana is essenceless by refuting the specific assertions of the opponent,

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary responds to this as follows:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good.

original: ji ltar sgyu ma'i mar me ngo bo nyid dang bral ba 'chi ba tha snyad du gtogs pa'i blo'i spyod yul du yod par mi 'gal ba de bzhin du 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin yang thog ma med pa'i rkyen brgyud pa las skyes
analyzed: ji ltar sgyu ma'i mar me ngo bo nyid dang bral ba 'chi ba tha snyad du gtogs pa'i blo'i spyod yul du yod par mi 'gal ba de bzhin du 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin yang thog ma med pa'i rkyen brgyud pa las skyes
translated: Just as the nonexistence of an intrinsically existent lamp that is extinguished is not inconsistent with its existence as an object of the mind that is included within the conventional, in the same way, although compounded phenomena are essenceless, they arise from beginningless conditions,

original: pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu dag gi skye ba med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: pa sgyu ma dang smig rgyu lta bu dag gi skye ba med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and their nonarising is nirvana.

original: des ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin yang tha snyad du 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des ni ngo bo nyid med pa yin yang tha snyad du 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because, although they are essenceless, arising and ceasing exist conventionally.

original: nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / phung po dgag pas mya ngan las 'das pa rnam gnyis 'thob pa yod pa dpe dang bcas par bstan to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / phung po dgag pas mya ngan las 'das pa rnam gnyis 'thob pa yod pa dpe dang bcas par bstan to //
translated: The two types of nirvana are attained through the abandonment of the afflictions and the cessation of the aggregates.

original: de na de 'thob par 'grub pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba dag gi phyogs rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de na de 'thob par 'grub pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba dag gi phyogs rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the position of those who advocate the existence of essence is not reasonable, because nirvana is not attained,

original: de 'thob pa yang 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de 'thob pa yang 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said that nirvana is not attained,

original: ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid rigs pa dang mi ldan par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid rigs pa dang mi ldan par shes par bya'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: because the existence of essence is not reasonable.

original: dngos po rnams med pa'i ngo bo nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i @251a * //
analyzed: dngos po rnams med pa'i ngo bo nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i @251a * //
translated: Since we do not accept that things are essentially nonexistent,🔽there is no fault in our position.

original: phyir dam bcas pa la skyon med do zhes bya ba ni sngar pha rol po dag na re ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa brtsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: phyir dam bcas pa la skyon med do zhes bya ba ni sngar pha rol po dag na re ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pa mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa brtsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Previously, the opponent said that since the nonexistence of essence is inferred, nirvana is not attained, and that nirvana is not attained through the abandonment of the afflictions and the cessation of the aggregates.

original: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par brtsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes zer ba de'i lan btab ste /
analyzed: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par brtsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes zer ba de'i lan btab ste /
translated: The reply to the objection that the thesis is faulty because the specific property of the subject is not sought is as follows.

original: dbu ma pas dngos po rnams mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du med pa'i ngo bo nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir tha snyad du mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod pas dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par brtsal ba'i skyon med do //
analyzed: dbu ma pas dngos po rnams mo gsham gyi bu bzhin du med pa'i ngo bo nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir tha snyad du mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod pas dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par brtsal ba'i skyon med do //
translated: Since the Madhyamikas accept that things do not exist inherently, like the son of a barren woman, conventionally nirvana is attained. Therefore the thesis is not faulty because the specific property of the subject is not sought.

original: glags yod pa'i skyon yang med de /🔽mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag don dam par dpe nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag gis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba rnams la ni gang ngo bo nyid med pa de la mya ngan
analyzed: glags yod pa'i skyon yang med de / mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag don dam par dpe nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sngar pha rol po dag gis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba rnams la ni gang ngo bo nyid med pa de la mya ngan
translated: Nor is there the fault of being open to dispute.🔽Since the son of a barren woman and so on are not established as examples ultimately, the opponent’s earlier objection that if things are essenceless, then nirvana cannot be attained is answered.

original: las 'das pa 'thob pa med de /
analyzed: las 'das pa 'thob pa med de /
translated: The opponent’s objection is that if things are essenceless, then nirvana cannot be attained.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no zhes sgrub pa smras pas dbu ma pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba'i phyogs la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med pa'i glags yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar🔽bstan pa'i lan btab ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no zhes sgrub pa smras pas dbu ma pas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba'i phyogs la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med pa'i glags yod pa'i skyon du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i lan btab ste /
translated: In response to this, we Followers of the Middle Way say that the position of those who propound the lack of entityness is not vulnerable to the charge that nirvana cannot be attained.🔽The ultimate examples of the barren woman’s son and so on that you use are not established as examples.

original: don dam par pha rol po dag gi dpe mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag dpe nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pa des /
analyzed: don dam par pha rol po dag gi dpe mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag dpe nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pa des /
translated: Therefore your argument is flawed in that it lacks an example that is established.

original: dbu ma pa la glags yod pa'i skyon gdags par mi nus so //
analyzed: dbu ma pa la glags yod pa'i skyon gdags par mi nus so //
translated: You cannot use this flawed argument to charge us with a fault.

analyzed: da ni pha rol po dag gis dbu ma pa la skyon gang dag brtags pa de dag nyid pha rol po dag la phyir bsgrin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now we will show how the faults that you impute to us are actually present in your own position.

analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du rtog pa la /
translated: Furthermore, in your attempt to understand how things are devoid of entityness,

analyzed: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
translated: you say, “If all this is empty,

analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med // gang zhig spang dang 'gag pa las //
translated: There is no origination and no cessation.🔽If you assert nirvana is

analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //

analyzed: ces bya ba de bzhin du dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du rtog pa la yang /

analyzed: gal te 'di kun mi stong na //
translated: If all these were not empty,

analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med // gang zhig spang dang 'gag pa las //
translated: There would be no origination and no cessation.🔽If you assert nirvana is

original: mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //
translated: From the cessation of that which is to be abandoned,

original: ngo bo nyid la 'gyur ba med pas spang ba dang 'gag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la 'gyur ba med pas spang ba dang 'gag pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no tenability of abandonment and cessation due to the immutability of intrinsic reality,

original: ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba /
translated: The assertion of intrinsic reality🔽Is not tenable.

original: de kho na rab tu ma mthong ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid la de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de kho na rab tu ma mthong ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid la de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The meaning is that it is not tenable that one who does not see reality sees reality.

original: de nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba @251b bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi mjug bsdu ba @251b bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the summary of that, he said:

analyzed: de'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba dag nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod par bstan dka'o zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is difficult to teach those who propound intrinsic reality that nirvana is attainable.

original: ngo bo nyid med par smra ba la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par smra ba la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach those who propound intrinsic realitylessness that nirvana is attainable,

analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid la ni sgyu ma'i mar me 'chi ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod par rung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //

original: ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod par rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la chos can mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par sgrub pa'i chos ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid brtsal ba'i skyon yod par
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod par rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la chos can mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par sgrub pa'i chos ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid kyi ngo bo nyid brtsal ba'i skyon yod par
translated: In order to show that the subject, the attainment of nirvana, is flawed in seeking the essence of intrinsic reality, which is the property to be established, in the thesis that the attainment of nirvana is inferred in the presence of intrinsic reality,

analyzed: bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par rjes su dpog pas //
