original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa yod pa'i phyir //
translated: because becoming and destruction exist,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid brtsal ba'i phyir /🔽ngo bo nyid rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la //🔽chos can mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod par sgrub pa'i chos ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid brtsal ba'i phyir / ngo bo nyid rjes su dpog pa'i dam bcas pa la // chos can mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod par sgrub pa'i chos ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid kyis /
translated: Because of the absence of intrinsic reality, intrinsic reality is sought.🔽The thesis that intrinsic reality is inferred

original: ngo bo nyid brtsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid brtsal ba'i skyon yod do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: has the fault of seeking intrinsic reality through the intrinsic reality of the property of the thesis that establishes the existence of the property possessor, nirvana.

original: yang na pha rol po dag na re /
analyzed: yang na pha rol po dag na re /
translated: Or, the opponent might say:

original: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
analyzed: gal te 'di dag kun stong na //
translated: If all this is empty,

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //🔽de'i phyir / gang zhig spang dang 'gag pa las //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med // de'i phyir / gang zhig spang dang 'gag pa las //
translated: there is neither origination nor cessation.🔽Therefore,🔽one who desires nirvana through the cessation and abandonment

original: mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //
analyzed: mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //
translated: of that

original: gal te 'du byed 'di dag mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod na ni 'du byed de dag don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed 'di dag mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod na ni 'du byed de dag don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: If you desire nirvana for these compounded phenomena, then you should understand that those compounded phenomena definitely exist through intrinsic reality ultimately,

original: nyon mongs pa spang pa dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang pa dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because nirvana is attained through the abandonment of afflictions and the cessation of name-and-form.

original: rnga mo la sogs pa'i rva yod pa ma yin pa dag la ni de dag med do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par snga ma de nyid rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: rnga mo la sogs pa'i rva yod pa ma yin pa dag la ni de dag med do zhes zer ro zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par snga ma de nyid rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: This is a different way of explaining the former distinction that is the opposite of emptiness.

original: 'di ni rang gi sde pa gang dag 'du byed rnams mya ngan las 'das par smra ba de dag na re gal te dbu ma pa dag 'dod pa ltar 'di dag kun stong na /
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi sde pa gang dag 'du byed rnams mya ngan las 'das par smra ba de dag na re gal te dbu ma pa dag 'dod pa ltar 'di dag kun stong na /
translated: Some Buddhist schools assert that formations are nirvana. They say, “If all this is empty as the Madhyamikas assert,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir 'du byed nyon mongs pa dang / phung po gang zhig spang ba dang / 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod de /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa med pa'i phyir 'du byed nyon mongs pa dang / phung po gang zhig spang ba dang / 'gag pa las mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod de /
translated: then since there would be no arising or ceasing, what formations, what afflictions, and what aggregates would you assert are abandoned and cease in nirvana?

original: de dag la mya ngan las 'da' ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de dag la mya ngan las 'da' ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Nirvana would be untenable for you.

original: gal te 'du byed 'di dag mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod na ni 'du byed 'di dag don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed 'di dag mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod na ni 'du byed 'di dag don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: If you assert that formations are nirvana, then you should understand that these formations definitely exist ultimately with intrinsic reality.

original: nyon mongs @252a * //
analyzed: nyon mongs @252a * //
translated: Since afflictions are abandoned and nirvana is attained through the cessation of name and form, they do not exist in the horns of a rabbit and so on.

original: pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir rnga mo la sogs pa'i rva yod pa ma yin pa dag la ni de dag med do zhes gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa dang / rang gi gzhung 'dzugs pa'i tshig ston te /
analyzed: pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir rnga mo la sogs pa'i rva yod pa ma yin pa dag la ni de dag med do zhes gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byin pa dang / rang gi gzhung 'dzugs pa'i tshig ston te /
translated: The words of the opponent’s refutation and the establishment of our own position are shown.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are applied in order to the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example of the dissimilar class.

original: 'di na rnga mo la sogs pa'i rva yod pa ma yin pa gang dag la nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med pa de dag ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na rnga mo la sogs pa'i rva yod pa ma yin pa gang dag la nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa med pa de dag ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, those horns of a rabbit and so on that do not exist, in which the attainment of nirvana through the abandonment of afflictions and the cessation of name and form do not exist, do not exist inherently.

original: 'du byed gang dag la nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod pa de dag ni don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'du byed gang dag la nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod pa de dag ni don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar shes par bya'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Those formations in which the afflictions are abandoned and nirvana is attained through the cessation of name-and-form should be understood as having ultimate intrinsic reality alone.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to this statement,

original: 'dir slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
translated: the master [Nāgārjuna] explains:

original: gal te 'di kun mi stong na //
analyzed: gal te 'di kun mi stong na //
translated: If all these were not empty,

original: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med //🔽ngo bo nyid yod pas nges par gnas pa ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur ba la de dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba med cing 'jig pa med // ngo bo nyid yod pas nges par gnas pa ngo bo nyid mi 'gyur ba la de dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: there would be neither origination nor cessation.

original: de'i phyir / gang zhig spang dang 'gags pa las //🔽mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang zhig spang dang 'gags pa las // mya ngan 'da' bar 'gyur bar 'dod //
translated: Because they are untenable in intrinsic reality, which definitely endures and does not change, due to having intrinsic reality.

original: ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽Nirvana would be asserted🔽from the abandonment and cessation of that.

original: 'di yang stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa sngar bstan pa de nyid rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di yang stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa sngar bstan pa de nyid rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa yin no //
translated: This also is an explanation in a different way of the refutation of the distinctions that are discordant with emptiness, which was previously taught.

original: de'i phyir / 'di ltar khyod kyis smras pa'i gtan tshigs la rjes su 'gro ba yod par gyur na ni bsgrub par bya ba sgrub nus par yang 'gyur grang na ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'di ltar khyod kyis smras pa'i gtan tshigs la rjes su 'gro ba yod par gyur na ni bsgrub par bya ba sgrub nus par yang 'gyur grang na ;
translated: Therefore, if the reason you state had a pervasion, then it would be able to prove the probandum.

original: de yang med pas kho bo cag gi phyogs la ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de yang med pas kho bo cag gi phyogs la ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But since it does not, it is said that the reason of those who assert that things intrinsically exist is not a unique reason and it is also contradictory.

original: 'dis ni 'du byed mya ngan las 'da' bar smra ba dag gi gtan tshigs nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe 'du byed de dag don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni 'du byed mya ngan las 'da' bar smra ba dag gi gtan tshigs nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la rjes su 'gro ba'i dpe 'du byed de dag don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: This shows that the reason of those who assert that compounded phenomena attain nirvana is a reason that is not a unique property of the subject.

original: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba yod par gyur na ni des bsgrub par bya ba 'du byed rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid @252b yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste zhes bya ba de sgrub nus par yang 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba yod par gyur na ni des bsgrub par bya ba 'du byed rnams don dam par ngo bo nyid @252b yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste zhes bya ba de sgrub nus par yang 'gyur grang na /
translated: For example, if it were the case that “it is like so and so,” then it would be possible to establish that by that, one should understand that the phenomena to be established are only ultimately existent.

original: de yang med pas kho bo cag gi phyogs la khyed kyi gtan tshigs de thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas don dam par ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de yang med pas kho bo cag gi phyogs la khyed kyi gtan tshigs de thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin pas don dam par ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: But since that is not the case, your reason is not unique to our position, and so it is not established ultimately.

original: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bstan to ;
analyzed: kun rdzob tu sgrub na ni don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no zhes bstan to ;
translated: And if it were established conventionally, then it would be contradictory.

original: / da ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gag pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don bden pa gnyi gar yang mi 'grub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / da ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gag pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don bden pa gnyi gar yang mi 'grub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the reasonings of the opponents, “because of the abandonment of the afflictions and because of the attainment of nirvana through the cessation of name and form,” are not established in terms of either of the two truths,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don dri bar yang bya ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don dri bar yang bya ste /
translated: the meaning of the reason should be questioned.

original: ji tha snyad du mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ram /🔽'on te don dam par 'thob pa'i phyir zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis smras so //
analyzed: ji tha snyad du mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ram / 'on te don dam par 'thob pa'i phyir zhes brtag pa rnam pa gnyis smras so //
translated: Or is it in order to attain nirvana ultimately?

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In response to this, in order to demonstrate that the first of these two🔽hypotheses is untenable, it is said,

original: de la gal te tha snyad du na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de la gal te tha snyad du na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: If it is conventionally, then it would be the establishment of what is already established.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the second hypothesis is untenable, it is said,🔽But if it is ultimately, then we maintain

original: 'on te don dam par na ni kho bo cag / spang ba med pa 'thob med pa //🔽chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
analyzed: 'on te don dam par na ni kho bo cag / spang ba med pa 'thob med pa // chad pa med pa rtag med pa //
translated: That which is not abandoned, not attained,🔽Not annihilated, not eternal,

original: 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
analyzed: 'gag pa med pa skye med pa //
translated: Not ceased, not arisen

original: de ni mya ngan 'das par 'dod //
analyzed: de ni mya ngan 'das par 'dod //
translated: Is held to be nirvana.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, since nirvana is attained through the abandonment of the afflictions and the cessation of name-and-form, the reason that was stated, “because nirvana is attained through the abandonment of the afflictions and the cessation of name-and-form,” is unestablished.

original: tshig le'ur byas pa'i tshig gi don de dag ni gcig gis gcig bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i tshig gi don de dag ni gcig gis gcig bshad par bya'o //
translated: The meanings of the words of the verses should be explained by means of the words of the commentary.

original: da ni pha rol po dag don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / phung po 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: da ni pha rol po dag don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / phung po 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de la /
translated: Now, in order to refute the argument that things ultimately exist because one abandons the afflictions and attains nirvana through the cessation of the aggregates,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod par smra ba dag las kha cig ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par 'dod /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod par smra ba dag las kha cig ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par 'dod /
translated: some proponents of the attainment of nirvana say that nirvana is a thing.🔽Some say that nirvana is a nonthing.

original: kha cig ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin par 'dod pas de gnyi ga la yang mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod par mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha cig ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin par 'dod pas de gnyi ga la yang mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod par mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To both of these, it is not tenable that nirvana is attained.

original: yang gzhan yang 'di la mya ngan las 'das pa smra ba dag las kha cig ni mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su yod par smra /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang 'di la mya ngan las 'das pa smra ba dag las kha cig ni mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su yod par smra /
translated: Moreover, in this regard, some proponents of the attainment of nirvana say that nirvana is a substance.

original: gzhan dag ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin par smra ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin par smra ste /
translated: Others say that it does not substantially exist.

original: de gnyi ga yang @253a * //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang @253a * //
translated: Both of these

original: ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: should be analyzed as to how they are untenable.

original: rdzas su yod par smra ba ni dngos po yin par smra ba ste grangs can dang / bye brag pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: rdzas su yod par smra ba ni dngos po yin par smra ba ste grangs can dang / bye brag pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: Those who say that it substantially exists are proponents of entities, such as the Sāṃkhya, Vaiśeṣika, Vaibhāṣika, and Yogācāra.

original: rdzas su yod pa ma yin par smra ba ni dngos po med pa yin par smra ba ste /
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa ma yin par smra ba ni dngos po med pa yin par smra ba ste /
translated: Those who say that it does not substantially exist are proponents of nonentities.

original: gos dmar sde dang / mdo sde pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa la sogs pa dag go //
analyzed: gos dmar sde dang / mdo sde pa dang / 'jig rten rgyang phan pa la sogs pa dag go //
translated: They include the Vātsīputrīya, Sautrāntika, Lokāyata, and so on.

original: de la re zhig mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par 'dod pa dag gi gzhung ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par 'dod pa dag gi gzhung ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag par bya ste /
translated: First, the scriptures of those who assert that nirvana is an entity should be analyzed as to how they are untenable.

original: de'i phyir / mya ngan 'das pa dngos po min//
analyzed: de'i phyir / mya ngan 'das pa dngos po min//
translated: Therefore: Nirvana is not an entity.

original: rga shi'i mtshan nyid thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rga shi'i mtshan nyid thal bar 'gyur //
translated: It would absurdly follow that it has the characteristics of aging and death.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / dngos po nyid du rjes su dpog pas rga shi'i mtshan nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa rga shi'i mtshan nyid can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / dngos po nyid du rjes su dpog pas rga shi'i mtshan nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa rga shi'i mtshan nyid can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because there is no inference that nirvana is a thing, and because it follows that nirvana would have the characteristic of aging and death if it were inferred to be a thing.

original: des ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin te dngos po yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / dngos po nyid du rjes su dpog pa na rga shi'i mtshan nyid can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: des ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin te dngos po yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / dngos po nyid du rjes su dpog pa na rga shi'i mtshan nyid can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that nirvana is not a thing because there is no inference that nirvana is a thing, and because it follows that nirvana would have the characteristic of aging and death if it were inferred to be a thing.

original: dngos po nyid rjes su dpog na /
analyzed: dngos po nyid rjes su dpog na /
translated: If it is inferred to be a thing,

original: ci'i phyir rga shi'i mtshan nyid can du thal bar 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / rga dang 'chi ba med pa yi //
analyzed: ci'i phyir rga shi'i mtshan nyid can du thal bar 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir / rga dang 'chi ba med pa yi //
translated: why does it follow that it would have the characteristic of aging and death?🔽Therefore:

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: A thing that is devoid of aging and death does not exist.

original: dngos po ni rga shi'i mtshan nyid med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po ni rga shi'i mtshan nyid med na mi 'byung ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because a thing is not possible without the characteristic of aging and death.

original: da ni de ltar dngos po ni rga shi'i mtshan nyid can yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa ni rga shi med pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de ltar dngos po ni rga shi'i mtshan nyid can yin pas mya ngan las 'das pa ni rga shi med pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that since a thing has the characteristic of aging and death, nirvana is not a thing because it is devoid of aging and death,

original: de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: he says, “That is not accepted.”

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni rga shi med par 'dod pas de'i phyir smra ba nus te zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni rga shi med par 'dod pas de'i phyir smra ba nus te zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Since nirvana is accepted as being devoid of aging and death, therefore he says, “It is possible to state that.”

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inference of that, he says,

original: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po yod pa ma yin te ;
analyzed: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po yod pa ma yin te ;
translated: “Nirvana does not exist ultimately as a thing,

original: rga shi med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rga shi med pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is devoid of aging and death.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin pas de'i phyir khyod kyi phyogs la yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa de nyid yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin pas de'i phyir khyod kyi phyogs la yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa de nyid yod do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, like the son of a barren woman. Therefore, in your position, the meaning of the reason is not established. That is stated.”

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dung na mjug bsdu ba yin par @253b go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe dung na mjug bsdu ba yin par @253b go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the predicate of the probandum, the proof, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu ni rga shi med pa'i phyir khyod dngos po ma yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang rga shi med pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin pas de'i phyir dngos por smra ba khyod kyi phyogs la yang don dam par
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu ni rga shi med pa'i phyir khyod dngos po ma yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang rga shi med pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin pas de'i phyir dngos por smra ba khyod kyi phyogs la yang don dam par
translated: For example, just as the son of a barren woman does not age and die because he does not exist, so too nirvana does not age and die because it does not exist. Therefore, even in your system, which advocates that nirvana is a thing, nirvana is not a thing ultimately.

original: 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste ;
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste ;
translated: Therefore, you should understand that compounded phenomena definitely exist essentially,

original: nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa de nyid yod do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa de nyid yod do //
translated: because nirvana is attained through the abandonment of afflictions and the cessation of name and form. The meaning of the reason is not established.

original: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par gyur na /
analyzed: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par gyur na /
translated: Now, suppose nirvana were a thing.

original: 'dus byas yin par thal bar 'gyur bas dngos po ma yin par sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus byas yin par thal bar 'gyur bas dngos po ma yin par sgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it would follow that it is a conditioned thing, to demonstrate that nirvana is not a thing,

original: yang na sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan yod de /
analyzed: yang na sun dbyung ba'i lam gzhan yod de /
translated: another refutation is stated:🔽For those who say that nirvana is a thing,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par smra ba dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par smra ba dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: it is said:

original: gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
translated: If nirvana were a thing,

original: mya ngan 'das pa 'dus byas 'gyur //🔽'dus byas yin par mi 'dod de //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'dus byas 'gyur // 'dus byas yin par mi 'dod de //
translated: nirvana would be a conditioned thing.

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: But it is not asserted that it is a conditioned thing.🔽This demonstrates that the phenomenon of nirvana is not a conditioned thing.

original: 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos ni 'dus byas nyid ma yin par bstan to zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni 'dus byas nyid ma yin🔽par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos ni 'dus byas nyid ma yin par bstan to zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin par sgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni 'dus byas nyid ma yin par bstan to //
translated: The first half of this verse demonstrates that the reason nirvana is not a thing is that it is not a conditioned thing.

original: ci'i phyir dngos po yin na 'dus byas su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po yin na 'dus byas su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it that if it is a thing, it must be a conditioned thing?

original: de'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: To demonstrate the logic of that,🔽it is said:

original: dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa //
analyzed: dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa //
translated: A thing that is not a conditioned thing

original: 'ga' yang ji ltar yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'ga' yang ji ltar yod ma yin //
translated: Nothing whatsoever exists in that way.

original: zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: This is what is said.🔽This shows the example of the dissimilar class.

original: 'dis ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe bstan to zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin par bsgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe ni dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa 'ga'
analyzed: 'dis ni chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe bstan to zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin par bsgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe ni dngos po 'dus byas ma yin pa 'ga'
translated: The second half of the verse shows the example of the similar class that proves nirvana is not a thing.

original: yang med pa'i sgo nas nam mkha'i me tog lta bu 'dus byas ma yin pa dpe nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: yang med pa'i sgo nas nam mkha'i me tog lta bu 'dus byas ma yin pa dpe nyid du bstan to //
translated: Since there is no unconditioned thing whatsoever, the unconditioned, like a flower in the sky, is shown to be an example.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the measure of that,

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po ma yin te /
translated: he says, “Therefore, the inference is: Nirvana is not a thing

original: 'dus byas ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dus byas ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is not conditioned, like a flower in the sky.”

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: These are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the reason, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni 'dus byas ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin pa de bzhin du mya @254a * //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog ni 'dus byas ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin pa de bzhin du mya @254a * //
translated: For example, a sky flower is not a thing because it is not a conditioned phenomenon.

original: ngan las 'das pa yang 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: ngan las 'das pa yang 'dus ma byas pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, nirvana is not a thing because it is not conditioned.

original: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin na bsten nas gdags par bya ba yin par thal bar 'gyur bas dngos po ma yin par bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin na bsten nas gdags par bya ba yin par thal bar 'gyur bas dngos po ma yin par bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the proof that nirvana is not a thing because it follows that if nirvana were a thing, it would be a dependent designation, he says:

original: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de ;
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan yang yod de ;
translated: Or, there is another syllogism:

original: / gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
analyzed: / gal te mya ngan 'das dngos na //
translated: If nirvana were a thing,

original: ji ltar myang 'das de bsten min //
analyzed: ji ltar myang 'das de bsten min //
translated: how could nirvana not be a dependent designation?

original: dngos po ni bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: dngos po ni bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The meaning is that a thing does not occur without being a dependent designation.

original: 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos ni bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa nyid bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin par bsgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni
analyzed: 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos ni bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa nyid bstan to zhes bya ba ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong ma 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin par bsgrub pa'i chos gtan tshigs ni
translated: The first half of this verse shows that the reason that nirvana is not a thing is

original: bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin par bstan to //
translated: that it is not something that is imputed in dependence.

original: ci'i phyir dngos po yin na bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po yin na bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why is it that if something is a thing, it must be something that is imputed in dependence?

original: de'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the rationale for this, he says:

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /🔽dngos po bsten pa ma yin pa //🔽'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa / dngos po bsten pa ma yin pa // 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽There is no thing that does not depend🔽on something else.

original: gang ma bsten par yod pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: gang ma bsten par yod pa'i dngos po ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: There is no thing that exists without depending on something else.

original: 'dis ni chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe ma yin pa nyid bstan to zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin par bsgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe ni dngos po bsten nas gdags
analyzed: 'dis ni chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe ma yin pa nyid bstan to zhes bya bas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed 'og ma 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po ma yin par bsgrub pa'i chos mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe ni dngos po bsten nas gdags
translated: This teaches that the example of the similar class is not a real thing.

original: par bya ba ma yin pa 'ga' yang med pa'i sgo nas ri bong gi rva lta bu bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa dpe de nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: par bya ba ma yin pa 'ga' yang med pa'i sgo nas ri bong gi rva lta bu bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa dpe de nyid du bstan to //
translated: The second half of this verse teaches that the example of the similar class that proves that nirvana is not a thing is the same as the example of the rabbit’s horns, which is not something that is posited in dependence on a thing.

original: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshad ma bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the measure of that,

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po ma yin te /
translated: it says, “Therefore, nirvana is not a thing,

original: bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not something that is posited in dependence on a thing,

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: like the horns of a rabbit.”

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Moreover, they are to be applied in order as the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the reason, and the example.

original: dper na ri bong rva ni bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po @254b yang ma yin no //🔽de ltar re zhig mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par 'dod pa dag gi gzhung ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag pa bstan to //
analyzed: dper na ri bong rva ni bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dngos po @254b yang ma yin no // de ltar re zhig mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par 'dod pa dag gi gzhung ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag pa bstan to //
translated: For example, a rabbit’s horns are not a thing because they are not established by dependence. In the same way, nirvana is not a thing because it is not established by dependence.🔽Thus, it has been demonstrated that the treatises of those who assert that nirvana is a thing are untenable.

original: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin par 'dod pa dag gi gzhung ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin par 'dod pa dag gi gzhung ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag par bya ste /
translated: Now, the treatises of those who assert that nirvana is a nonthing will be demonstrated to be untenable.

original: de'i phyir / gos dmar sde gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa mar me shi ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dag skye ba med pa tsam la mya ngan las 'das par tha snyad 'dogs pa de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gos dmar sde gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa mar me shi ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smra ba dang / mdo sde pa dag skye ba med pa tsam la mya ngan las 'das par tha snyad 'dogs pa de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, this is explained for the sake of those who say that nirvana is like the extinction of a lamp, and for Sautrantikas who conventionally designate mere nonarising as nirvana.

original: gal te mya ngan 'das dngos min //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das dngos min //
translated: If nirvana is not a thing,

original: dngos med ji ltar rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos med ji ltar rung bar 'gyur //
translated: How could it be a nonthing?

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin na dngos po med pa rdzas su med pa'i rnam grangs la bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pas brtags pa don dam pa'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dag ji
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin na dngos po med pa rdzas su med pa'i rnam grangs la bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pas brtags pa don dam pa'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid dag ji
translated: If nirvana is a nonthing, then how could it be ultimate virtue and the characteristic of the pacification of affliction, which are synonyms of nonthings that are not substantially existent, as imagined by Vaibhasikas and so on?

original: ltar rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ltar rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be tenable?

original: dngos po med pa la nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du dge ba nyid la sogs pa dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa la nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du dge ba nyid la sogs pa dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because virtue and so on are untenable in the absence of things, like a sky flower, and because there is no inference that teaches nirvana to be the nature of a nonexistent substance, it is the thought that nirvana is not a nonthing.

original: des ni gos dmar sde dag gi gzhung las /
analyzed: des ni gos dmar sde dag gi gzhung las /
translated: The Red-Garbed ones say:

original: ji ltar mar me shi ba ni //
analyzed: ji ltar mar me shi ba ni //
translated: Just as an extinguished butter lamp

original: sa la mi 'gro mkha' la min //
analyzed: sa la mi 'gro mkha' la min //
translated: does not go to the earth, the sky,

original: phyogs su mi 'gro phyogs mtshams min //🔽mar zad nyi tshe shi 'gyur ltar //
analyzed: phyogs su mi 'gro phyogs mtshams min // mar zad nyi tshe shi 'gyur ltar //
translated: the directions, or the intermediate directions,

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan 'das pa yang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan 'das pa yang //
translated: so too the nirvana of the buddhas

original: sa la mi 'gro mkha' la min //
analyzed: sa la mi 'gro mkha' la min //
translated: does not go to the earth, the sky,

original: phyogs su mi 'gro phyogs mtshams min //
analyzed: phyogs su mi 'gro phyogs mtshams min //
translated: the directions, or the intermediate directions.

original: sred zad nyi tshes 'da' bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sred zad nyi tshes 'da' bar 'gyur //
translated: Nirvana is the mere extinction of craving.

original: zhes smra zhing mya ngan las 'das pa mar me shi ba bzhin du dngos po med pa yin par 'dod pa dang / mdo sde pa dag nyon mongs pa dang / ming dang gzugs skye ba med pa tsam la mya ngan las 'das par tha snyad gdags kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba nyid ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes zer bas de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: zhes smra zhing mya ngan las 'das pa mar me shi ba bzhin du dngos po med pa yin par 'dod pa dang / mdo sde pa dag nyon mongs pa dang / ming dang gzugs skye ba med pa tsam la mya ngan las 'das par tha snyad gdags kyi mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba nyid ni dngos po med pa yin no zhes zer bas de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: Sautrantikas say that nirvana is merely the nonarising of the afflictions and name and form, but nirvana itself is not a thing.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin na /🔽dngos po med pa rdzas su med pa'i rnam grangs la bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pas brtags pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni don dam pa'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan @255a * //
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin na / dngos po med pa rdzas su med pa'i rnam grangs la bye brag tu smra ba la sogs pas brtags pa mya ngan las 'das pa ni don dam pa'i dge ba dang nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan @255a * //
translated: If nirvana were a nonthing,

original: nyid rnam par grol ba'i bde ba chen po yin no zhes bya ba'i lung de dag ji ltar rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyid rnam par grol ba'i bde ba chen po yin no zhes bya ba'i lung de dag ji ltar rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the statements in the scriptures that nirvana is ultimate virtue, the characteristic of the pacification of the afflictions, and the great bliss of liberation would be illogical.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin par smra ba dag lung de dag mi 'thad pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin par smra ba dag lung de dag mi 'thad pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because those who say nirvana is a nonthing are harmed by the untenability of those scriptures.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rdzas su med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bstan to //
translated: Since there is no inference that teaches nirvana is not a substantially existent entity, nirvana is not a nonthing.

original: yang gzhan yang ji skad bstan pa'i sgrub pas //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang ji skad bstan pa'i sgrub pas //
translated: Moreover, as it has been taught,

original: gang la mya ngan 'das dngos min //
analyzed: gang la mya ngan 'das dngos min //
translated: Nirvana is not a thing.

original: de la dngos med yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la dngos med yod ma yin //
translated: Nor is it a nonthing.

original: mar me'i dpes mar me ni dngos po nyid yin par 'jig rten la grags te /
analyzed: mar me'i dpes mar me ni dngos po nyid yin par 'jig rten la grags te /
translated: The example of the butterlamp teaches that in the world a butterlamp is renowned as a thing,🔽because it does not exist later.

original: phyis med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gos dmar sde gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa mar me shi ba bzhin no zhes zer ba'i sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa des na /
analyzed: phyis med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gos dmar sde gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa mar me shi ba bzhin no zhes zer ba'i sgrub pa ji skad bstan pa des na /
translated: The proponents of the Red Suitcase say, “Nirvana is like the extinction of a butterlamp.”

original: de dag gi phyogs la mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po la brten pa yin pas /
analyzed: de dag gi phyogs la mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po la brten pa yin pas /
translated: The position of those who say this is that nirvana is based on a thing.

original: de la dngos po med pa yod pa ma yin te /🔽mar me'i dpes mar me ni phyis shi ba na med par gyur pa'i phyir ma shi ba'i dus na dngos po nyid yin par 'jig rten la grags pas de dngos po med pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang dngos po med pa
analyzed: de la dngos po med pa yod pa ma yin te / mar me'i dpes mar me ni phyis shi ba na med par gyur pa'i phyir ma shi ba'i dus na dngos po nyid yin par 'jig rten la grags pas de dngos po med pa ma yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang dngos po med pa
translated: Nonthing does not exist.

original: ma yin par bstan to //🔽gal te 'dir gos dmar sde dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gis mya ngan las 'das pa'i dpe mar me las blangs pa des mar me dngos po yod pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yod par ma smras kyi mar me shi ba dngos
analyzed: ma yin par bstan to // gal te 'dir gos dmar sde dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag gis mya ngan las 'das pa'i dpe mar me las blangs pa des mar me dngos po yod pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yod par ma smras kyi mar me shi ba dngos
translated: Since it is well known in the world that a lamp is a thing at the time it is not extinguished, but becomes nonexistent when it is extinguished later, this example of a lamp shows that nirvana is not a nonthing.🔽If the Aparāntakas say, “We do not say that nirvana is a thing because it exists like a lamp, which is the example of nirvana.

original: po med pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med par smras pas ;
analyzed: po med pa bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med par smras pas ;
translated: We say that nirvana is a nonthing because it is like a lamp that is extinguished, which is a nonthing,”

original: des na mar me shi ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin par grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pas yang /
analyzed: des na mar me shi ba bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yin par grub po zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pas yang /
translated: The treatise responds to this former opponent’s position, which is drawn out from within the text, as follows:

original: gzhan yang / gal te mya ngan 'das dngos min //
analyzed: gzhan yang / gal te mya ngan 'das dngos min //
translated: Moreover, if nirvana is not a thing,

original: ji ltar myang 'das de bsten min //🔽mar me dngos po med pa bsten nas gdags pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar myang 'das de bsten min // mar me dngos po med pa bsten nas gdags pa ni /
translated: how could nirvana be a dependent origination?

original: bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bshad de /
analyzed: bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bshad de /
translated: The meaning is that the designation of the nonthing of the flame as a dependent origination is itself a dependent designation.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa mar me shi ba bzhin du dngos po med pa yin na bsten nas gdags @255b par bya ba yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa mar me shi ba bzhin du dngos po med pa yin na bsten nas gdags @255b par bya ba yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If nirvana were a non-thing, like the extinction of a flame, it would follow that it would be a dependent designation.

original: dper na mar me shi ba dngos po med pa ni dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yang dngos po la bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin par thal bas de
analyzed: dper na mar me shi ba dngos po med pa ni dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po med pa yang dngos po la bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin par thal bas de
translated: In the same way, it follows that nirvana, a nonthing, is something that is imputed in dependence on a thing.

original: lta na mya ngan las 'das pa bstan nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i lung dang 'gal lo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: lta na mya ngan las 'das pa bstan nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i lung dang 'gal lo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: If that is so, it would contradict the scriptures that state that nirvana is not something that is imputed in dependence on something else.

original: ci'i phyir dngos po med pa yin na bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po med pa yin na bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why would it be something that is imputed in dependence on something else if it is a nonthing?

original: de'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the logic of that,🔽Candrakīrti explains:

original: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gang zhig bsten pa ma yin pa'i ;🔽/ dngos med yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig bsten pa ma yin pa'i ; / dngos med yod pa ma yin no //
translated: A nonthing that is not dependent🔽on something else does not exist.

original: gang ma bsten par yod pa'i dngos po med pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gang ma bsten par yod pa'i dngos po med pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: There is no nonthing that exists without depending on something else.

original: 'dir yang rdzes su dpag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang rdzes su dpag pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po med pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the correct inference is: Nirvana is not a non-thing,

original: bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsten nas gdags par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is not something that is imputed in dependence on something else.

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: For example, it is like the horn of a rabbit.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces sangs rgyas par gtogs pa thams cad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod par bya ba yin na de khyod kyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul gnyi gar brtsal bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces sangs rgyas par gtogs pa thams cad kyis mya ngan las 'das pa 'dod par bya ba yin na de khyod kyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i tshul gnyi gar brtsal bas de'i phyir /
translated: Here, if the opponent says, “If all Buddhists must assert nirvana, then because you search for it in both the mode of being a thing and the mode of being a nonthing,

original: khyod la khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma'i khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: khyod la khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma'i khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du /
translated: you are undermined with respect to your own assertions,” the response from the standpoint of the opponent’s position is as follows.

original: 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pas /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos mdzad pas /
translated: Here the author of the treatise says,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: “Because nirvana is not a thing or a nonthing ultimately in the way that has been explained,

original: 'ong ba dang ni 'gro ba'i dngos ;
analyzed: 'ong ba dang ni 'gro ba'i dngos ;
translated: That which is dependent and that which is imputed

original: / bsten tam rgyur byas gang yin pa //
analyzed: / bsten tam rgyur byas gang yin pa //
translated: in dependence on coming and going

original: de ni bsten min rgyur byas min //
analyzed: de ni bsten min rgyur byas min //
translated: are not dependent and not imputed

original: mya ngan 'das pa yin par bstan //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa yin par bstan //
translated: in dependence, which is taught to be nirvana.

original: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i dngos po bsten nas 'byung ba dang rgyur byas nas gdags pa gang yin pa de dag bsten nas 'byung ba dang / rgyur byas nas gdags pa med pa ni tha snyad du mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bstan pas /
analyzed: 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i dngos po bsten nas 'byung ba dang rgyur byas nas gdags pa gang yin pa de dag bsten nas 'byung ba dang / rgyur byas nas gdags pa med pa ni tha snyad du mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bstan pas /
translated: That which arises in dependence on the things of coming and going and is imputed in dependence on them is not dependent and not imputed in dependence, which is taught to be nirvana conventionally.

original: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa nyid du bkag kyang khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skabs med do zhes bya ba smras te /🔽'dis ni kun rdzob tu 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba'i dngos po bsten @256a * //
analyzed: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa nyid du bkag kyang khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skabs med do zhes bya ba smras te / 'dis ni kun rdzob tu 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba'i dngos po bsten @256a * //
translated: Therefore, although nirvana is refuted as a thing or nonthing ultimately, there is no occasion to fault our position.

original: nas 'byung ba dang / rgyur byas nas gdags pa gang yin pa de ni 'khor ba yin la /
analyzed: nas 'byung ba dang / rgyur byas nas gdags pa gang yin pa de ni 'khor ba yin la /
translated: This shows that that which arises in dependence on the things of coming and going and is imputed in dependence on them is samsara.

original: 'khor ba de nyid bsten nas 'byung ba dang / rgyur byas nas gdags pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bstan pas don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa nyid du bkag kyang kho bo cag la khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skabs med do zhes
analyzed: 'khor ba de nyid bsten nas 'byung ba dang / rgyur byas nas gdags pa med pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bstan pas don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po ma yin pa nyid du bkag kyang kho bo cag la khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skabs med do zhes
translated: Since it is taught that nirvana is the non-reliance on and the non- imputation in terms of the appropriator of samsara, although nirvana is refuted as a thing and non-thing in the ultimate, there is no occasion for this to contradict our own position.

original: bstan to // de la 'ong ba ni skye ba yin /
analyzed: bstan to // de la 'ong ba ni skye ba yin /
translated: Here, “coming” is arising.

original: gro ba ni 'gag pa yin te /🔽skye ba dang 'gag pa'i dngos po de yang rkyen 'ga' zhig la brten nas 'byung ba dang / nye bar len pa 'ga' zhig rgyur byas nas gdags pa yin pa de ni 'khor ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gro ba ni 'gag pa yin te / skye ba dang 'gag pa'i dngos po de yang rkyen 'ga' zhig la brten nas 'byung ba dang / nye bar len pa 'ga' zhig rgyur byas nas gdags pa yin pa de ni 'khor ba zhes bya ste /
translated: “Going” is ceasing.🔽That thing which arises and ceases occurs in dependence on some conditions and is imputed in dependence on some appropriated aggregates. That is called “samsara.”

original: 'di ltar 'du byed kyi tshogs rkyen 'gag zhig la brten tam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed kyi tshogs rkyen 'gag zhig la brten tam /
translated: Thus, the collection of compounded phenomena is either dependent on the cessation of some conditions or is imputed in dependence on the appropriation of some aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa 'ga' zhig rgyur byas nas 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i tshul gyis 'khor lo'i rnam pa bzhin du skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ba ni 'khor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'ga' zhig rgyur byas nas 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor bar 'ong ba dang 'gro ba'i tshul gyis 'khor lo'i rnam pa bzhin du skye ba dang 'gag par 'gyur ba ni 'khor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because cyclic existence is the arising and ceasing in the manner of coming and going in the five transmigrations, in the aspect of a wheel, through appropriating some appropriated aggregates as a cause.

original: de nyid rkyen la ma brten tam nye bar len pa rgyur ma byas pas 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba'i tshul gyis 'khor lo'i rnam pa bzhin du skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ba 'di mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid rkyen la ma brten tam nye bar len pa rgyur ma byas pas 'gro ba lnga'i 'khor ba 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba'i tshul gyis 'khor lo'i rnam pa bzhin du skye ba dang 'gag par mi 'gyur ba 'di mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: That very thing, not dependent on conditions, not appropriating aggregates as a cause, does not arise and cease in the manner of coming and going in the five transmigrations, in the aspect of a wheel. This is nirvana.

original: de ltar dbu ma pas kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga yod par khas len pas don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga ma yin par bkag tu zin kyang khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba med do zhes bya bar
analyzed: de ltar dbu ma pas kun rdzob kyi tha snyad du 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa gnyi ga yod par khas len pas don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga ma yin par bkag tu zin kyang khas blangs pa la gnod pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba med do zhes bya bar
translated: Thus, since the Madhyamikas accept that both cyclic existence and nirvana exist conventionally, although nirvana is refuted as ultimately being both a thing and a nonthing, there is no fault in their acceptance.

original: sbyar ro / da ni sngar pha rol po dag na re dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod na nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / phung po 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob par 'gyur bas ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod do zhes zer ba de nyid dgag pa'i phyir yang /
analyzed: sbyar ro / da ni sngar pha rol po dag na re dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod na nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / phung po 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa gnyis 'thob par 'gyur bas ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba la mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa yod do zhes zer ba de nyid dgag pa'i phyir yang /
translated: Now, in order to refute that, it is said:🔽The Teacher taught that arising and destruction

original: gzhan yang / 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pha dang // spang bar ston pas bka' stsal to //🔽zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pha dang // spang bar ston pas bka' stsal to // zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and abandonment are to be relinquished.

analyzed: 'byung ba ni srid par 'khor ba yin la 'jig pa ni nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / phung po 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa yin pas de gnyi ga yang dngos po dang dngos po med @256b pa'i mthar lta ba yin pa'i phyir spang bar ston pas bka' stsal te /
translated: Arising is samsara, and destruction is nirvana, which is attained through the abandonment of afflictions and the cessation of the aggregates. Since both of these are views grasping at the extremes of things and nonthings, the Teacher taught that they are to be relinquished.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / phung po 'gags pas dngos po'i mtshan nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par bya ba yang med la /

translated: There is no abandonment of afflictions characterized by entities, and no attainment of nirvana characterized by entities through the cessation of the aggregates.

original: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / phung po 'gags pas dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par bya ba yang med do zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / phung po 'gags pas dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob par bya ba yang med do zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: There is no abandonment of afflictions characterized by non-entities, and no attainment of nirvana characterized by non-entities through the cessation of the aggregates.

analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin par rigs pas khas blangs pa la gnod par yang mi 'gyur ro // gal te 'byung ba ni spang bar bya ba nyid kyis sun dbyung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid dgag pa mi rigs so zhe na zhes bya ba pha rol po dag na re 'byung ba ni srid pa 'khor ba ste /
translated: And it is not undermined by reasoning.🔽If you say that it is unreasonable to refute the reality of emergence because emergence is to be refuted because it is to be abandoned,

analyzed: de ni spang bar bya ba nyid kyis sun dbyung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dngos po nyid yin pas dngos po de dngos po med par dgag pa mi rigs so zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: the opponent’s position is stated in the words “If you say that it is unreasonable to refute the reality of emergence because emergence is to be refuted because it is to be abandoned.”

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'byung ba yang dngos po'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis 'byung ba yang dngos po'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says, “Since emergence is the nature of things, there is no error.”

original: 'byung ba yang 'khor ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir de ni ngo bo nyid kyis spang du med cing sun dbyung du med pa'i phyir de dngos po nyid ma yin par bkag pa la skyon med do //

translated: Since emergence is the nature of things that cycle, it is not inherently to be abandoned and it is not to be refuted. Therefore there is no error in refuting that it is not a thing.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin par 'dod pa dang / dngos po med pa yin par 'dod pa dag ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag pa bstan to //

original: da ni mu stegs 'os pa pa dag gi gzhung las mya ngan las 'das pa ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin par 'dod pa'i gzhung dgag par bya ste /

translated: Now, in the treatises of the tīrthikas, it is asserted that nirvana is the nature of both a thing and a nonthing.

original: de la re zhig de @257a * //
analyzed: de la re zhig de @257a * //
translated: Now, first, that is untenable.

analyzed: dag gi phyogs snga ma bstan pa'i phyir dang / gzhan dag gis smras pa /

analyzed: thar pa ni dngos po yang yin la dngos po med pa yang yin pas gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba smras te /

original: de ni mu stegs 'os pa dag na re thar pa ni 'jig rten 'dus pa zhes bya ba grub pa'i zhing gi mtshan nyid yin pas yod la /
analyzed: de ni mu stegs 'os pa dag na re thar pa ni 'jig rten 'dus pa zhes bya ba grub pa'i zhing gi mtshan nyid yin pas yod la /

analyzed: de la srog gi tshig gi don nges par gnas pa'i phyir dngos po yang yin la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rgyun chad bas dngos po med pa yang yin te /
translated: It is a thing because the meaning of the term life force definitely abides in it and it is a nonthing because the suffering of samsara is severed.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: rgyal bas gsungs pa'i thar pa 'tsho byed pa // rgya spos dri ma med pa'i mdog dang ni //

analyzed: dbyibs ni gdugs zlum bkan pa lta bu yin //🔽zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /

original: de'i don ni thar pa 'jig rten 'dus pa zhes bya ba grub pa'i zhing gi mtshan nyid 'jig rten thams cad kyi steng na gnas pa de'i kha dog ni rgya spos kyi me tog dang / 'o ma dang / mu tig dang ; kha ba'i mdog 'dra la dbyibs ni gdugs zlum po bkan pa ltar 'dug pa yin te /

translated: The meaning of that is as follows: Liberation is called the “world’s assembly,” which is the characteristic of the field of accomplishment, located above all worlds. Its color is like the color of an incense flower, milk, a pearl, and snow, and its shape is like a round open parasol.

original: de la srog gi tshig gi don nges par gnas pas dngos po yang yin la /
analyzed: de la srog gi tshig gi don nges par gnas pas dngos po yang yin la /
translated: Since the meaning of the words of life abide there, it is a thing.

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rgyun chad pas dngos po med pa yang yin pas gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir khyed dbu ma pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pa'i skyon kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rgyun chad pas dngos po med pa yang yin pas gnyi ga'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir khyed dbu ma pas dngos po dang dngos po med pa bkag pa'i skyon kho bo cag gi phyogs la med do zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Since the continuum of the suffering of saṃsāra is severed, it is also a nonthing. Since it is the nature of both, the fault of the refutation of things and nonthings by you Mādhyamikas does not exist in our position.

original: de skad ces zer ba de dag gi gzhung yang ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de dag gi gzhung yang ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar brtag par bya ste /

original: de'i phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di bshad de /

analyzed: gal te mya ngan 'das pa ni //

analyzed: tshig le'ur byas pa'i phyed gong mas ni pha rol po'i gzhung bsnan pa bstan la phyed 'og mas ni de mi 'thad par sun dbyung ba bstan te /

translated: If nirvana were both a thing and a nonthing, it would be illogical for both a thing and a nonthing, which are incompatible, to be nirvana.

original: khyod phyed ni yod la phyed ni med par 'dod pa de lta na khyod kyi thar pa kha dog dkar po dbyibs zlum po de yang phyed yod la phyed med pas phyed dkar phyid gnag dang zla gam lta bur 'gyur la khyod kyi srog gi tshig gi don

translated: If you assert that it is partly existent and partly nonexistent, then your liberation, which is white in color and round in shape, would also be partly existent and partly nonexistent. Therefore it would be like a half-white and half-black half-moon.

original: nges par gnas pa de yang phyed yod phyed med pas phyed shi phyed gson par 'gyur zhing khyod kyi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rgyun chad pa de yang phyed yod phyed med pas phyed sdug phyed skyid par 'gyur bas de lta bu'i thar pa de ni yod par mi
analyzed: nges par gnas pa de yang phyed yod phyed med pas phyed shi phyed gson par 'gyur zhing khyod kyi 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal rgyun chad pa de yang phyed yod phyed med pas phyed sdug phyed skyid par 'gyur bas de lta bu'i thar pa de ni yod par mi
translated: And your life force, which definitely abides, would also be partly existent and partly nonexistent. Therefore it would be like something that is half-dead and half-alive. And the cessation of the suffering of cyclic existence would also be partly existent and partly nonexistent. Therefore it would be like something that is half-joy and half-suffering. Thus it is illogical that such a liberation exists.

analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang blo med pa'i phyir dngos po med pa yin la /

original: bde ba la bzlar med pa gtan du ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dngos po yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'os pa pa dag na re mya ngan las 'das pa ni ji skad smos pa de gnyis ltos pa'i dbang gis dngos po dang dngos po med

translated: In response to that, the Subcommentary states:

original: don dam par skye ba bkag pa'i phyir ltos pa snga ma gnyis mo 'grub pa'i phyir dang / bde ba 'dus ma byas yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa khyed la med pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no //

translated: Because ultimately arising is refuted, the first two relations are not established, and because you do not have an inference that demonstrates the existence of an unconditioned bliss, that also is not correct.

analyzed: dngos po med pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba de mngon par byed pa med pas ma grub po //
translated: Since that is not established, it is not evident.

original: de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin pa dang / dngos po med pa yin pa dang / gnyi ga @260a * //
analyzed: de ltar mya ngan las 'das pa dngos po yin pa dang / dngos po med pa yin pa dang / gnyi ga @260a * //
translated: Thus, nirvana is not a thing, not a nonthing, and also not both.

original: yin pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa yin par ma grub pas sngar pha rol po dag na re gal te 'du byed 'di dag mya ngan las 'das par 'dod na ni /
analyzed: yin pa dang / gnyi ga ma yin pa yin par ma grub pas sngar pha rol po dag na re gal te 'du byed 'di dag mya ngan las 'das par 'dod na ni /
translated: Since it is not established that nirvana is both a thing and a nonthing, and it is not established that nirvana is neither a thing nor a nonthing, the meaning of the reason that the opponent previously stated, “If these compounded phenomena are asserted to be nirvana,

original: 'du byed de dag don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed de dag don dam par ngo bo nyid yod pa kho nar shes par bya ste /
translated: then it should be known that these compounded phenomena definitely exist ultimately,”

original: nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid nyams pa med do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spang ba dang / ming dang gzugs 'gags pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid nyams pa med do //
translated: is not established, and the fault of the reason’s meaning not being established remains.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Nirvana definitely exists ultimately,

original: skye ba dang rga shis 'jig pa rnams de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shis 'jig pa rnams de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who are superior engage in it in order to attain it.

original: med pa la ni khyad par can rnams de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa ma mthong ste /
analyzed: med pa la ni khyad par can rnams de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa ma mthong ste /
translated: Those who are superior do not engage in order to attain what does not exist,

original: dper na rus sbal gyi spu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi spu bzhin no //
translated: like the hair of a turtle.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la ni de 'thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / khyad par can rnams lam bsgom pa la 'jug pa yod pas de'i phyir don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag rnal 'byor pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir🔽lam bsgom pa la 'jug cing 'khor ba ni spong /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la ni de 'thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / khyad par can rnams lam bsgom pa la 'jug pa yod pas de'i phyir don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag rnal 'byor pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir lam bsgom pa la 'jug cing 'khor ba ni spong /
translated: Since there is the attainment of nirvana and since there is the engagement in the meditation of the path by those who are special, therefore nirvana definitely exists ultimately.🔽This is the statement of the opponent, who says that yogis engage in the meditation of the path in order to attain nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni len pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa khyad par yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa kho na yin te zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni len pas 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa khyad par yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa kho na yin te zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: Since samsara is to be abandoned and nirvana is to be adopted, the reason that samsara and nirvana are different is that nirvana definitely exists ultimately.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dpe dang / nye bar sbyar ba'i sbyor ba dang / mjug bsdu ba yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: They are respectively the subject, the predicate of the probandum, the logical reason, the example of the discordant side, the application, and the conclusion.

original: 'di na rus sbal gyi spu lta bu med pa gang la khyad par can rnams de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa med pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di na rus sbal gyi spu lta bu med pa gang la khyad par can rnams de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa med pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The nonexistence of nirvana is like the nonexistence of the hair of a turtle, because no one engages in the practice of the path in order to attain it.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la ni rnal 'byor pa khyad par can rnams ni de thob par bya ba'i phyir lam bsgom pa la 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //🔽de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la ni rnal 'byor pa khyad par can rnams ni de thob par bya ba'i phyir lam bsgom pa la 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro // de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: But since those who are superior yogis do engage in the practice of the path in order to attain nirvana, nirvana exists ultimately.

original: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: khyad par yod na ni gzhan gyis gzhan 'thob pa mthong ste /
analyzed: khyad par yod na ni gzhan gyis gzhan 'thob pa mthong ste /
translated: If there were a difference, then one would attain another.

original: dper na lag pas rkang pa slebs pa lta bu yin na kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa @260b dag la rnam pa de lta bu med pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dper na lag pas rkang pa slebs pa lta bu yin na kho bo cag gi phyogs la don dam par 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa @260b dag la rnam pa de lta bu med pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: For example, if the hand were to reach the foot, then we would say that in our system, ultimately, cyclic existence and nirvana do not have such aspects, and so there is no engagement for the sake of attaining nirvana.

original: don dam par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la khyad par med pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa med pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa yod🔽pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: don dam par 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa dag la khyad par med pas mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa med pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs ma grub pa'i phyir don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Since ultimately there is no difference between cyclic existence and nirvana, there is no engagement for the sake of attaining nirvana. Therefore, since the reason of the opponent is not established, it is shown that ultimately nirvana does not exist.🔽In order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽'khor ba mya ngan 'das pa las //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / 'khor ba mya ngan 'das pa las //
translated: It is thus:

original: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: There is not the slightest difference

original: mya ngan 'das pa 'khor ba las //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'khor ba las //
translated: Between cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: There is not the slightest difference🔽Between nirvana and cyclic existence.

original: dmigs su med par mnyam pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: dmigs su med par mnyam pa nyid kyis /
translated: Because of the sameness of non-apprehension,

original: gnyi ga yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bar smras so //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya bar smras so //
translated: both are non-apprehensible.

original: ji ltar dmigs su med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs su med ce na /
translated: How are they non-apprehensible?

original: de'i phyir / ji ltar de dag gi brtags pa'i bdag nyid dmigs su med pa de ltar ni bstan zin pas zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ji ltar de dag gi brtags pa'i bdag nyid dmigs su med pa de ltar ni bstan zin pas zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Therefore, it is said: Just as their imagined nature is non-apprehensible, so has it been taught.

original: de'i phyir de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de thob par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid dang don 'gal ba nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reason “because there is engagement for the sake of attaining that” is unestablished and contradictory. This is the conclusion.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba khyad par med pa'i 'thad pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba khyad par med pa'i 'thad pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the very tenability of the non-difference of nirvana and samsara,
