analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'khor ba dag khyad par med par bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / mya ngan 'das mtha' gang yin pa //
translated: in order to demonstrate the non-difference of nirvana and samsara, it is said:🔽The limit of nirvana

original: de ni 'khor ba'i mtha' yin te //
analyzed: de ni 'khor ba'i mtha' yin te //
translated: is the limit of samsara.

original: mtha' ni de bzhin nyid dang chos nyid dang // stong pa nyid ces bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //🔽de gnyis khyad par cung zad ni //
analyzed: mtha' ni de bzhin nyid dang chos nyid dang // stong pa nyid ces bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so // de gnyis khyad par cung zad ni //
translated: The end is a synonym for suchness, reality, and emptiness.🔽There is not the slightest

original: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'ang yod ma yin //
translated: difference between the two.

original: chos nyid dbyer med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos nyid dbyer med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because reality is indivisible.

original: nam mkha' la phyogs kyi khyad par yod kyang mtshan nyid dbyer med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: nam mkha' la phyogs kyi khyad par yod kyang mtshan nyid dbyer med pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: It is like the fact that although space has directional parts, its characteristic is indivisible.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: stong pa nyid ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las nges par 'byin pa yin par gsungs na khyed kyis mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bshad pas med pa ni lta ba'i gnyen po nyid yin par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las nges par 'byin pa yin par gsungs na khyed kyis mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bshad pas med pa ni lta ba'i gnyen po nyid yin par mi rung ngo zhes bya ba
translated: If emptiness is said to be the deliverance from all views, then since you explain nirvana to be essenceless, it is not tenable that nonexistence is the antidote to the view.

original: ni pha rol po dag na ri lung las /
analyzed: ni pha rol po dag na ri lung las /
translated: The opponent says:

original: mdor na chos ni mi 'tshe ste //
analyzed: mdor na chos ni mi 'tshe ste //
translated: In brief, the Dharma is nonviolence.

original: mya ngan 'das pa stong pa nyid //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa stong pa nyid //
translated: Nirvana is emptiness.

original: 'dir ni de gnyis 'ba' zhig ces /
analyzed: 'dir ni de gnyis 'ba' zhig ces /
translated: Here, only these two

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: The Tathagatas have stated

original: zhes 'byung bas @261a * //
analyzed: zhes 'byung bas @261a * //
translated: Thus,

original: stong pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin la /
translated: emptiness is nirvana.

original: de ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las nges par 'byin pa yin par gsungs pas de ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las nges par 'byin pa yin par gsungs pas de ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Since it is stated that nirvana is the emancipation from all views, it definitely exists.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su dpag pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the inference of that,

original: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: he says, Therefore, nirvana definitely exists,

original: gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dper na snang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dper na snang ba bzhin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because it is the antidote, like light.

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are to be applied in order.🔽For example, since light is the antidote to darkness, it definitely exists.

original: dper na snang ba ni mun pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang lta bar gyur pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na snang ba ni mun pa'i gnyen po yin pa'i phyir yod pa kho na yin pa de bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa yang lta bar gyur pa thams cad kyi gnyen po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, since nirvana is the antidote to all views, it definitely exists.

original: yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: It is only existent.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du /
translated: In response to that,

original: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: the author of the commentary himself says:

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: don dam par mar me snang ba nyid dang / dngos po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par mar me snang ba nyid dang / dngos po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because a lamp’s illumination and its being an entity are not established ultimately,

original: dpe med pas sgrub par ma tshang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dpe med pas sgrub par ma tshang ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: your example is not established, and your proof is incomplete.

original: kho bo cag gis sngar /🔽mar me dag ni gang dang ni //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis sngar / mar me dag ni gang dang ni //
translated: We previously explained:🔽A lamp illuminates itself

original: de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
analyzed: de 'dug pa na mun pa med //
translated: And it illuminates other things.

original: ces bshad pa dang / dngos po rnams kyi skye ba bkag pa nyid kyis snang ba mun pa'i gnyen por ma grub pa'i phyir khyed kyi bsgrub pa la dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ces bshad pa dang / dngos po rnams kyi skye ba bkag pa nyid kyis snang ba mun pa'i gnyen por ma grub pa'i phyir khyed kyi bsgrub pa la dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod pas mi rung ngo //
translated: And because the arising of things is refuted, illumination is not established as the antidote to darkness. Therefore your proof has the fault of an incomplete example. It is not correct.

original: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa ni stong pa nyid yin la de yang dmigs pa'i gnyen po yin par brjod na dmigs par bya ba'i don dmigs su med na yul de la dmigs pa yang med do zhes bya bas ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni stong pa
analyzed: chos thams cad mi dmigs pa ni stong pa nyid yin la de yang dmigs pa'i gnyen po yin par brjod na dmigs par bya ba'i don dmigs su med na yul de la dmigs pa yang med do zhes bya bas ni mya ngan las 'das pa ni stong pa
translated: The non-observation of all phenomena is emptiness, and if it is said that it is the antidote to observation, then if the object of observation is unobservable, there is no observation of that object.🔽This teaches that nirvana is emptiness, and also that it is the antidote that definitely delivers from all views.

original: nyid yin la da yang lta ba thams cad las nges par 'byin pa'i gnyen po yin par brjod pas de la de dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa gnyi ga dmigs su med pa'i phyir gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bstan te ;
analyzed: nyid yin la da yang lta ba thams cad las nges par 'byin pa'i gnyen po yin par brjod pas de la de dmigs par bya ba dang / dmigs par byed pa gnyi ga dmigs su med pa'i phyir gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par mi bya'o zhes bstan te ;
translated: Therefore, since neither the object of observation nor the observer is observable, one should not adhere to the nature of apprehendeds and apprehenders.

original: des ni pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa ma grub par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni pha rol po dag gi dam bcas pa ma grub par bstan to //
translated: This teaches that the assertions of the opponents are not established.

original: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces 'o na mya ngan las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces gsungs pa ste yod pa yin nam med pa yin zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa @261b nyid
analyzed: 'dir gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces 'o na mya ngan las 'das pa stong pa nyid ces gsungs pa ste yod pa yin nam med pa yin zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa @261b nyid
translated: Here, the Commentary itself presents the following response to the opponent’s earlier question, “Well then, is nirvana empty or not?”

original: kyis / yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: kyis / yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It says: It is not existent.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is not produced.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: It is like a sky flower.

original: med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not nonexistent.

original: dgag pa sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: dgag pa sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because negation has already been presented earlier.

original: stong pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Emptiness is not existent.🔽Because it is not produced, it is like a sky flower.

original: ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa 'dis ni yod par lta ba dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: ma skyes pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no zhes bya ba'i sgrub pa 'dis ni yod par lta ba dgag pa bstan to //
translated: This argument refutes the view of existence.

original: stong pa nyid ni med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Emptiness is not nonexistent.

original: dngos po bkag pas dngos po med par brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: dngos po bkag pas dngos po med par brjod pa yin na /
translated: Because negation is expressed as the absence of an entity.

original: 'dir dngos po nyid dmigs su med pa yin pas de bkag pa dang dngos po med par bsgrub pa yang ma yin dbu ma pa ni med par dgag pa'i tshul ston pa yin gyi ;
analyzed: 'dir dngos po nyid dmigs su med pa yin pas de bkag pa dang dngos po med par bsgrub pa yang ma yin dbu ma pa ni med par dgag pa'i tshul ston pa yin gyi ;
translated: The Madhyamikas teach the mode of non-affirming negation, not the mode of affirming negation.

original: ma yin par dgag pa mi ston to zhes dgag pa sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir des ni med par lta ba dgag pa bstan to //
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa mi ston to zhes dgag pa sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir des ni med par lta ba dgag pa bstan to //
translated: Since this has already been taught in the refutation above, it shows the refutation of the view of non-existence.

original: de lta bas na stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la mtha' gnyis su mngon par zhen pa dgag pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na stong pa nyid la mngon par zhen pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni stong pa nyid la mtha' gnyis su mngon par zhen pa dgag pa'i mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to adhere to emptiness. This is the conclusion of the refutation of the two extremes in relation to emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa gzhan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach another logical argument for that,

original: stong pa nyid du lta ba yang chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du dmigs su med pa'i bgegs bsal ba'i phyir mkhas pa rnams spong bar byed do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du lta ba yang chos thams cad rnam pa thams cad du dmigs su med pa'i bgegs bsal ba'i phyir mkhas pa rnams spong bar byed do //
translated: the view of emptiness is also abandoned by the wise in order to clear away the obstacle to the complete non-observation of all phenomena in every way.

original: mi mkhas pa rnams ni de nyid dngos po dang dngos po med pa las 'dzin par byed cing don med pa nyid sgrub par byed de zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: mi mkhas pa rnams ni de nyid dngos po dang dngos po med pa las 'dzin par byed cing don med pa nyid sgrub par byed de zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: The unwise apprehend that emptiness itself as a thing or non-thing, and they establish the meaninglessness of emptiness.

original: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the source of that,

original: ji skad du 'od srungs gang stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni gsor mi rung bar nga smra'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji skad du 'od srungs gang stong pa nyid du lta ba de ni gsor mi rung bar nga smra'o zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: he says, “As it is said, ‘Kāśyapa, I say that whoever views emptiness as a view is incurable.’”

original: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las de skad gsungs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa dkon mchog brtsegs pa'i mdo las de skad gsungs so //
translated: This is stated in the Noble Jewel Pile Sutra.

original: de'i phyir de ltar stong pa nyid ma grub pas gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang / tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar stong pa nyid ma grub pas gnyen po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba dang / tshad ma'i 'bras bu yin te /
translated: Therefore, since emptiness is not established in that way, the meaning of the reason “because it is an antidote” is not established. This is the conclusion, and it is the result of the valid knowledge.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni sngar pha rol po dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin te gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dper na snang ba bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe dang dam bcas pa dang / gtan tshigs dag ma grub par rim bzhin du bstan to //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni sngar pha rol po dag gis mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin te gnyen po yin pa'i phyir dper na snang ba bzhin no zhes smras pa'i dpe dang dam bcas pa dang / gtan tshigs dag ma grub par rim bzhin du bstan to //
translated: This, in brief, is the order in which the previous section demonstrated that the example, thesis, and reason of the opponent’s argument, “Nirvana exists, because it is an antidote, like light,” are not established.

original: da ni pha rol po dag na re stong pa nyid ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las nges par 'byin pa yin par gsungs na /🔽khyed kyis mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid du med pa bshad pas med pa ni lta ba'i gnyen po @262a * //
analyzed: da ni pha rol po dag na re stong pa nyid ni lta bar gyur pa thams cad las nges par 'byin pa yin par gsungs na / khyed kyis mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid du med pa bshad pas med pa ni lta ba'i gnyen po @262a * //
translated: Now, the opponent may say, “Emptiness is taught to be the deliverance from all views.🔽But since you say that nirvana does not exist inherently, it cannot be the antidote to the views.

original: yin par mi rung ngo zhes smras pa'i lta ba dag don dam par yod pa ma yin pas de dag gi gnyen po yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yin par mi rung ngo zhes smras pa'i lta ba dag don dam par yod pa ma yin pas de dag gi gnyen po yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: ” To demonstrate that since the views do not exist ultimately, it is not tenable that they have an antidote, the following is said:

original: yang na don dam par lta ba dag yod na ni de dag gi gnyen po yang rigs par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yang na don dam par lta ba dag yod na ni de dag gi gnyen po yang rigs par 'gyur grang na /
translated: If the views existed ultimately, it would be tenable to posit their antidote.

original: lta ba de dag yod pa ma yin pas de brtag pa'i phyir 'di bshad de /
analyzed: lta ba de dag yod pa ma yin pas de brtag pa'i phyir 'di bshad de /
translated: Since those views do not exist, this is explained in order to investigate them.

original: 'gags par gyur dang mtha' sogs dang // rtag la sogs par lta ba dag / mya ngan 'das dang phyi mtha' dang // sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin //
analyzed: 'gags par gyur dang mtha' sogs dang // rtag la sogs par lta ba dag / mya ngan 'das dang phyi mtha' dang // sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin //
translated: The views of existence and so on in regard to the cessation of the Tathāgata, the views of the finitude and so on of the world, and the views of the permanence and so on of the world are based on nirvana, the limit of the future, and the limit of the past.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'gags par gyur na yod pa la sogs par lta ba dang ; 'jig rten mtha' yod pa la sogs par lta ba dang / 'jig rten rtag pa la sogs par lta ba de dag ni lta bar gyur pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'gags par gyur na yod pa la sogs par lta ba dang ; 'jig rten mtha' yod pa la sogs par lta ba dang / 'jig rten rtag pa la sogs par lta ba de dag ni lta bar gyur pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: The views of existence and so on in regard to the cessation of the Tathāgata, the views of the finitude and so on of the world, and the views of the permanence and so on of the world are aspects of the views.

original: de dag kyang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin pas /
analyzed: de dag kyang mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin pas /
translated: And those are based on nirvana, the limit of the future, and the limit of the past.

original: ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ;
translated: Since they do not exist by intrinsic reality,

original: de dag gi gnyen po stong pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po stong pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes ston to //
translated: their antidote, emptiness, also does not exist.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that, a specific explanation is given.

original: 'gags par gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod pa dang med pa dang yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin par lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'gags par gyur pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod pa dang med pa dang yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin par lta ba'o //
translated: The extreme of cessation is the view that the Tathagata exists, does not exist, both exists and does not exist, or neither exists nor does not exist after his death.

original: mtha' la sogs pa ni 'jig rten mtha' yod pa dang mtha' med pa dang / mtha' yod kyang yod la mtha' med kyang med pa dang / mtha' yod pa yang ma yin /🔽mtha' med pa yang ma yin par lta ba'o //
analyzed: mtha' la sogs pa ni 'jig rten mtha' yod pa dang mtha' med pa dang / mtha' yod kyang yod la mtha' med kyang med pa dang / mtha' yod pa yang ma yin / mtha' med pa yang ma yin par lta ba'o //
translated: The extreme of finitude, etc., is the view that the world is finite, infinite, both finite and infinite, or neither finite nor infinite.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa ni 'jig rten rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin par lta ba'o //
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa ni 'jig rten rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang / rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin par lta ba'o //
translated: The extreme of eternity, etc., is the view that the world is eternal, not eternal, both eternal and not eternal, or neither eternal nor not eternal.

original: lta ba de dag ni go rims bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin pas ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: lta ba de dag ni go rims bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang / sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa yin pas ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: Since these views are, respectively, based on nirvana, the future, and the past, they do not exist inherently.

original: de ltar lta ba de dag ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin na ji ltar snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar lta ba de dag ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin na ji ltar snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If these views do not exist inherently, how can they appear?

original: de'i phyir log par rnam par rtog pa la goms pa'i bag chags kyi skyon gyis rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par brtag pa'i dngos po ngo bo nyid med @262b pa nyid du bstan zin pas de'i phyir dngos po thams cad stong pa la /🔽mtha' yod ci zhig mtha' med ci //
analyzed: de'i phyir log par rnam par rtog pa la goms pa'i bag chags kyi skyon gyis rnam par rtog pa dang rnam par brtag pa'i dngos po ngo bo nyid med @262b pa nyid du bstan zin pas de'i phyir dngos po thams cad stong pa la / mtha' yod ci zhig mtha' med ci //
translated: Since the error of the habitual tendency to conceive of things in terms of unreal imagination has already been explained, therefore, all things are empty.🔽How could there be an end or no end?

original: mtha' dang mtha' med ci zhig yin //
analyzed: mtha' dang mtha' med ci zhig yin //
translated: How could there be both end and no end?

original: mtha' min mtha' med min pa ci //🔽de nyid ci zhig gzhan ci yin //🔽rtag pa ci zhig mi rtag ci //
analyzed: mtha' min mtha' med min pa ci // de nyid ci zhig gzhan ci yin // rtag pa ci zhig mi rtag ci //
translated: How could there be neither end nor no end?🔽How could there be reality or unreality?🔽How could there be both reality and unreality?🔽How could there be neither reality nor unreality?🔽How could there be permanence or impermanence?

original: rtag dang mi rtag gnyis ka ci //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag gnyis ka ci //
translated: How could there be both permanence and impermanence?

original: gnyi ga min pa'ang ji zhig yin //
analyzed: gnyi ga min pa'ang ji zhig yin //
translated: What is neither?

original: rnam par brtag par bya ba'i dngos po med na gzhi med pa la de dag tu rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba'i dngos po med na gzhi med pa la de dag tu rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: If the thing to be imagined does not exist, then there is no imagination of it in the absence of a basis.

original: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de nyid kyi khungs bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says:

original: de'i phyir mdo sde las kyang //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo sde las kyang //
translated: Therefore, in the sutra it is said:

original: gang la rnam rtog yod min pa //
analyzed: gang la rnam rtog yod min pa //
translated: “Where there is no imagination,

original: de la rnam rtog gal yod //
analyzed: de la rnam rtog gal yod //
translated: how can there be the imagined?

original: rnam brtag rnam rtog zad gyur pas //
analyzed: rnam brtag rnam rtog zad gyur pas //
translated: When the imagination and the imagined are exhausted,

original: bstan pa rnam par grol bar 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras so //🔽tha snyad pa'i gtan tshigs su rtogs na ni skyon snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de kun rdzob kyi gtan tshigs su rtogs na ni don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon snga
analyzed: bstan pa rnam par grol bar 'gyur // zhes gsungs so zhes bya ba smras so // tha snyad pa'i gtan tshigs su rtogs na ni skyon snga ma bzhin no zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs gnyen po yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de kun rdzob kyi gtan tshigs su rtogs na ni don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon snga
translated: the teaching is liberated.”🔽If one understands the reason as a conventional one, then the former error arises, because the reason is an antidote to the opponent.

original: ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ma bzhin no //
translated: If one understands the reason as a conventional one, then the error of contradiction in meaning arises, just as before.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /

original: de med na sgrub pa de mi 'thad te /
analyzed: de med na sgrub pa de mi 'thad te /

original: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhi stong mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir /

original: spyad pa'i gnyen por bka' stsal pas de'i phyir de yod pas don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi
analyzed: spyad pa'i gnyen por bka' stsal pas de'i phyir de yod pas don dam par mya ngan las 'das pa yod pa kho na yin no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag mya ngan las 'das pa thob par bya ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis sems can gyi

original: dbang po dang / bsam pa dang / mos pa dang / dus dang / yul ma ltos pas chos bstan pa yod pa'i gtan tshigs kyis mya ngan las 'das pa yod par bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /

translated: These are the subject, the predicate, the reason, the example of the dissimilar class, the application of the reason, and the conclusion, respectively.🔽The Blessed One taught the Dharma in order to attain that which does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit.

original: 'das kyis chos bstan pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'das kyis chos bstan pa de ni yod pa ma yin gyi /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos kyi phung po brgyad khri bzhin stong spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba'i gnyen por bka' stsal pas /

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gnas gyur pa 'gyur ba med pa yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid dang / yang @263b dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba don dam par yang yod par brtags pa dag gi gzhung dgag pa bstan te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid gnas gyur pa 'gyur ba med pa yongs su grub pa dang / phyin ci ma log par yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid dang / yang @263b dag pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba don dam par yang yod par brtags pa dag gi gzhung dgag pa bstan te /
translated: The ultimate reality of the relative reality, the unchanging transformation, the perfect reality, the suchness that is not wrongly imagined, and the pure pristine awareness, which are designated as ultimately existent, are refuted in the scriptures.

original: 'dir dbu ma pa dag gi phyogs la don dam par dmigs par bya ba'i yul dang / dmigs par byed pa'i sems gnyis ka yang ngo bo nyid med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dir dbu ma pa dag gi phyogs la don dam par dmigs par bya ba'i yul dang / dmigs par byed pa'i sems gnyis ka yang ngo bo nyid med pa yin la /
translated: Here, in the Madhyamaka position, both the object that is ultimately observed and the mind that observes it are devoid of essence.

original: de dag kyang kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir rkyen gzhan las 'byung bas rang gi ngo bo nyid las skye ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar dmigs par bya ba'i yul ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin du dmigs par
analyzed: de dag kyang kun rdzob tu rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir rkyen gzhan las 'byung bas rang gi ngo bo nyid las skye ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar dmigs par bya ba'i yul ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin du dmigs par
translated: Therefore, just as the object that is observed lacks essence, the mind that observes it also lacks essence.

original: byed pa'i sems kyang ngo bo nyid med pas gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa thams cad log par gyur pa ni dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin te /
analyzed: byed pa'i sems kyang ngo bo nyid med pas gzhan gyi dbang dang yongs su grub pa'i dmigs pa thams cad log par gyur pa ni dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin te /
translated: The cessation of all observations of the dependent and the real is the complete pacification of all observations.

original: de ni don dam pa'i bden pa mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba gnyis su med par brjod du med pa smra ba dang / bsam pa las 'das pa skye ba med pa 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang gi rig pa ;
analyzed: de ni don dam pa'i bden pa mtshan nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid dang bral ba gnyis su med par brjod du med pa smra ba dang / bsam pa las 'das pa skye ba med pa 'phags pa rnams kyis so so rang gi rig pa ;
translated: That is the ultimate truth, which is said to be without characteristics, free from the characteristics of duality, inexpressible, beyond speech and thought, unborn, and the individual knowledge of the noble ones.

original: / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: It is unborn and unceasing,

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: Dharma nature, and the same as nirvana.

original: zhes bya ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin par bstan to //
translated: This is the teaching.

original: spros pa nye bar zhi ba ni dmigs par bya ba'i don med pa kho na'i phyir yul de la brjod pa'i mtshan nyid ni spros pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba kho na'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab🔽pa'i dbyings de la yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir spros pa nye bar zhi ba yin ste /
analyzed: spros pa nye bar zhi ba ni dmigs par bya ba'i don med pa kho na'i phyir yul de la brjod pa'i mtshan nyid ni spros pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba kho na'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i dbyings de la yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir spros pa nye bar zhi ba yin ste /
translated: Since the object of conceptualization does not exist, the characteristic of verbal expression does not operate in that domain.🔽This is the teaching.

original: de ni brjod par bya ba dang sems kyi spyod yul log pa'i don dam pa /🔽brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //
analyzed: de ni brjod par bya ba dang sems kyi spyod yul log pa'i don dam pa / brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //
translated: Since the domain of the mind and verbal expression do not exist, the ultimate is the object of the reversal of the domain of the mind and verbal expression.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: The domain of the mind and verbal expression are reversed.

original: zhes bya ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin par bstan to //
translated: This is the teaching.🔽Since it is free from all harm, it is peace.

original: zhi ba ni gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i gnod pa ni rnam par rtog pa las 'byung la /
analyzed: zhi ba ni gnod pa thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni las dang nyon mongs pa'i gnod pa ni rnam par rtog pa las 'byung la /
translated: The harm of karma and affliction arises from conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni spros pa las 'byung /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni spros pa las 'byung /
translated: Conceptualization arises from mental proliferation.

original: spros pa pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gags pas /
analyzed: spros pa pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gags pas /
translated: Mental proliferation ceases due to emptiness.

original: gang gi tshe brjod par bya ba dang / sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa rtogs pa'i dus na gnod pa thams cad dang bral bar gyur pa ni zhi ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe brjod par bya ba dang / sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa rtogs pa'i dus na gnod pa thams cad dang bral bar gyur pa ni zhi ba ste /
translated: Therefore, when the domain of expression and the domain of mind cease, the non-arisen and non-ceased reality that is equivalent to nirvana is realized. At that time, one becomes free from all harm, which is peace.

original: de nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid don dam pa'i mtshan nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: This is taught to be the characteristic of the ultimate.🔽The Buddha

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni @264a * //🔽gang du yang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni @264a * // gang du yang //
translated: has not taught

original: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
analyzed: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
translated: any dharma to anyone anywhere.

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir dang brjod du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni don dam par kun brtags kyi bdag nyid dang / brjod pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam par chos thams cad kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid du yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir dang brjod du med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni don dam par kun brtags kyi bdag nyid dang / brjod pa'i bdag nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because ultimately all phenomena are not fully established as having the nature of the imagined and are inexpressible. This teaches that ultimately the imagined nature and the expressed nature do not exist.

original: don dam par sangs rgyas kyis gnas skabs gang du 'ang gang zag su la'ang chos 'ga' yang ma bstan pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //🔽yang na / sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
analyzed: don dam par sangs rgyas kyis gnas skabs gang du 'ang gang zag su la'ang chos 'ga' yang ma bstan pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du bstan to // yang na / sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
translated: Ultimately, the Buddha did not teach any dharma to anyone at any time, so the meaning of the opponent’s reason is not established.

original: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
analyzed: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
translated: Or, the Buddha did not teach any dharma to anyone at any time.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: chos kyi de kho na ni rang rig par bya ba yin la brjod pa ni kun brtags pa'i spyi'i yul can yin pas de'i phyir chos kyi de kho na de ni bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi de kho na ni rang rig par bya ba yin la brjod pa ni kun brtags pa'i spyi'i yul can yin pas de'i phyir chos kyi de kho na de ni bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni /
translated: the suchness of phenomena is to be known by oneself, and expression is a conceptual cognition that has a generic image as its object. Therefore it is said, “Because that suchness of phenomena is not to be indicated.”

original: chos kyi de kho na ni rang rig par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: chos kyi de kho na ni rang rig par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The suchness of phenomena is to be known by oneself.

original: kun brtags kyi brjod pas bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun brtags kyi brjod pas bstan par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not to be indicated by the expression of the imaginary.

original: don dam par sangs rgyas kyis gnas skabs gang du yang gang zag su la yang chos 'ga' yang ma bstan pas /
analyzed: don dam par sangs rgyas kyis gnas skabs gang du yang gang zag su la yang chos 'ga' yang ma bstan pas /
translated: Ultimately, the Buddha did not teach any dharma to anyone at any time.

original: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The meaning of the opponent’s argument is not established.

original: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'ga' yang ma bstan na /
analyzed: gal te bcom ldan 'das kyis chos 'ga' yang ma bstan na /
translated: If the Buddha did not teach any phenomena,

original: mdo sde la sogs pa theg pa gsum dang ldan pa 'di dag las 'byung ste /
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa theg pa gsum dang ldan pa 'di dag las 'byung ste /
translated: then how could these scriptures of the three vehicles, such as the sūtras, come into existence?🔽Therefore your assertion is undermined.”

original: de'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de'i lan du 'on kyang tha snyad kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul du ni ston pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro zhes zer ba de'i lan du 'on kyang tha snyad kyi bden pa rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul du ni ston pas /
translated: In response to this, the Commentary says, “Nevertheless, the Teacher, in terms of the way of positing conventional truth,

original: thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir bskal pa stong phrag dpag tu med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rab tu bstsags pa las nges par 'khrungs pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu gzugs sna tshogs dang ldan pa lta bu rnam par mi rtog pa las rtsol
analyzed: thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir bskal pa stong phrag dpag tu med par bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs rab tu bstsags pa las nges par 'khrungs pa yid bzhin gyi nor bu gzugs sna tshogs dang ldan pa lta bu rnam par mi rtog pa las rtsol
translated: in order to benefit all sentient beings, taught the three vehicles in the scriptures, which were born from the nonconceptual mind that was produced through the accumulation of the collections of merit and wisdom for countless eons, like a wish-fulfilling jewel that has various forms.

original: ba mi mnga' bar sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis theg pa gsum pa ldan pa'i gsung 'byung zhing /
analyzed: ba mi mnga' bar sems can rnams kyi bsam pa'i dbang gis theg pa gsum pa ldan pa'i gsung 'byung zhing /
translated: From that, the scriptures of the three vehicles come forth effortlessly, in accordance with the dispositions of sentient beings.

original: de'i dbang gis nyan pa'i skye bo rnams ston pa bdag cag la chos ston to snyam du de la rnam par rmongs par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis nyan pa'i skye bo rnams ston pa bdag cag la chos ston to snyam du de la rnam par rmongs par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and by its power, the listeners would be confused, thinking that the Teacher is teaching us the Dharma.

original: kun rdzob tu ston pa'i khyad par dang gsung gi khyad par @264b dang ; gdul bya'i khyad par las theg pa gsum dang ldan pa'i chos bstan pa yang yod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽yang na / sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ston pa'i khyad par dang gsung gi khyad par @264b dang ; gdul bya'i khyad par las theg pa gsum dang ldan pa'i chos bstan pa yang yod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro // yang na / sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
translated: But it is said that there is a teaching of the Dharma endowed with the three vehicles from the point of view of the conventional, due to the distinction of the Teacher, the distinction of the teaching, and the distinction of the disciples.🔽Again,

original: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
analyzed: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
translated: the Buddha has not taught any Dharma anywhere to anyone.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
translated: the Buddha is not the body, nor is he other than the body,

original: de las sku med der de med //
analyzed: de las sku med der de med //
translated: there is no body in him, nor is he in the body,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
translated: the Tathagata is not endowed with a body,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
translated: and what is the Tathagata?

original: zhes bstan pa'i tshul gyis don dam par ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang med la gang du bstan par bya ba dang / gang la bstan par bya ba dang gang bstan par bya ba yang med pas de ltar de dag rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sngar de bzhin gshegs pa brtags pa'i skabs su de skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis ston pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i tshul gyis don dam par ston pa de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba'i ngo bo nyid 'ga' yang med la gang du bstan par bya ba dang / gang la bstan par bya ba dang gang bstan par bya ba yang med pas de ltar de dag rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni sngar de bzhin gshegs pa brtags pa'i skabs su de skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis ston pa dang /
translated: Thus, in the ultimate truth, there is no essence of a teacher called “the Tathagata,” there is no place where he teaches, there is no one to whom he teaches, and there is nothing that he teaches.🔽Since these do not exist substantially, as has been explained in the chapter on the Tathagata,

original: gnas skabs dang nyan pa dang / chos dag ngo bo nyid med cing rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir don dam par sangs rgyas kyis gnas skabs gang du yang ;
analyzed: gnas skabs dang nyan pa dang / chos dag ngo bo nyid med cing rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir don dam par sangs rgyas kyis gnas skabs gang du yang ;
translated: the teacher, the occasion, the listener, and the Dharma are essenceless and do not exist substantially. Therefore, in the ultimate truth, the Buddha has not taught anything to anyone at any time.

original: gang zag su la'ang chos 'ga' yang ma bstan pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: gang zag su la'ang chos 'ga' yang ma bstan pas pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus the opponent’s argument is shown to be pointless.

original: yang na / sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
analyzed: yang na / sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
translated: Or, the verse could be read as follows:🔽The Buddha has not taught anything🔽To anyone at any time anywhere.

original: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
analyzed: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
translated: I have not taught any Dharma to anyone.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: 'du byed rnams ni byed pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams ni byed pa med pa yin la /
translated: conditioned phenomena are devoid of activity.

original: 'du byed kyi tshogs zag pa med pa /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi tshogs zag pa med pa /
translated: The collection of conditioned phenomena that is uncontaminated,

original: sgrib pa gnyis spangs pa /
analyzed: sgrib pa gnyis spangs pa /
translated: free from the two obscurations,

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa ni sangs rgyas yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa ni sangs rgyas yin te /
translated: and the basis of the distinct qualities of a buddha is a buddha.

original: de la ni bya ba med pas ston par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang gang la bstan par bya ba de yang 'du byed kyi tshogs g-yo ba med pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yin pas nyan pa dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad med pas don dam par nyan pa dang 'dzin par byed pa med pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de la ni bya ba med pas ston par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang gang la bstan par bya ba de yang 'du byed kyi tshogs g-yo ba med pa zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa yin pas nyan pa dang 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad med pas don dam par nyan pa dang 'dzin par byed pa med pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Since there is no activity on the part of that buddha, it is not tenable that he teaches. And since the one to whom the Dharma is taught is a collection of conditioned phenomena that is unmoving, either contaminated or uncontaminated, there is no convention of listening or apprehending, and so ultimately there is no listening or apprehending.

original: gang du gang bstan par bya ba yang /
analyzed: gang du gang bstan par bya ba yang /
translated: And the one to whom the Dharma is taught and the one who teaches the Dharma are, in the ultimate sense, like a rabbit’s horns or a magical creation.

original: don dam par bong ba dang / sprul pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'du byed thams cad ni byed pa med pa yin la /
analyzed: don dam par bong ba dang / sprul pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni 'du byed thams cad ni byed pa med pa yin la /
translated: This is because all conditioned phenomena are devoid of activity.

original: ston pa dang nyan pa dang gnas skabs dang / chos dag kyang 'du byed kyi tshogs kyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ston pa dang nyan pa dang gnas skabs dang / chos dag kyang 'du byed kyi tshogs kyi khyad par yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The teacher, the listener, the occasion, and the Dharma are all particular instances of the collection of compounded phenomena.

original: don dam par sangs rgyas kyis gnas skabs gang du yang gang zag su la'ang chos 'ga' yang ma bstan pas /
analyzed: don dam par sangs rgyas kyis gnas skabs gang du yang gang zag su la'ang chos 'ga' yang ma bstan pas /
translated: Therefore, ultimately, the Buddha did not teach any Dharma to anyone at any time.

original: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the opponent’s reason is not established.

original: yang na / @265a * //
analyzed: yang na / @265a * //
translated: Or else,

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni dang du yang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni dang du yang //
translated: the Buddha did not teach

original: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
analyzed: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
translated: any Dharma to anyone at all.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis bsdus pa'i sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / nye bar bstsags pa dang yongs su smin par gyur pa rnams kyi rgyu'i mthu nyid las mos pa dang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang dang / byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis bsdus pa'i sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang / nye bar bstsags pa dang yongs su smin par gyur pa rnams kyi rgyu'i mthu nyid las mos pa dang /
translated: This is because of the power of his previous aspirations and because of the power of the cause of those sentient beings who have generated, accumulated, and ripened roots of virtue through being gathered by the four means of gathering.

original: dbang po dang bsam pa'i dbang gis chos ston pa zhes bya ba'i gsung sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa /
analyzed: dbang po dang bsam pa'i dbang gis chos ston pa zhes bya ba'i gsung sbyin pa la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa /
translated: The speech of the Buddha is the basis for generosity and so on, since it teaches the Dharma in accordance with the faculties and thoughts of beings.

original: yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa sems can thams cad yang dag par ma gu bar mdzad pa /
analyzed: yan lag drug cu dang ldan pa sems can thams cad yang dag par ma gu bar mdzad pa /
translated: It is endowed with sixty melodious qualities and it perfectly delights all sentient beings.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las lta bur 'byung gi / de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa mi mnga' ba rnams la 'jug pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las lta bur 'byung gi / de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa rtog pa dang dpyod pa mi mnga' ba rnams la 'jug pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The Buddha's speech arises like the Tathagata's activity, because it is not tenable that the Tathagata, who is always in equipoise, who is spontaneously accomplished and who has no thoughts or analysis, engages in speech.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam dang / sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis bsdus pa'i sems can yongs su smin pa rnams kyi rgyu'i mthu nyid las sems can gyi mos pa dang / dbang po dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam dang / sngon byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa na bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhis bsdus pa'i sems can yongs su smin pa rnams kyi rgyu'i mthu nyid las sems can gyi mos pa dang / dbang po dang /
translated: The Buddha's speech arises from the power of the cause, namely, the Tathagata's former aspirations and the sentient beings he gathered in the past when he was practicing bodhisattva conduct by means of the four means of gathering disciples.

original: bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung chos ston pa zhes bya ba phrin las lta bur byung bar zad kyi /
analyzed: bsam pa'i dbang gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung chos ston pa zhes bya ba phrin las lta bur byung bar zad kyi /
translated: Due to the power of thought, the Tathagata's speech is called the teaching of the Dharma, but it is merely an appearance like an action.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa la chos ston pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir don dam par sangs rgyas kyis gnas skabs gang du yang gang zag su la yang chos 'ga' yang ma bstan pas pha rol po dag gi gtan
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu mnyam par gzhag pa la chos ston pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir don dam par sangs rgyas kyis gnas skabs gang du yang gang zag su la yang chos 'ga' yang ma bstan pas pha rol po dag gi gtan
translated: Because the Tathagata, who is always in equipoise, does not engage in teaching the Dharma and so forth, ultimately the Buddha never taught any Dharma to anyone at any time.

original: tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du bstan to //

original: gal te sprul pa'i sangs rgyas la kun rdzob tu snying rje yod na de ni bsam pa thag pa'i snying rje ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te sprul pa'i sangs rgyas la kun rdzob tu snying rje yod na de ni bsam pa thag pa'i snying rje ma yin gyi /
translated: Thus, if the Buddha has conventional compassion, it is not compassion from the heart.

original: smad 'tshong ma ngu bar byed pa'i snying rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smad 'tshong ma ngu bar byed pa'i snying rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is like the compassion of a prostitute who weeps.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar smad 'tshong ma rnams kyi dud mo gang @267a * //🔽yin pa de ni kun rdzob tu 'phyon ma bdag brid pa'i phyir sgyu bag byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar smad 'tshong ma rnams kyi dud mo gang @267a * // yin pa de ni kun rdzob tu 'phyon ma bdag brid pa'i phyir sgyu bag byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The weeping of prostitutes🔽is not from the heart, but is pretense.

original: snying nas gcugs pas du ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snying nas gcugs pas du ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not from the heart, but is a pretense in order to deceive their clients.

original: stsogs pa'o zhes bya bas ni mu stegs can dag sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dang / theg pa chen po med pa dang / bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis mi 'dod pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas la kha zer pa'i tshig ca le co le rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las smra ba gzhan dag bsdu ste /
analyzed: stsogs pa'o zhes bya bas ni mu stegs can dag sangs rgyas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dang / theg pa chen po med pa dang / bden pa gnyis rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis mi 'dod pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas la kha zer pa'i tshig ca le co le rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las smra ba gzhan dag bsdu ste /
translated: The phrase “and so on” includes the statements of other schools that contradict the Buddha, such as the tīrthikas’ claim that the Buddha is not omniscient, that the Mahāyāna does not exist, and that the Buddha’s teachings on the two truths are not to be taken literally.

original: re zhig de dag ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par gzhan yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: re zhig de dag ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par gzhan yin par sbyar ro //
translated: These are some of the other specific factors that are discordant with emptiness.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to such statements, the author of the commentary here says:

original: de la 'dir don dam pa'i mtshan nyid med pas //
analyzed: de la 'dir don dam pa'i mtshan nyid med pas //
translated: In this regard, because the ultimate has no characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyang yod pa ma yin la theg pa chen po yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis sangs rgyas kyang yod pa ma yin la theg pa chen po yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: the Buddha does not exist by virtue of having a single characteristic, nor does the Mahāyāna exist.

original: don dam pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the ultimate is the domain of nondual wisdom.

original: kho bo cag gi tshul nyid smras par gyur to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi tshul nyid smras par gyur to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: We have spoken in accordance with the very way of things.

original: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba la chos ston pa mi mnga' bar ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni bcom ldan 'das rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' ba la chos ston pa mi mnga' bar ston te /
translated: This shows that the Lord, who is free from conceptualization, does not teach the Dharma.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi gzhung las don dam pa'i mtshan nyid med pas mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi gzhung las don dam pa'i mtshan nyid med pas mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis /
translated: For, in our scriptures, the ultimate is said to be a single reality because it has no characteristics.

original: don dam par sangs rgyas kyang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: don dam par sangs rgyas kyang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Thus, ultimately, there is no Buddha,

original: theg pa chen po yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: and there is no Great Vehicle.

original: don dam pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa ni gnyis su med pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The ultimate is the domain of nondual intuition.🔽Ultimately, the Buddha never taught any doctrine to anyone at any time.

original: don dam par sangs rgyas kyis gnas skabs gang du yang gang zag su la yang chos 'ga' yang ma bstan pas kho bo cag gi tshul de nyid kyis smras par gyur to //
analyzed: don dam par sangs rgyas kyis gnas skabs gang du yang gang zag su la yang chos 'ga' yang ma bstan pas kho bo cag gi tshul de nyid kyis smras par gyur to //
translated: Thus, we have spoken in accordance with the very way of things.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam par mi rtog pa las kyang sprul pa'i sku thams cad la phan 'dogs par bzod pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam par mi rtog pa las kyang sprul pa'i sku thams cad la phan 'dogs par bzod pa /
translated: The Tathāgata’s body is free from conceptualization, yet it is also capable of benefiting all beings through its emanations.

original: gzhan la phan pa dang / bde bsgrub pa'i thugs dam gyis yongs su bsgos pa nyid dang / sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang gis rnam pa thams cad du 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa dang / bde bsgrub pa'i thugs dam gyis yongs su bsgos pa nyid dang / sngon gyi smon lam gyi shugs kyi dbang gis rnam pa thams cad du 'byung ste /
translated: It arises in all ways due to the power of the force of former prayers and due to the complete pervasion of the mind of enlightenment, which is the wish to accomplish the benefit and happiness of others.

original: de la brten nas yi ge dang ngag dang tshig rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsung chos dang gang zag bdag med pa mu stegs byed dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa gsal bar mdzad pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir theg pa mchog gis @267b 'gro ba rnams la nye bar 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la brten nas yi ge dang ngag dang tshig rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsung chos dang gang zag bdag med pa mu stegs byed dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas thams cad dang thun mong ma yin pa gsal bar mdzad pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams yang dag par 'grub pa'i phyir theg pa mchog gis @267b 'gro ba rnams la nye bar 'byung ste /
translated: Based on that, the speech of the Buddha arises for beings who follow the supreme vehicle, in order to clearly reveal the Dharma, which has the characteristic of being in accord with letters, speech, and words, and the selflessness of persons and phenomena, which is not in common with all the tirthikas, sravakas, and pratyekabuddhas, and in order to perfectly accomplish the perfections.

original: de ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: de ni theg pa chen po zhes bya'o zhes bya bas ni /
translated: That is called the Mahayana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam par mi rtog pa las sprul pa'i sku thugs dam dang / smon lam gyi dbang gis byung ba de la brten nas yi ge dang dag dang / tshig rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsung ji skad smos pa dag 'byung ba de ni theg pa chen po yin pas sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa theg pa chen po yod par bstan to //🔽don dam pa'i sangs rgyas yod na bstan pa brjod pa'i gsung 'byung ba'i phyir ston pa yang bstan pa dag gi mdzad pa po nyid du 'dod pa kho na yin pas grags pa'i gnod pa yang med do zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku rnam par mi rtog pa las sprul pa'i sku thugs dam dang / smon lam gyi dbang gis byung ba de la brten nas yi ge dang dag dang / tshig rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gsung ji skad smos pa dag 'byung ba de ni theg pa chen po yin pas sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa theg pa chen po yod par bstan to // don dam pa'i sangs rgyas yod na bstan pa brjod pa'i gsung 'byung ba'i phyir ston pa yang bstan pa dag gi mdzad pa po nyid du 'dod pa kho na yin pas grags pa'i gnod pa yang med do zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas rnam par
translated: The emanation body that arises from the nonconceptual body of the Tathagata through the power of his aspirations and his commitments is the basis for the teaching of the Mahayana, since it is the Mahayana that is the teaching of the emanation body of the Buddha, which is characterized by letters, words, and phrases.🔽Since the teaching of the Mahayana is the teaching of the emanation body of the Buddha, and since the teaching of the Mahayana is the teaching of the ultimate Buddha, the teaching of the ultimate Buddha is the teaching of the emanation body of the Buddha.

original: mi rtog pa la brten nas sprul pa'i sku 'byung zhing de las bstan pa brjod pa'i gsung 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rtog pa la brten nas sprul pa'i sku 'byung zhing de las bstan pa brjod pa'i gsung 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: Since the teaching of the ultimate Buddha is the teaching of the emanation body of the Buddha, and since the teaching of the emanation body of the Buddha is the teaching of the ultimate Buddha, the teaching of the ultimate Buddha is the teaching of the emanation body of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bstan pa dag gi mdzad pa po nyid du 'dod pas ;
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams bstan pa dag gi mdzad pa po nyid du 'dod pas ;
translated: Since the Bhagavan Buddhas are asserted to be the agents of the teachings,

original: don dam par sangs rgyas kyis chos ma bstan kyang tha snyad du bstan pa yod pas grags pa'i gnod pa yang med par bstan to //
analyzed: don dam par sangs rgyas kyis chos ma bstan kyang tha snyad du bstan pa yod pas grags pa'i gnod pa yang med par bstan to //
translated: even though the Buddha did not teach the dharma ultimately, he did so conventionally, and thus the objection that it is renowned otherwise is also refuted.

original: ji ste yang la la 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni /
analyzed: ji ste yang la la 'di snyam du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni /
translated: But if someone thought that the teachings of the Tathagata

original: byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog pa can dang ldan pa yin te sgra'i mtshan nyid yin na /🔽gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog pa can dang ldan pa yin te sgra'i mtshan nyid yin na / gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: are the teachings of an agent who possesses discursive thought, because they are characterized by sound,🔽like the teachings of the sravakas and so on, which arise due to the power of the thoughts of others,

original: dper na nyan thos la sogs pa'i bstan pa bzhin no snyam du sems na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni byed pa po rnam par rtog pa can dang ldan pa yin pas /
analyzed: dper na nyan thos la sogs pa'i bstan pa bzhin no snyam du sems na zhes bya ba ni pha rol po dag na re de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa ni byed pa po rnam par rtog pa can dang ldan pa yin pas /
translated: then the response to that is stated in the following.

original: sangs rgyas rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bstan pa theg pa chen po yod par mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bstan pa theg pa chen po yod par mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: The words of the opponent are: “It is not possible that the teaching of the Buddha, the Great Vehicle, is without conceptualization.”

original: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag ni chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The subject, the probandum, the probative property, and the example are to be applied in order.

original: dper na nyan thos la sogs pa'i bstan pa ni sgra'i mtshan nyid nyid yin na gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de 'byung ba'i phyir byed pa po nyan thos la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa can dang ldan pa yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i
analyzed: dper na nyan thos la sogs pa'i bstan pa ni sgra'i mtshan nyid nyid yin na gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de 'byung ba'i phyir byed pa po nyan thos la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa can dang ldan pa yin pa de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i
translated: For example, the teaching of the śrāvakas and so on is characterized by sound, and because it arises by the power of the intention of others, the conceptualizing śrāvakas and so on are the agents.🔽In the same way, the teaching of the Tathāgata

original: bstan pa yang sgra'i mtshan nyid nyid yin na /
analyzed: bstan pa yang sgra'i mtshan nyid nyid yin na /
translated: is also characterized by sound.

original: gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de 'byung ba'i phyir byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog @268a * //🔽pa can dang ldan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de 'byung ba'i phyir byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog @268a * //🔽pa can dang ldan pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because it arises by the power of the intention of others, the Tathāgata is the conceptualizing agent.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of this commentary says:

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: sprul pas bstan pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: sprul pas bstan pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because it is not definite by the teachings of emanations.

original: 'dis ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid du ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs de ma nges pa nyid du ston te /
translated: This shows that the reason of the opponent is not definite.🔽If this is the definition of the teachings of emanations, then it is seen that the creator is not endowed with conceptuality, even though it arises by the power of the thought of another.

original: 'di ni sprul pa dag gi bstan pa sgra'i mtshan nyid nyid yin na gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de 'byung yang byed pa po rnam par rtog pa can ma yin pa dang ldan par mthong bas des na ji re zhig sgra'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di ni sprul pa dag gi bstan pa sgra'i mtshan nyid nyid yin na gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de 'byung yang byed pa po rnam par rtog pa can ma yin pa dang ldan par mthong bas des na ji re zhig sgra'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: Therefore, if it is the definition of sound,

original: gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: then it arises by the power of the thought of another.

original: dper na nyan thos la sogs pa'i bstan pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog pa can dang ldan pa yin na /
analyzed: dper na nyan thos la sogs pa'i bstan pa bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog pa can dang ldan pa yin na /
translated: For example, if the teachings of the Tathagata are like the teachings of sravakas and so on, then the creator of the teachings of the Tathagata is the Tathagata, who is endowed with conceptuality.

original: 'on te sgra'i mtshan nyid nyid yin na gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te sgra'i mtshan nyid nyid yin na gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dbang gis de 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: But if it is the characteristic of sound, then the teaching would arise by the power of the thought of another.

original: dper na spul pas bstan pa dag bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog pa can ma yin pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na spul pas bstan pa dag bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa byed pa po de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par rtog pa can ma yin pa dang ldan par 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Then the one who teaches, the Tathāgata, would be endowed with conceptualization, just like the teaching of the Tathāgata that is indicated by the sound.

original: pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no //🔽'dis ni rnam par mi rtog pa la bstan pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa de ni rigs pa ma yin no // 'dis ni rnam par mi rtog pa la bstan pa mi rung ste /
translated: Therefore the proof of the opponent is not reasonable.🔽This also refutes the argument that the teaching is untenable in the absence of conceptualization,🔽because it is nonconceptual, like a donkey.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na bong ba bzhin no zhes rjes su dpog pa la yang skyon gyis lan btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sprul pas bstan pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i skabs 'dis ni gal
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na bong ba bzhin no zhes rjes su dpog pa la yang skyon gyis lan btab pa yin no zhes bya ba ni sprul pas bstan pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i skabs 'dis ni gal
translated: This section shows that the teaching is not definite because of the teaching of emanations.

original: te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa la bstan pa yod par mi rung ste /
analyzed: te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa la bstan pa yod par mi rung ste /
translated: If the opponent says, “The teaching is not tenable in the absence of conceptualization in the Buddha,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na bong ba bzhin no zhes rjes su dpog pa la yang snga ma bzhin du ma nges pa'i skyon gyis lan btab pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na bong ba bzhin no zhes rjes su dpog pa la yang snga ma bzhin du ma nges pa'i skyon gyis lan btab pa yin te /
translated: Because it is nonconceptual, it is like a clod of earth.🔽But just as it is possible to demonstrate that a nonconceptual emanation is a buddha,

original: 'di sprul pa rnam par mi rtog pa la yang bstan pa rung bar mthong bas /
analyzed: 'di sprul pa rnam par mi rtog pa la yang bstan pa rung bar mthong bas /
translated: so it is possible to demonstrate that a buddha is nonconceptual.

original: des na je re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir /🔽dper na sprul pa bzhin du sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa la bstan par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: des na je re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir / dper na sprul pa bzhin du sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa la bstan par 'gyur ram /
translated: So is it that because it is nonconceptual,🔽it is like an emanation that a buddha is nonconceptual?

original: 'on te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na bong ba bzhin du sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa la bstan pa mi rung bar 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir dper na bong ba bzhin du sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa la bstan pa mi rung bar 'gyur ba ma nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Or is it that because it is nonconceptual, it is like a clod of earth that it is impossible to demonstrate that a buddha is nonconceptual?

original: pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pha rol po dag gi sgrub pa de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is uncertain, the opponent’s proof is illogical.

original: gtan tshigs kyi don rang la ma grub pa nyid kyang yin @268b no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de pha rol po dag rang la ma grub ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don rang la ma grub pa nyid kyang yin @268b no zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag gi gtan tshigs rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de pha rol po dag rang la ma grub ste /
translated: The phrase “the meaning of the reason is not established for you” means that the reason “because of being nonconceptual” is not established for the opponent.

original: pha rol po dag la sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol po dag la sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is not established for the opponent because the opponent does not accept that buddhas are nonconceptual.🔽The opponent might respond, “The reason is not not established for us because the reason is established for the other party.”

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa gtan tshigs nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes phyir zlog par byed na yang lan snga ma bzhin no zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa gtan tshigs nyid yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no zhes phyir zlog par byed na yang lan snga ma bzhin no zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The response to this is the same as the previous one.

original: gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag rang gi phyogs la sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du ma grub kyang khyed dbu ma pa'i phyogs la sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du grub pa gtan tshigs nyid yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: gal te pha rol po dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag rang gi phyogs la sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du ma grub kyang khyed dbu ma pa'i phyogs la sangs rgyas rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du grub pa gtan tshigs nyid yin pa'i phyir
translated: The opponent might respond, “Although we do not establish the nonconceptuality of buddhas in our own system, the nonconceptuality of buddhas is established for you Mādhyamikas. Therefore it is a reason.

original: ; kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ; kho bo cag gi gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Our reason is not unestablished.

original: rang la gtan tshigs ma grub pas kyang 'dod pa'i don ston par byed de /
analyzed: rang la gtan tshigs ma grub pas kyang 'dod pa'i don ston par byed de /
translated: Even though the reason is not established for us, it does establish the desired meaning,

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos bzhin no zhes phyir zlog par byed na yang /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos bzhin no zhes phyir zlog par byed na yang /
translated: because it is established for the other party, just like a property that is acknowledged by both parties.

original: de'i lan ni sngar bdag dang chos brtag pa'i skabs su gzhan gyi phyogs 'ba' zhig la grags pa'i phyogs kyi chos kyis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don bsgrub mi nus par nges par bzung ste /
analyzed: de'i lan ni sngar bdag dang chos brtag pa'i skabs su gzhan gyi phyogs 'ba' zhig la grags pa'i phyogs kyi chos kyis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don bsgrub mi nus par nges par bzung ste /
translated: The response to this is as follows: In the chapter on the examination of the self and phenomena, it was ascertained that a property of the position that is acknowledged by the other party alone cannot establish the meaning of the probandum.

original: gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir /

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la ma grub pa bzhin pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la ma grub pa bzhin pas /
translated: it is just like the nonestablishment for the other party.

original: rjes su dpag pa 'gal bas bzlog pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid nyams pa med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'gal bas bzlog pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid nyams pa med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the inference is contradicted, the reason is not undermined by the nonestablishment of the meaning of the reason.

original: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas ni don dam par sangs rgyas las gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir tha snyad pa'i sangs rgyas nyid zlog par mi byed do zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag na re don dam pa'i sangs rgyas kyis chos bstan🔽pa ma byas pa'i phyir theg pa chen po mi rung ngo zhes gang smras pa de yang sprul pa'i sangs rgyas ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas las gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyis
analyzed: sprul pa'i sangs rgyas ni don dam par sangs rgyas las gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir tha snyad pa'i sangs rgyas nyid zlog par mi byed do zhes bya bas ni pha rol po dag na re don dam pa'i sangs rgyas kyis chos bstan pa ma byas pa'i phyir theg pa chen po mi rung ngo zhes gang smras pa de yang sprul pa'i sangs rgyas ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas las gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir don dam pa'i sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sangs rgyas kyis
translated: The emanation Buddha is not to be expressed as other than the ultimate Buddha, therefore, the conventional Buddha is not refuted.🔽This is because the opponent says that the Mahayana is not tenable because the ultimate Buddha does not teach the Dharma.

original: chos bstan pa bzlog par mi byed de /
analyzed: chos bstan pa bzlog par mi byed de /
translated: The emanation Buddha is not to be expressed as other than the ultimate Buddha, therefore, the teaching of the Dharma by the emanation Buddha of the ultimate Buddha is not refuted.

original: 'di ltar kun rdzob tu bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa'i skus sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun rdzob tu bcom ldan 'das kyi sprul pa'i skus sems can gyi don mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the emanation body of the Bhagavat performs the welfare of sentient beings conventionally.

original: des bstan pa yang zlog par mi byed do //
analyzed: des bstan pa yang zlog par mi byed do //
translated: His teaching is also not refuted.

original: don dam par sangs rgyas ni gsung gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang tha snyad du mdzad pa po nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas de tha snyad du chos bstan pa yang @269a * //
analyzed: don dam par sangs rgyas ni gsung gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang tha snyad du mdzad pa po nyid du grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni don dam pa'i sangs rgyas de tha snyad du chos bstan pa yang @269a * //
translated: Because ultimately the Buddha is the cause of speech, and conventionally he is established as the agent of teaching.

original: zlog par mi byed de //
analyzed: zlog par mi byed de //
translated: This does not refute the teaching of the Dharma conventionally.

original: chos kyi sku ni gsung gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du chos ston pa'i mdzad pa po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: chos kyi sku ni gsung gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du chos ston pa'i mdzad pa po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes ston to //
translated: Because the Dharma Body is the cause of speech, and because the agent of teaching the Dharma conventionally is not established.

original: re zhig de dag gis ni sngar pha rol po dag gis //
analyzed: re zhig de dag gis ni sngar pha rol po dag gis //
translated: Up to this point, the opponent’s position has been stated.

original: sangs rgyas rnam rtog med pa yi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam rtog med pa yi //
translated: The Buddha is not without conceptualization,

original: theg pa chen po mi rung ste //
analyzed: theg pa chen po mi rung ste //
translated: Because the Mahayana is not tenable,

original: gang phyir don dam sangs rgyas kyis //
analyzed: gang phyir don dam sangs rgyas kyis //
