original: chos ni bstan pa ma byas phyir //
analyzed: chos ni bstan pa ma byas phyir //
translated: Does not teach the Dharma.

original: sprul sangs rgyas kyi 'ang mi rung ste //
analyzed: sprul sangs rgyas kyi 'ang mi rung ste //
translated: The emanation Buddha is not tenable,

original: de la sems la sogs med phyir //
analyzed: de la sems la sogs med phyir //
translated: Because he does not have mind and so on.

original: de phyir sprul pa'ang sangs rgyas min //
analyzed: de phyir sprul pa'ang sangs rgyas min //
translated: Therefore the emanation is not the Buddha,

original: des ni chos kyang bstan ma byas //
analyzed: des ni chos kyang bstan ma byas //
translated: And he does not teach the Dharma.

original: zhes smras pa'i sgrub pa dag sun dbyung ba ci rigs par bstan to //
analyzed: zhes smras pa'i sgrub pa dag sun dbyung ba ci rigs par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the arguments that the opponent has stated have been refuted in the appropriate manner.

original: da ni sngar pha rol po dag gis //
analyzed: da ni sngar pha rol po dag gis //
translated: Now, previously the opponent said:

original: don dam du ni mi rtog pa'i //
analyzed: don dam du ni mi rtog pa'i //
translated: In the ultimate, compassion

original: stong la snying rje mi 'dod do //🔽gang la snying rje byed pa yi //
analyzed: stong la snying rje mi 'dod do // gang la snying rje byed pa yi //
translated: is not asserted for the empty.🔽Since there are no sentient beings

original: sems can med phyir sangs rgyas med //
analyzed: sems can med phyir sangs rgyas med //
translated: to be compassionate toward, there is no buddha.

original: gal te kun rdzob snying rje yod //🔽smad 'tshong ngu bar byed dang 'dra //
analyzed: gal te kun rdzob snying rje yod // smad 'tshong ngu bar byed dang 'dra //
translated: If there is compassion in the conventional,🔽it is like the weeping of a prostitute.

original: smad 'tshong rnams kyi dud mo gang //
analyzed: smad 'tshong rnams kyi dud mo gang //
translated: The weeping of prostitutes

original: de ni kun rdzob snying nas min //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob snying nas min //
translated: is not from the depths of their hearts.

original: zhes smras pa'i sgrub pa dag sun dbyung ba ci rigs par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes smras pa'i sgrub pa dag sun dbyung ba ci rigs par bstan par bya ste /
translated: Thus, the arguments that the opponent has stated have been refuted in the appropriate manner.

original: de'i phyir don dam par ni de bzhin gshegs pa la spros pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par ni de bzhin gshegs pa la spros pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in the ultimate, since the Tathāgata is free from mental fabrication,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje mi mnga' ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thugs rje mi mnga' ba'am /
translated: the Tathāgata would be devoid of compassion.

original: thugs rje dang ldan pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / thugs rje dang thugs rje'i gnas sems can med pa'i phyir thugs rje yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: thugs rje dang ldan pa'o zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / thugs rje dang thugs rje'i gnas sems can med pa'i phyir thugs rje yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Because the Tathāgata is free from the conceptual elaborations of the thought “I have compassion,” and because compassion and sentient beings who are the objects of compassion do not exist, compassion does not exist.

original: de dang ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa yang yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: And because the Tathāgata does not exist, one who possesses compassion does not exist.

original: 'di yang kho bo cag gi tshul nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'di yang kho bo cag gi tshul nyid gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore this passage also clarifies our own standpoint.

original: des ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa la spros pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / thugs rje dang sems can dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des ni don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa la spros pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir dang / thugs rje dang sems can dmigs su med pa'i phyir /
translated: This passage teaches that ultimately the Tathāgata is free from conceptual elaborations and compassion and sentient beings who are the objects of compassion are not observed.

original: khyed na re don dam par rnam par mi rtog pa'i sangs rgyas la stong pa nyid rtog pa'i ye shes dang / thugs rje yod par mi 'dod do zhes zer ba de kho bo cag gi tshul gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: khyed na re don dam par rnam par mi rtog pa'i sangs rgyas la stong pa nyid rtog pa'i ye shes dang / thugs rje yod par mi 'dod do zhes zer ba de kho bo cag gi tshul gsal bar byed pa yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: You say that ultimately you do not assert that the nonconceptual buddha has the gnosis that conceives of emptiness and compassion. This is a clarification of our own standpoint.

original: kun rdzob tu ni kho bo cag la sems can dang thugs rje yang yod pas /
analyzed: kun rdzob tu ni kho bo cag la sems can dang thugs rje yang yod pas /
translated: But conventionally we do assert that sentient beings and compassion exist.

original: gzhi de las bcom ldan 'das kyang yod de de'i dbang gis sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba rnam pa sna tshogs sgrub pa'i thugs dam bzhes pa yin par 'dod do zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob tu sprul pa'i sangs rgyas la bsam pa thag pa nas sems can la dgongs pa'i thugs @269b rje mnga' bar bstan to //
analyzed: gzhi de las bcom ldan 'das kyang yod de de'i dbang gis sems can la phan pa dang / bde ba rnam pa sna tshogs sgrub pa'i thugs dam bzhes pa yin par 'dod do zhes bya bas ni kun rdzob tu sprul pa'i sangs rgyas la bsam pa thag pa nas sems can la dgongs pa'i thugs @269b rje mnga' bar bstan to //
translated: The Bhagavat exists in that basis, and by his power, he has the intention to accomplish the various kinds of benefit and happiness for sentient beings. This shows that the emanation Buddha has compassion for sentient beings from the depths of his mind in the conventional sense.

original: de la thugs rje ni gzhan sdug bsngal bas thugs thag pa nas sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: de la thugs rje ni gzhan sdug bsngal bas thugs thag pa nas sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: Compassion is the characteristic of being pained in mind from the suffering of others.

original: dper na ma bu la byams pa bu gcig po la ji lta ba bzhin du sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang sems can thams cad la de bzhin no zhes bya bas ni thugs rje'i mtshan nyid bstan to //

translated: Just as a mother loves her only child, so the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas are like that for all sentient beings. This shows the characteristic of compassion.

original: gal te smad 'tshong ma la yod par gyur na yang de la mi dgar ci yod ces bya bas ni khyed na re gal te sprul pa'i sangs rgyas la kun rdzob tu snying rje yod na ni bsam pa thag pa'i snying rje ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te smad 'tshong ma la yod par gyur na yang de la mi dgar ci yod ces bya bas ni khyed na re gal te sprul pa'i sangs rgyas la kun rdzob tu snying rje yod na ni bsam pa thag pa'i snying rje ma yin gyi /
translated: This is saying that if the Buddha’s compassion were conventional, then it would not be compassion from the depths of his heart,

analyzed: smad 'tshong ma ngu bar byed pa'i snying rje dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes zer na /

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rje ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: The compassion of the Tathāgata is not like that.

original: gzhan sdug bsngal bas thugs thag pa nas sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan sdug bsngal bas thugs thag pa nas sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i mtshan nyid de /
translated: It is characterized by the suffering that comes from the depths of his heart at the suffering of others.

analyzed: gal te kun rdzob tu smad 'tshong ma la snying rje de lta bu yod par gyur na yang /

analyzed: de kun rdzob tu thugs rje mnga' ba smad du mi rung ngo zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that it is not right to disparage the conventional compassion of the Buddha.

original: de lta mod kyi spu'i khung bu dang nam mkha'i khams dag mtshan nyid 'drar zin kyang khyad par shin tu che ba bzhin bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs rje yang smad 'tshong ma'i dud mo lta bu ma yin te /

translated: If you

translated: Therefore, when the tīrthikas utter the foul-smelling, stinking words of their hatred,🔽they reveal their own evil nature.

translated: This shows the fault of the tīrthikas, who are evil, who are devoid of eloquence, who follow bad ways, and who speak words that are censured because their philosophy is flawed.

analyzed: 'dir nyan thos kyi theg pa pa dag na re theg pa chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin te /
translated: Here the hearers say, “The Mahāyāna is not the word of the Buddha,

analyzed: sde pa bco brgyad kyi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir dper na grangs can la sogs pa'i bstan pa bzhin no zhes zer ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don kyang ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: because it is not included among the eighteen schools, like the teachings of the Sāṃkhya and so on.” The meaning of that reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar dge 'dun phal chen sde nyid kyi sde snod kyi gzhi chen po zhes bya ba'i khongs su theg pa chen po 'di yang gtogs te /🔽de nas sa bcu pa'i mdo dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid dag 'byung ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun phal chen sde nyid kyi shar gyi ri bo'i sde dang nub kyi ri bo'i sde dag las kyang 'phral skad du /
analyzed: 'di ltar dge 'dun phal chen sde nyid kyi sde snod kyi gzhi chen po zhes bya ba'i khongs su theg pa chen po 'di yang gtogs te / de nas sa bcu pa'i mdo dang pha rol tu phyin pa'i mtshan nyid dag 'byung ba'i phyir dang / dge 'dun phal chen sde nyid kyi shar gyi ri bo'i sde dang nub kyi ri bo'i sde dag las kyang 'phral skad du /
translated: Thus, the Mahayana is included in the Mahavibhāṣā,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i mdo dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa theg pa chen po'i mdo dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Daśabhūmika Sūtra and the characteristics of the perfections are found there, and because the Mahāsāṃghika’s Pūrvaśailas and Aparaśailas also contain Mahāyāna sūtras such as the Prajñāpāramitā.

original: gzhan yang sde pa thams cad kyi sde snod gsum @270b po dag gcig gis gcig la mi snang ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang sde pa thams cad kyi sde snod gsum @270b po dag gcig gis gcig la mi snang ste /
translated: Moreover, the three piṭakas of all the sects do not appear in each other’s scriptures.

original: 'di ltar kha cig la ni dge slong nad pa la dus ma yin pa'i zas gnang ba snang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar kha cig la ni dge slong nad pa la dus ma yin pa'i zas gnang ba snang la /
translated: Thus, for some, the allowance of untimely food for sick monks appears,🔽but for others, it does not appear.

original: kha cig la ni mi snang ba dang / kha cig la ni dus ma yin par bu ram zar gnang ba snang la kha cig la mi snang ba dang / kha cig la ni mtshan mo bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang ; gnas gcig na lhan cig nyal bar gnang ba snang la /
analyzed: kha cig la ni mi snang ba dang / kha cig la ni dus ma yin par bu ram zar gnang ba snang la kha cig la mi snang ba dang / kha cig la ni mtshan mo bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang ; gnas gcig na lhan cig nyal bar gnang ba snang la /
translated: Some sūtras appear to teach that the Buddha did not appear to some beings, that he gave permission to eat sugarcane out of season, that he gave permission to sleep together with a woman in the same room, and so on.

original: kha cig la mi snang ba de dag ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: kha cig la mi snang ba de dag ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: But these do not appear in other sūtras. How could these not be the word of the Buddha?

original: mdo sde dang chos mngon pa yang kha cig la ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / nam mkha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / so sor brtags pa dang / ma brtags par 'gog pa dag yod par 'dod la kha cig la ni med par 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: mdo sde dang chos mngon pa yang kha cig la ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / nam mkha' dang / de bzhin nyid dang / so sor brtags pa dang / ma brtags par 'gog pa dag yod par 'dod la kha cig la ni med par 'dod pa dang /
translated: Some sūtras and abhidharma texts assert that the past, future, space, suchness, analytical cessations, and nonanalytical cessations exist, but others do not assert this.

original: kha cig la ni de la gang zag bdag med pa nyid snang la kha cig la ni mi snang ba de dag ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid ma yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: kha cig la ni de la gang zag bdag med pa nyid snang la kha cig la ni mi snang ba de dag ji ltar sangs rgyas kyi bka' nyid ma yin par 'gyur /
translated: Some sūtras appear to teach that there is no self of persons, but others do not teach this. How could these not be the word of the Buddha?

original: gzhan yang theg pa chen po 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa sh'a-kya thub pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par drungs phyung ba shes bya mtha' dag thugs su chud pa'i zhal gyi pad ma nas nges par🔽byung ba yin par gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang theg pa chen po 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa sh'a-kya thub pa nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa bag chags dang bcas pa ma lus par drungs phyung ba shes bya mtha' dag thugs su chud pa'i zhal gyi pad ma nas nges par byung ba yin par gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, this Mahayana was definitely spoken from the lotus mouth of the Tathagata Shakyamuni, who completely eradicated all afflictive obscurations and all cognitive obscurations together with their latent tendencies and who comprehended all objects of knowledge.

original: sde pa bzhi po dag gi khongs su gtogs par 'byung ba nyid du kho bos brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sde pa bzhi po dag gi khongs su gtogs par 'byung ba nyid du kho bos brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: It should be accepted as the word of the Buddha because I have said that it occurs within the four schools of tenets.

original: dper na 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, it is like the eightfold noble path.

original: ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni sde pa bzhi po dag gi khongs su gtogs par 'byung ba nyid du kho bos brjod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab yin pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po yang sde pa bzhi po dag gi khongs🔽su gtogs par 'byung ba nyid du kho bos brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ni sde pa bzhi po dag gi khongs su gtogs par 'byung ba nyid du kho bos brjod pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab yin pa de bzhin du theg pa chen po yang sde pa bzhi po dag gi khongs🔽su gtogs par 'byung ba nyid du kho bos brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as I have said that the eightfold noble path is the word of the Buddha because it occurs within the four schools of tenets, in the same way, I have said that the Mahayana is the word of the Buddha because it occurs within the four schools of tenets.

original: sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no //
translated: It is the word of the Buddha.

original: gzhan yang dge 'dun phal chen sde pa dag gi 'jig rten 'das smra sde'i sde snod kyi gzhi chen po las theg pa chen po'i ma mo dang / sa bcu pa'i mdo la sogs pa phal cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge 'dun phal chen sde pa dag gi 'jig rten 'das smra sde'i sde snod kyi gzhi chen po las theg pa chen po'i ma mo dang / sa bcu pa'i mdo la sogs pa phal cher 'byung ste /
translated: Moreover, the great basis of the canon of the Lokottaravada branch of the Mahasanghika school contains most of the Mahayana sutras, such as the Mother of Conquerors and the Dashabhumika Sutra.

original: de dag sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin na sde pa bzhi po dag gi khongs su mi gtogs shing /
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas kyi bka' ma yin na sde pa bzhi po dag gi khongs su mi gtogs shing /
translated: If these were not the word of the Buddha, they would not be included in the four schools.

original: sde pa dag kyang dper na rang bzhin dang skyes bu dang / de kho na nyi shu rtsa lnga dag bzhin du klog par mi 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin pas /
analyzed: sde pa dag kyang dper na rang bzhin dang skyes bu dang / de kho na nyi shu rtsa lnga dag bzhin du klog par mi 'gyur ba zhig na de lta ma yin pas /
translated: And the schools would not recite them, just as they do not recite the twenty five principles of the Samkhya and the Purva Mimamsa.

original: theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no //
analyzed: theg pa chen po sangs rgyas kyi bka' yin no //
translated: Therefore the Mahayana is the word of the Buddha.

original: gzhan yang gang gi phyir gang zag gnyis la phyag @271a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang gi phyir gang zag gnyis la phyag @271a * //
translated: Moreover, it is said that two people should be respected:

original: bya ste ; de bzhin gshegs pa dang / dge slong ches rgan pa la'o zhes 'byung bas /
analyzed: bya ste ; de bzhin gshegs pa dang / dge slong ches rgan pa la'o zhes 'byung bas /
translated: the Tathagata and the most senior monk.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni phyag bya ba'i 'os pa ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni phyag bya ba'i 'os pa ma yin no zhes gang smras pa de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also illogical to say that bodhisattvas are not worthy of homage.

original: 'di ltar lnga pa dag skyon med pa la zhugs pas dge slong nyid yin pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa thob cing skyon med pa la zhugs pa nyid kyi dge slong nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar lnga pa dag skyon med pa la zhugs pas dge slong nyid yin pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang sa rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa thob cing skyon med pa la zhugs pa nyid kyi dge slong nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, just as the five are monks because they have entered the faultless state, so too bodhisattvas are monks because they have attained the ground of joy and so on and have entered the faultless state.

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Moreover, the Bhagavān has said:

original: rgyan gyis brgyan kyang chos la spyod 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: rgyan gyis brgyan kyang chos la spyod 'gyur zhing //
translated: Even if adorned with ornaments, they practice the Dharma.

original: zhi zhing dul la legs sdom tshangs spyod la //
analyzed: zhi zhing dul la legs sdom tshangs spyod la //
translated: Peaceful, disciplined, well restrained, celibate,

original: 'byung po kun la dbyug pa spangs gyur na //
analyzed: 'byung po kun la dbyug pa spangs gyur na //
translated: having abandoned the stick with regard to all beings,

original: de ni bram ze dge sbyong dge slong yin //
analyzed: de ni bram ze dge sbyong dge slong yin //
translated: they are brahmans, spiritual practitioners, and monks.

original: zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: He also said this.

original: gzhan yang sde snod kyi gzhi chen po de nyid las byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la zhugs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin du mchod pas mchod par bya zhing de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin du phyag bya bar 'os pa yin no zhes kyang 'byung ngo
analyzed: gzhan yang sde snod kyi gzhi chen po de nyid las byang chub sems dpa' sa brgyad pa la zhugs pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin du mchod pas mchod par bya zhing de bzhin gshegs pa bzhin du phyag bya bar 'os pa yin no zhes kyang 'byung ngo
translated: “A bodhisattva who has entered the eighth level should be worshipped like a tathagata and should be revered like a tathagata.”

original: // zhar la bshad pas chog go //
analyzed: // zhar la bshad pas chog go //
translated: Enough with this digression.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: Yogacaras say:

original: dmigs pa thams cad nyer zhi zhing //
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad nyer zhi zhing //
translated: All objects of observation are completely pacified.

original: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba ste //🔽sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
analyzed: spros pa nyer zhi zhi ba ste // sangs rgyas kyis ni gang du yang //
translated: Pacification of elaborations is peace.🔽The Buddha did not teach

original: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
analyzed: su la'ang chos 'ga' ma bstan to //
translated: any dharma to anyone anywhere.

original: zhes bya ba ni bden na de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs gzhan gyi dbang la skur pa 'debs pa de ni mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bden na de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs gzhan gyi dbang la skur pa 'debs pa de ni mi rung ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If that is true, then it is not correct to deprecate the dependent nature, which is the method for realizing that.

original: 'dir rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re lung las dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa de ni bden na /
analyzed: 'dir rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re lung las dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa bka' stsal pa de ni bden na /
translated: Here, the Yogacaras say: It is true that a scripture says, “The pacification of all objectification,” and so on.

original: khyed dbu ma pas de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs gzhan gyi dbang gis mtshan nyid la skur pa btab pa de ni mi rung ste /🔽'di ltar dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs na byis pa rnams kyis kun brtags pa'i dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin te /
analyzed: khyed dbu ma pas de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs gzhan gyi dbang gis mtshan nyid la skur pa btab pa de ni mi rung ste / 'di ltar dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs na byis pa rnams kyis kun brtags pa'i dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin te /
translated: But it is not correct for you Madhyamikas to deprecate the characteristic of dependent origination by means of another dependent origination that is a means of understanding that.🔽For the pacification of all objectification is the pacification of all the objectifications imagined by the naive when they realize the reality of the perfected nature.

original: dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs ni gang la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa de la de kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral zhing rnam par dag pa na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs ni gang la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa de la de kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral zhing rnam par dag pa na yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid du
translated: The means of understanding that pacification of all objectification is that when the dependent nature is devoid of the imagined nature and is pure, it is the perfected nature.

original: gyur pa ni dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin pa gang la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med pa de la gang zhig dag pas yongs @271b su grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gyur pa ni dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin pa gang la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med pa de la gang zhig dag pas yongs @271b su grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Since the dependent nature does not exist, what is purified to become the perfected nature?

original: de bas na dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs gzhan gyi dbang la skur pa 'debs pa de ni mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs gzhan gyi dbang la skur pa 'debs pa de ni mi rung ngo zhes zer ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement “It is not correct to repudiate the dependent nature, the means of understanding the pacification of all objectifications” is the response to that.

original: de ni rung na /
analyzed: de ni rung na /
translated: If that is correct,

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: ngo bo nyid gsum shes par bya //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum shes par bya //
translated: The three natures should be understood.

original: dang po kun du brtags pa yin //
analyzed: dang po kun du brtags pa yin //
translated: The first is the imagined.

original: gnyis pa gzhan gyi dbang yin te //
analyzed: gnyis pa gzhan gyi dbang yin te //
translated: The second is the dependent.

original: tha ma yongs su grub pa yin //
analyzed: tha ma yongs su grub pa yin //
translated: The third is the perfected.🔽Because of the characteristic, arising,

original: mtshan nyid de bzhin skye ba dang // don dam ngo bo nyid med pas //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de bzhin skye ba dang // don dam ngo bo nyid med pas //
translated: and ultimate naturelessness,🔽the three natures

original: ngo bo nyid ni gsum po dag / ngo bo nyid med nyid du 'dod //🔽ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gsum po dag / ngo bo nyid med nyid du 'dod //🔽ces bya ba smras te /
translated: are asserted to be natureless.

original: theg pa chen po 'di la rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i lugs kyis ngo bo nyid gsum po yod par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: theg pa chen po 'di la rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i lugs kyis ngo bo nyid gsum po yod par shes par bya ste /
translated: In this Great Vehicle, one should understand that there are three natures according to the Yogācāra system.

original: dang po ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin /
analyzed: dang po ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin /
translated: The first is the imagined nature.

original: gnyis pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin /
translated: The second is the dependent nature.

original: tha ma ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: tha ma ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: The third is the perfected nature.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum po de dag kyang chos ldas bsdus te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum po de dag kyang chos ldas bsdus te /
translated: These three natures are included in ten topics.

original: ming dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ; de bzhin nyid kyis so //
analyzed: ming dang / rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang ; de bzhin nyid kyis so //
translated: Name, sign, conceptualization, correct knowing, and reality.

original: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ming gis bsdus la /
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni ming gis bsdus la /
translated: Among them, the imagined nature is included in name.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pas bsdus /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pas bsdus /
translated: The dependent nature is included in sign and conceptualization.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid kyis bsdus so //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid kyis bsdus so //
translated: The perfected nature is included in correct knowing and reality.

original: ngo bo nyid gsum po de dag kyang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gsum gyis go rims bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum po de dag kyang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gsum gyis go rims bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, those three natures are respectively devoid of nature by way of the three non-natures.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin la /
translated: The imagined nature is devoid of nature by way of the non-nature of character.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin /
translated: The dependent nature is devoid of nature by way of the non-nature of production.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ni don dam pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no //
translated: The thoroughly established nature is devoid of nature by way of the non-nature of the ultimate.

original: de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du ming dang brdar sgro btags pa gang yin pa de ni ming dang brdar sgro btags par zad kyi /
analyzed: de la mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du ming dang brdar sgro btags pa gang yin pa de ni ming dang brdar sgro btags par zad kyi /
translated: Among them, the non-nature of character is the non-nature of the imagined nature. That which is the nature and the differentiations of phenomena that are imputed by names and signs is only imputed by names and signs.

original: ji ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin pas mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin pas mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Since it does not exist as it appears, it is realityless by the realitylessness of characteristics.

original: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gzhi gang yin pa @272a * //
analyzed: skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gzhi gang yin pa @272a * //
translated: Realitylessness by the realitylessness of production is the relative reality, the reality of dependent origination of things, which is the basis of defilement and purification.

original: de ni rkyen gzhan las skye ba yin pas rang gi ngo bo nyid las skye ba med pa'i phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: de ni rkyen gzhan las skye ba yin pas rang gi ngo bo nyid las skye ba med pa'i phyir skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: Since it is produced from other conditions, it is not produced from its own nature. Therefore, it is realityless by the realitylessness of production.

original: don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yang yin la /
analyzed: don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba chos rnams kyi de bzhin nyid gang yin pa de ni don dam pa yang yin la /
translated: Realitylessness by ultimate realitylessness is the perfect reality, the thusness of things. It is the ultimate, and it is also reality.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa yang yin pa'ang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa yang yin pa'ang /
translated: And they are also realitylessnesses.

original: de la don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do //
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pas don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do //
translated: The ultimate realitylessness of the imagined reality is its realitylessness in the ultimate.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid gsum po dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gsum po dag gis go rims bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thams cad kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ma
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid gsum po dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gsum po dag gis go rims bzhin du ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pas ngo bo nyid thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid thams cad kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ma
translated: Thus, the three unrealities of the three realities are respectively the three realitylessnesses. Therefore, all realities are realityless in terms of all realitylessnesses.

original: yin te / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: yin te / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis rnam pa thams cad du med pa'i phyir mi dmigs shing /
translated: The imagined reality is not perceived at all because of the realitylessness of character.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med du zin kyang rnam par rtog pa dang / 'du byed kyi rgyu mtshan kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs gnyi gar yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med du zin kyang rnam par rtog pa dang / 'du byed kyi rgyu mtshan kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gnas skabs gnyi gar yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: The other-dependent nature is indeed realityless in being realityless in production, but it is not the case that it is not realityless in being realityless in the ultimate, because it is the basis of the imagined reality and the reality of the consummated.

original: gang gi tshe de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa de'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa de'i tshe na ni /
translated: When one is attached to the imagined reality in it,

original: dmigs pa thams cad nye bar ma zhi bas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad nye bar ma zhi bas kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur la /
translated: then, because all the objective references are not pacified, there is defilement.

original: gang gi tshe de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa de'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa de'i tshe na ni /
translated: When one is not attached to the imagined reality in it,🔽then, because all the objective references are pacified, there is purification.

original: dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur zhing yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pas rab tu phye bar 'gyur ba med pa dang / phyin ci ma log pas yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid dang ;
analyzed: dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin pas rnam par byang bar 'gyur zhing yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pas rab tu phye bar 'gyur ba med pa dang / phyin ci ma log pas yongs su grub pa de bzhin nyid dang ;
translated: The consummated reality is distinguished by the realization of the consummated nature, which is changeless and nonerroneous suchness.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du don dam par yod pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes 'phags pa so so rang gis rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du don dam par yod pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the reality of the authentic pristine wisdom of the noble ones’ individual self-cognizance existed ultimately,

original: dbu ma pas de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: dbu ma pas de rtogs par bya ba'i thabs gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid de /
translated: it would be illogical for the Followers of the Middle Way to explain that the other-dependent nature, the method for realizing that reality,

original: med par bshad pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: med par bshad pa mi rung ngo //
translated: does not exist.

original: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bye brag tu bshad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To explain that point in more detail, the text says:

original: de la gang gi tshe kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir mi dmigs shing /
translated: At that time, when the imputed nature is not observed because it does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang rgyu mtshan du mi 'dzin pas yod dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i tshe na dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang rgyu mtshan du mi 'dzin pas yod dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i tshe na dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin no zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: and when the dependent nature is not seen as real because it is not apprehended as a cause, all observations are completely pacified.

original: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni @272b nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du med pa'i phyir mi dmigs shing /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni @272b nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du med pa'i phyir mi dmigs shing /
translated: When yogins and yoginīs do not observe the imputed nature because it does not exist, like a flower in the sky,🔽and when they do not see the dependent nature as real because it is not apprehended as a cause, all observations are completely pacified.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu mtshan du mi 'dzin pas de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i tshe na /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyang kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu mtshan du mi 'dzin pas de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa med pa'i tshul gyis yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba de'i tshe na /
translated: Since the dependent nature is not apprehended as the reason for the imagined nature, at that time, when one does not see the dependent nature as the imagined nature, one realizes the consummate nature.

original: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa yin pas de ni dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin te /
analyzed: yongs su grub pa'i ngo bo nyid rtogs pa yin pas de ni dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, all objects are pacified.

original: don dam par yod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: don dam par yod pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that it exists ultimately.

original: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de skad ces zer ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the author of the commentary says:

original: de dag dang lhan cig tu 'di dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de dag dang lhan cig tu 'di dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This should be analyzed together with them.

original: ji ngo bo nyid gsum po dag bstan pa kho nas dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ram /
analyzed: ji ngo bo nyid gsum po dag bstan pa kho nas dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ram /
translated: Do all objects become pacified just by teaching the three natures?

original: 'on te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis bden pa gnyis rnam par bzhag pas don dam par dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ba 'di rigs pa dang lung dag gis
analyzed: 'on te rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis bden pa gnyis rnam par bzhag pas don dam par dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ba 'di rigs pa dang lung dag gis
translated: Or, by the method of dependent origination, the two truths are posited, and it is said that ultimately all things are devoid of essence, and all objectification is pacified.

original: dpyad par bya'o zhes ston to //
analyzed: dpyad par bya'o zhes ston to //
translated: This should be analyzed by means of reasoning and scripture.

original: de la 'dir rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum po dag gi mtshan nyid ni gang yin /
analyzed: de la 'dir rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag 'dod pa'i ngo bo nyid gsum po dag gi mtshan nyid ni gang yin /
translated: Here, what are the characteristics of the three natures asserted by the Yogācāra?

original: de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gsum po dag gis ni ji ltar ngo bo nyid med par brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid gsum po dag gis ni ji ltar ngo bo nyid med par brtag par bya ste /
translated: How are they to be regarded as essenceless by means of the three essencelessnesses?

original: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la re zhig brtag pa dang po bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the first of these, he says,

original: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de gang yin //
analyzed: de la kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de gang yin //
translated: What is this so-called imagined nature?

original: de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ni ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ni ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: How is it essenceless by virtue of the essencelessness of characteristic?

original: gal te kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par la sogs par tha snyad pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gal te kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par la sogs par tha snyad pa'i rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: If the imagined nature is the conceptualization that is the conventional expression of the nature and particulars, etc. of phenomena,

original: 'di lta ste ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa ni gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa ni gzugs dang tshor ba zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: then it is as follows: Conceptualization of nature is the conceptualization of form, feeling, etc.🔽Conceptualization of particulars is the conceptualization of demonstrable, non-demonstrable, etc.

original: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa ni bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa ni bstan du yod pa dang / bstan du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs par rnam par rtog pa'o zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: This passage teaches the definition of the imagined nature according to the Yogācāra.

original: de la ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba dang / myong bar byed pa dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa @273a * //
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa ni gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni gzugs su rung ba dang / myong bar byed pa dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa @273a * //
translated: Conceptualization of nature is the characteristic of form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness.

original: dang ; mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dang ; mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'o //
translated: and the formation of consciousness.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / tsha ba dang / yang zhing g-yo ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs par ming dang brdar tha snyad 'dogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi mtshan nyid ni sra ba dang / gsher ba dang / tsha ba dang / yang zhing g-yo ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs par ming dang brdar tha snyad 'dogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The characteristics of earth, water, fire, and wind are solidity, liquidity, heat, and motility.

original: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa ni gzugs ni bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs pa med pa'o //🔽tshor ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa ni gzugs ni bstan du yod pa dang bstan du med pa dang / thogs pa dang bcas pa dang thogs pa med pa'o // tshor ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin /
translated: The specific conceptualization is that form is demonstrable or not demonstrable, resistant or nonresistant, pleasant or unpleasant, etc.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: Feeling is pleasant, unpleasant, or neither pleasant nor unpleasant.

original: 'du shes ni chung ngu dang ; chen po dang / tshad med par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes ni chung ngu dang ; chen po dang / tshad med par gyur pa'o //
translated: Ideation is small, large, or immeasurable.

original: 'du byed ni sems dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'du byed ni sems dang / mtshungs par ldan pa dang ldan pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Formation is associated with mind or not associated with mind.🔽Consciousness is the five sense consciousnesses, mental consciousness, and store consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba dang / tshor ba pa dang / nges pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs par ming dang / brdar tha snyad 'dogs pa dang rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o ;
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni nye bar gnas pa las byung ba dang / tshor ba pa dang / nges pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs par ming dang / brdar tha snyad 'dogs pa dang rnam par rtog pa gang yin pa'o ;
translated: The name and the verbal expression and the conceptual thought that “consciousness arises from the presence of sense-object and sense-faculty,” or that “feeling is the experience of the object,” or that “discrimination ascertains the object,” etc.,

original: / ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du rnam par rtog pa de gnyi ga yang gzhan gyi dbang gis bskyed pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba pa'i yul la glo bur du sgro 'dogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: / ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du rnam par rtog pa de gnyi ga yang gzhan gyi dbang gis bskyed pa'i 'du byed kyi rgyu mtshan dang / rnam par rtog pa kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba pa'i yul la glo bur du sgro 'dogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: are the imagined nature. The imagination of what-so-ever is the cause of the production of the other-dependent through the imprints of the verbal and conceptual, and the imagination of the thoroughly afflicted and the completely purified objects that suddenly superimpose upon the other-dependent,

original: de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: that is the imagined nature.

original: de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ni rgyu mtshan la sogs pa lnga po dag gi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ni rgyu mtshan la sogs pa lnga po dag gi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa ba dag gis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: The non-nature of the imagined nature is the non-nature of character, because it is not included among the five such as the causal sign, etc.

original: de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ji lta bu yin par bstan pa ste /🔽kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po dag gi rgyu mtshan yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa'i rgyu mtshan de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing yul gyi ngo bo nyid du mi dmigs pa dang mngon rtags su mi 'dzin cing ;
analyzed: de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ji lta bu yin par bstan pa ste / kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de ni gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po dag gi rgyu mtshan yid du 'ong ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba la sogs pa gang dag yin pa'i rgyu mtshan de dag la mtshan mar mi 'dzin cing yul gyi ngo bo nyid du mi dmigs pa dang mngon rtags su mi 'dzin cing ;
translated: This is the explanation of the realitylessness of the imagined, which is realitylessness by way of characteristic.🔽The reality of the imagined is not apprehended as the signs of the objects, such as the five objects, form, etc., which are the reasons for the pleasant, unpleasant, etc.

original: yul gyi khyad par du mi dmigs pa na de ltar yul gyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par la mtshan ma dang / mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pas yul mi dmigs pa'i phyir de dag la 'dzin pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams mi skye ba ni rgyu mtshan la sogs pa lnga po dag gi khongs su @273b ma gtogs pa zhes bya ste //
analyzed: yul gyi khyad par du mi dmigs pa na de ltar yul gyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par la mtshan ma dang / mngon rtags su mi 'dzin pas yul mi dmigs pa'i phyir de dag la 'dzin pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams mi skye ba ni rgyu mtshan la sogs pa lnga po dag gi khongs su @273b ma gtogs pa zhes bya ste //
translated: When one does not apprehend the nature of the object, nor its particulars, in the form of signs and indications, in that way, by not apprehending the nature and particulars of the object in the form of signs and indications, the consciousnesses that engage in apprehending them do not arise. This is called “not included among the five, such as the reason.”

original: de'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no //🔽yang na rgyu mtshan la sogs pa lnga po dag gi khongs su ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos lnga po rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ces bya ba dag las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa ni ming gis bsdus pa yin yang mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ming nyid rgyu mtshan la sogs pa gang gi khongs su yang ma gtogs pa bzhin
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no // yang na rgyu mtshan la sogs pa lnga po dag gi khongs su ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni chos lnga po rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes dang / de bzhin nyid ces bya ba dag las kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa ni ming gis bsdus pa yin yang mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ming nyid rgyu mtshan la sogs pa gang gi khongs su yang ma gtogs pa bzhin
translated: Therefore, it is the identity-unreality of the characteristic.🔽Or, “not included among the five such as the causal-sign” means that the imagined identity is included in the name, but, like the name itself, is not included in any of the five things such as the causal-sign, because it is identity-unreal due to identity-unreality by intrinsic identity.

original: kun btags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang rgyu mtshan la sogs pa chos lnga po dag gi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes kyang bshad do //
analyzed: kun btags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang rgyu mtshan la sogs pa chos lnga po dag gi khongs su ma gtogs pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin no zhes kyang bshad do //
translated: It is also explained that the imagined identity is identity-unreal due to identity-unreality by intrinsic identity, because it is not included among the five things such as the causal-sign.

original: de ltar kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin na des ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa yin na des ji ltar kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the imagined nature is essenceless due to the essencelessness of character, how can it be thoroughly afflicted?

original: de'i phyir / de de ltar yod pa ma yin yang ming don la 'jug pa las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de de ltar yod pa ma yin yang ming don la 'jug pa las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it says, “Although it does not exist in that way, it is thoroughly afflicted through the engagement of name and object.”

original: ming zhes bya ba ni sgras gzugs la sogs pa rjod par byed pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa rjod par byed pa dang / mi la sogs pa rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ming zhes bya ba ni sgras gzugs la sogs pa rjod par byed pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa rjod par byed pa dang / mi la sogs pa rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: “Name” refers to the expression of form and so forth, the expression of pot and so forth, and the expression of person and so forth.

original: don ni gzugs la sogs pa dang bum pa la sogs pa dang mi la sogs pa'o //🔽ming don la 'jug pa ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras /
analyzed: don ni gzugs la sogs pa dang bum pa la sogs pa dang mi la sogs pa'o // ming don la 'jug pa ni gzugs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras /
translated: “Object” refers to form and so forth, pot and so forth, and person and so forth.

original: gzugs la sogs pa brjod pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa'i sgras bum pa la sogs pa brjod pa dang / mi la sogs pa'i sgras mi la sogs pa brjod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa brjod pa dang / bum pa la sogs pa'i sgras bum pa la sogs pa brjod pa dang / mi la sogs pa'i sgras mi la sogs pa brjod pa'o //
translated: “The engagement of name and object” refers to the expression of form and so forth by means of the term “form” and so forth, the expression of pot and so forth by means of the term “pot” and so forth, and the expression of person and so forth by means of the term “person” and so forth.

original: ming don la 'jug pa las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ni kun brtags pa'i ming gis gzhan gyi dbang gi don la glo bur du 'jug cing sgro 'dogs pa las gzhan gyi dbang gi don la kun brtags pa'i ming du mngon par zhen pa'i sgo nas
analyzed: ming don la 'jug pa las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba ni kun brtags pa'i ming gis gzhan gyi dbang gi don la glo bur du 'jug cing sgro 'dogs pa las gzhan gyi dbang gi don la kun brtags pa'i ming du mngon par zhen pa'i sgo nas
translated: The term “afflicted” in the phrase “the thoroughly afflicted” refers to the fact that childish beings become thoroughly afflicted by means of their adherence to the imagined name as the meaning of the dependent.

original: byis pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This adherence occurs due to the adventitious engagement and superimposition of the imagined name on the meaning of the dependent.

original: ji ltar des kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhe na /🔽de'i phyir ji ltar ming don la 'jug pa de ltar byis pa rnams de'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen par byed do zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar des kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhe na / de'i phyir ji ltar ming don la 'jug pa de ltar byis pa rnams de'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen par byed do zhe na zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: How do they become thoroughly afflicted?🔽Therefore, the root text states, “In the same way that the name engages the meaning, childish beings cause adherence to its entity.”

original: ji ltar kun brtags pa'i ming gzhan gyi dbang gis don la glo bur du sgro 'dogs shing 'jug pa de ltar byis pa rnams gzhan gyi dbang de'i ngo bo nyid la 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //🔽@274a * // 'di ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar kun brtags pa'i ming gzhan gyi dbang gis don la glo bur du sgro 'dogs shing 'jug pa de ltar byis pa rnams gzhan gyi dbang de'i ngo bo nyid la 'di ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //🔽@274a * // 'di ni bum pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: In the same way that the imagined name adventitiously engages and superimposes the meaning of the dependent, childish beings cause adherence to the entity of the dependent, thinking, “This is form, etc.,” and “This is a vase, etc.”

original: 'di ni mi la sogs pa'o zhes kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par byed pa'i sgo de nas byis pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mi la sogs pa'o zhes kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen par byed pa'i sgo de nas byis pa rnams kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The gateway through which childish beings become thoroughly afflicted is the conception that thinks, This is a human, and so on, and conceives of the imaginary nature.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang / des kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i tshul de skad ces zer ba de la 'dir dbu ma pas bshad pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid dang de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa dang / des kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i tshul de skad ces zer ba de la 'dir dbu ma pas bshad pa /
translated: The Yogācāra say, The imaginary nature and the realitylessness of the imagined are as we have explained them, and the way in which one becomes thoroughly afflicted is also as we have explained it. To this the Madhyamika replies,

original: de la 'dir gal te gzugs zhes bya bar yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa'i kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de med do zhe na ni dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dir gal te gzugs zhes bya bar yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa'i kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de med do zhe na ni dngos po la skur pa 'debs pa yin te /
translated: Here, if you say that the imaginary nature, which is the mental expression and verbal expression called form, does not exist, then you deprecate things,

original: yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: because you deprecate mental expression and verbal expression.

original: 'dis ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes zer ba de /
analyzed: 'dis ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes zer ba de /
translated: This shows that the Yogacarins’ assertion that the imagined nature is realityless in being devoid of the nature of the characteristic is🔽If you say that the imagined nature is realityless in being devoid of the nature of the characteristic, that is, in being the imagined nature that is the conceptualization and verbalization of the name and referent as entity and attributes, then you are

original: gal te gzugs zhes bya bar ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du yid la brjod pa rnam par rtog pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa tha snyad 'dogs pa'i kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhe na ni kun rdzob tu gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo la skur pa 'debs pa yin pas
analyzed: gal te gzugs zhes bya bar ngo bo nyid dang khyad par du yid la brjod pa rnam par rtog pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa tha snyad 'dogs pa'i kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhe na ni kun rdzob tu gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo la skur pa 'debs pa yin pas
translated: denying the relative, the dependent nature.

original: mi rung bar ston te /
analyzed: mi rung bar ston te /
translated: This is shown to be unacceptable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: yid la brjod pa rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: yid la brjod pa rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: Conceptualization, the verbalization of the mind,

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung por gtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung por gtogs pa yin la /
translated: is included in the aggregate of consciousness.

original: tshig tu brjod pa tha snyad 'dogs pa ni 'du byed kyi phung por gtogs pa yin pas de gnyis ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po yin te /
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa tha snyad 'dogs pa ni 'du byed kyi phung por gtogs pa yin pas de gnyis ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po yin te /
translated: Since verbal expressions and designations belong to the aggregate of formations, both of them are dependent entities.

original: de dag la kun rdzob tu skur pa 'debs pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la kun rdzob tu skur pa 'debs pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not correct to deny them conventionally.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi yid la brjod pa dang tshig tu brjod pa'i kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de kun rdzob tu mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni kun
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi yid la brjod pa dang tshig tu brjod pa'i kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de kun rdzob tu mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba ni kun
translated: Thus, since the imagined nature that is mental and verbal expression is essenceless in terms of the characteristic on the conventional level, it is not correct to deny it,

original: rdzob tu gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur bas de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdzob tu gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur bas de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: for that would be to deny the dependent entity on the conventional level.

original: ji ste gang yang rung bas de gnyis kyi don kun brtags pa gang yin pa de med de /
analyzed: ji ste gang yang rung bas de gnyis kyi don kun brtags pa gang yin pa de med de /
translated: If you say that the object of either of those two is the imagined nature, which does not exist,

original: dper na thag pa la sbrul bzhin no zhe na ni kun brtags pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na thag pa la sbrul bzhin no zhe na ni kun brtags pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: like a snake in a rope, then the imagined nature is not nonexistent.

original: de la rnam pa 'dra bas blo gros 'khrul @274b bas kun brtags pa'i don med kyang tha snyad du sbrul 'khyil ba la de med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dgra kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid
analyzed: de la rnam pa 'dra bas blo gros 'khrul @274b bas kun brtags pa'i don med kyang tha snyad du sbrul 'khyil ba la de med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dgra kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid
translated: In response to that, “Although the object imagined by the confused mind because of similarity of aspect does not exist, conventionally it is not the case that a coiled snake does not exist.”🔽This is saying that the Yogācāra say that the imagined nature is natureless by way of the nature of nonentity.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes zer ba de ji sta byis pa gang yang rung bas yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa de gnyis kyi don sgro btags pa'i kun brtags pa gang yin pa de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes zer ba de ji sta byis pa gang yang rung bas yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa de gnyis kyi don sgro btags pa'i kun brtags pa gang yin pa de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Whatever is imagined by any childish being, whether mentally or verbally, the object that is imputed by those two is natureless by way of the nature of nonentity.

original: dper na thag pa la sbrul du sgro btags pa'i kun brtags pa gang yin pa de med pa bzhin no zhe na ni kun rdzob tu kun brtags pa mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ma yin pas mi rung bar
analyzed: dper na thag pa la sbrul du sgro btags pa'i kun brtags pa gang yin pa de med pa bzhin no zhe na ni kun rdzob tu kun brtags pa mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ma yin pas mi rung bar
translated: If you say that it is like the nonexistence of the imagined snake in a rope, that is not correct, because the imagined is not essenceless due to the essencelessness of the imagined in the conventional.

original: ston te / ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽thag pa de la nam mkha' phan phun tsam gyi tshe na sbrul 'khyil ba'i rnam pa 'dra bas blo gros 'khrul pa'i byis pa rnams kyis sbrul 'khyil pa dug drag po dang ldan pa yin par kun brtags pa'i don med kyang tha snyad du thag pa de las
analyzed: ston te / ci'i phyir zhe na / thag pa de la nam mkha' phan phun tsam gyi tshe na sbrul 'khyil ba'i rnam pa 'dra bas blo gros 'khrul pa'i byis pa rnams kyis sbrul 'khyil pa dug drag po dang ldan pa yin par kun brtags pa'i don med kyang tha snyad du thag pa de las
translated: Why is it not correct?

original: gzhan pa sbrul 'khyil ba nyid kyi lus la sbrul 'khyil pa dug drag po dang ldan par kun brtags pa'i don de med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan pa sbrul 'khyil ba nyid kyi lus la sbrul 'khyil pa dug drag po dang ldan par kun brtags pa'i don de med pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When there is just a little space in the rope, the childish, whose minds are confused by the appearance of a coiled snake, imagine that there is a coiled snake with virulent poison. Although the object of that imagination does not exist, conventionally, the body of the coiled snake itself, which is different from the rope, is not nonexistent.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa de gnyis kyi don kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de kun rdzob tu mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya bar yang kun rdzob tu kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid ngo
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa de gnyis kyi don kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de kun rdzob tu mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya bar yang kun rdzob tu kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid ngo
translated: Thus, the meaning of those two, mental expression and verbal expression, of the Yogacarins, is the imagined nature. That is not realityless by way of the realitylessness of identityunreality, but is realityless by way of the realitylessness of the imagined nature.

original: bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mi 'grub pas de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mi 'grub pas de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since that is not established as realityless by way of the realitylessness of the imagined nature, that also is not correct.🔽If one says that even conventionally a coiled rope is not a snake, then there is the fault of contradicting what is commonly acknowledged.

original: ji ste tha snyad du yang sbrul 'khyil pa la sbrul med do zhe na ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni ji ste rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag tha snyad du sbrul 'khyil pa la de med pa ma yin pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i
analyzed: ji ste tha snyad du yang sbrul 'khyil pa la sbrul med do zhe na ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ro zhes bya bas ni ji ste rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag tha snyad du sbrul 'khyil pa la de med pa ma yin pa'i phyir kun brtags pa'i
translated: If the Yogacarins say that even conventionally a coiled rope is not a snake, then there is the fault of contradicting what is commonly acknowledged.

original: ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ma 'grub pa'i skyon sel bar 'dod pas tha snyad du yang sbrul 'khyil pa la sbrul med do zhe na ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur bas mi rung bar ston
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du ma 'grub pa'i skyon sel bar 'dod pas tha snyad du yang sbrul 'khyil pa la sbrul med do zhe na ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur bas mi rung bar ston
translated: If you assert that a coiled snake does not exist conventionally, in order to avoid the error of nonestablishment of the lack of entityness due to the lack of entityness of nature, you would be harmed by what is renowned.

original: te / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: te / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: tha snyad du thag pa la sbrul med kyang sbrul 'khyil ba nyid la sbrul yod par 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad du thag pa la sbrul med kyang sbrul 'khyil ba nyid la sbrul yod par 'jig rten la grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, although a snake does not exist in a rope conventionally, a coiled snake exists in a coiled snake, as is renowned in the world.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag tha snyad du sbrul 'khyil pa la de med pa ma yin pa'i phyir kun btags pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid @275a * //
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag tha snyad du sbrul 'khyil pa la de med pa ma yin pa'i phyir kun btags pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid @275a * //
translated: Thus, because a coiled snake does not not exist conventionally, the Yogācāra say that the imputed nature is not a nonentity.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i skyon sel bar 'dod pas tha snyad du yang sbrul 'khyil pa la sbrul med do zhes zer ba ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur bas de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mi 'grub pa'i skyon sel bar 'dod pas tha snyad du yang sbrul 'khyil pa la sbrul med do zhes zer ba ni grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur bas de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it is not established as essenceless by way of being essenceless, the error of nonestablishment arises. Therefore, since it would be undermined by what is renowned, it is also not correct to say that conventionally, there is no snake in a coiled snake.

original: ji ste don dam par dngos po sel bar byed pa ni dbu ma pa'i tshul gyi rjes su smra ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ste don dam par dngos po sel bar byed pa ni dbu ma pa'i tshul gyi rjes su smra ba yin te /
translated: If you say that the Madhyamaka system is the one that refutes things ultimately,

original: don dam par sbrul rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid las skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni ji ste rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag tha snyad du yang sbrul 'khyil pa la sbrul med do zhes byas na grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba de spang bar 'dod pas don dam par sbrul
analyzed: don dam par sbrul rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid las skye ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni ji ste rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag tha snyad du yang sbrul 'khyil pa la sbrul med do zhes byas na grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba de spang bar 'dod pas don dam par sbrul
translated: since ultimately a snake does not substantially exist and since there is no arising from self, then if the Yogācāra say that conventionally, there is no snake in a coiled snake, since they would be undermined by what is renowned, they would want to avoid that. Therefore, ultimately, there is no snake in a coiled snake.

original: 'khyil pa la sbrul gyi dngos po med do zhes sel bar byed na dbu ma pa'i tshul gyi rjes su smras pa yin pas ngo bo nyid gsum kho nas dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes bya bar sgrub pa'i gzhung mi rung bar ston te /
analyzed: 'khyil pa la sbrul gyi dngos po med do zhes sel bar byed na dbu ma pa'i tshul gyi rjes su smras pa yin pas ngo bo nyid gsum kho nas dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes bya bar sgrub pa'i gzhung mi rung bar ston te /
translated: If you refute the existence of a snake by saying that the coiled thing is not a snake, then you are following the Madhyamaka method, and so it is not correct to teach that all objectification is pacified by the three realities alone.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don dam par sbrul rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang ngo bo nyid las skye ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par sbrul rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang ngo bo nyid las skye ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because ultimately the snake does not substantially exist, and because it does not arise from its own essence.

original: de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis don dam par dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pas dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar 'gyur pa'i tshul gyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i tshul gyis don dam par dngos po thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin pas dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi bar 'gyur pa'i tshul gyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because all things are ultimately realityless by the method of dependent origination, and so all objectification is pacified.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag tha snyad du yang sbrul 'khyil pa la sbrul med do zhes byas na grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba spang bar 'dod pas don dam par dngos po sel bar byed na ni dbu ma pa'i tshul gyi rjes su smra
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag tha snyad du yang sbrul 'khyil pa la sbrul med do zhes byas na grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba spang bar 'dod pas don dam par dngos po sel bar byed na ni dbu ma pa'i tshul gyi rjes su smra
translated: Thus, the Yogacaras, who wish to avoid the contradiction of conventional usage, when they say that a coiled snake is not a snake, and who wish to avoid the ultimate refutation of things, are in fact following the Madhyamaka method.

original: ba yin pas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las ngo bo nyid gsum kho nas dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes bya bar 'gyur bar 'dod pa'i gzhung nyams pas de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ba yin pas rang gi grub pa'i mtha' las ngo bo nyid gsum kho nas dmigs pa thams cad nye bar zhi ba zhes bya bar 'gyur bar 'dod pa'i gzhung nyams pas de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But since they have damaged their own scriptures, which state that all objects are completely extinguished by means of the three natures alone, their position is illogical.

original: thag pa dang sbrul 'khyil pa la ma dmigs pa kho nar thag pa dang sbrul gyi blo skye na ni pha rol po dang rang la shes par byed par rab tu ma grub po zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag thag pa dang sbrul la
analyzed: thag pa dang sbrul 'khyil pa la ma dmigs pa kho nar thag pa dang sbrul gyi blo skye na ni pha rol po dang rang la shes par byed par rab tu ma grub po zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag thag pa dang sbrul la
translated: If the cognition of a rope and a coiled snake were to arise in the absence of the observation of a rope and a coiled snake, then the opponent and we ourselves would not have established the cognition of a rope and a coiled snake.

original: sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul rnams kun rdzob tu med kyang de ltar 'khrul pa'i blo skye'o zhes zer ba de gal te kun rdzob tu theg pa dang sbrul 'khyil ba la sogs pa yul rnams med na de dag la ma dmigs pa kho nar thag pa dang🔽sbrul la sogs pa'i blo ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sogs pa phyi rol gyi yul rnams kun rdzob tu med kyang de ltar 'khrul pa'i blo skye'o zhes zer ba de gal te kun rdzob tu theg pa dang sbrul 'khyil ba la sogs pa yul rnams med na de dag la ma dmigs pa kho nar thag pa dang sbrul la sogs pa'i blo ji ltar skye bar 'gyur /
translated: The Samkhyas and so on say that although external objects do not exist conventionally, the mind that is confused about them arises.🔽If objects such as a rope and a coiled snake do not exist conventionally, then just as a snake is not observed in a rope, how could the mind that perceives a rope as a snake and so on arise?

original: ji ste skye na ni thag pa la sbrul du 'khrul pa'i blo skye ba gang yin pa de ni kun brtags @275b pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid shes par byed pa'i dpe thag pa las blangs pa de rnal 'byor spyod pa
analyzed: ji ste skye na ni thag pa la sbrul du 'khrul pa'i blo skye ba gang yin pa de ni kun brtags @275b pa'i ngo bo nyid yin no zhes kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid shes par byed pa'i dpe thag pa las blangs pa de rnal 'byor spyod pa
translated: If it does arise, then the mind that arises in error perceiving a rope as a snake is the imaginary nature.

original: pa dag rang la rab tu ma grub pas yul med par mi rung bar ston te /
analyzed: pa dag rang la rab tu ma grub pas yul med par mi rung bar ston te /
translated: The Yogacaras use the example of a rope to understand the imaginary nature, but since they do not accept it themselves, they teach that it is not tenable that objects do not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: thag pa dang sbrul 'khyil ba la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi yul rnams med na thag pa dang sbrul gyi blo skye ba yang med pas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni thag pa la sbrul du 'khyil pa'i blo skye ba lta bu'o zhes shes par byed pa'i
analyzed: thag pa dang sbrul 'khyil ba la sogs pa'i phyi rol gyi yul rnams med na thag pa dang sbrul gyi blo skye ba yang med pas kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni thag pa la sbrul du 'khyil pa'i blo skye ba lta bu'o zhes shes par byed pa'i
translated: Since if external objects such as a rope and a coiled snake do not exist, the mind perceiving a rope and a snake also does not exist, the imaginary nature is like the mind perceiving a snake coiled on a rope.

original: dpe rang la rab tu ma grub pas mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe rang la rab tu ma grub pas mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Since this example is not established for you, it is not suitable.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag phyi rol gyi yul med par nang gi blo 'khrul pas rnam par brtags pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'dod pa'i dpe yang rang la rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag phyi rol gyi yul med par nang gi blo 'khrul pas rnam par brtags pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par 'dod pa'i dpe yang rang la rab tu ma grub pa'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no
translated: Thus, since the example of the Yogācāra that external objects do not exist and the mind is imagined by internal delusion to be the imaginary nature is not established for you, that is also illogical.

original: // 'dir gal te rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag rang la phyi rol gyi yul yod par ma grub pas shes par byed pa'i dpe med kyang khyed dbu ma pa'i phyogs la kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi yul gyi yul sgyu ma tsam🔽du yod par grub pa kho bo cag gis shes par byed pa'i dper rung ba'i phyir kho bo cag gis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni thag pa la sbrul du 'khrul pa'i blo skye ba lta bu zhes shes par byed pa'i dpe rab tu ma grub pa
analyzed: // 'dir gal te rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag 'di skad ces kho bo cag rang la phyi rol gyi yul yod par ma grub pas shes par byed pa'i dpe med kyang khyed dbu ma pa'i phyogs la kun rdzob tu phyi rol gyi yul gyi yul sgyu ma tsam du yod par grub pa kho bo cag gis shes par byed pa'i dper rung ba'i phyir kho bo cag gis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni thag pa la sbrul du 'khrul pa'i blo skye ba lta bu zhes shes par byed pa'i dpe rab tu ma grub pa
translated: Here, the Yogācāra say, “Since we do not establish external objects to exist for ourselves, we have no example to prove it.
