However, in your Madhyamaka position, we can use the example of the mere illusion of external objects existing conventionally to prove it.🔽Therefore, we can use the example of the arising of the thought that mistakes a rope for a snake to prove that the imagined nature does not exist.”

original: yin te / rang la gtan tshigs ma grub pas kyang 'dod pa'i don ston par byed de /
analyzed: yin te / rang la gtan tshigs ma grub pas kyang 'dod pa'i don ston par byed de /
translated: This is not a good example because the reason is not established for them.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos bzhin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa ni gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la grub pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos bzhin no zhes zer ba'i phyogs snga ma khong nas dbyung ba de'i lan du 'dir 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa ni gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes
translated: The former position is drawn out from within the root text, and in response to that, the author of the commentary states, “That which is not established for either of the two parties is not a logical reason.”

original: bya ba der tha snyad kyi dus su ni phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i shes par byed pa 'dod par bya'o zhes sngar bstan zin to zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: bya ba der tha snyad kyi dus su ni phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i shes par byed pa 'dod par bya'o zhes sngar bstan zin to zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: He says that previously he taught that at the time of conventional usage, one should accept that which is a means of understanding that is renowned to both parties.

original: sngar bdag dang chos brtags pa'i skabs su gzhan gyi phyogs 'ba' zhig la grags pa'i phyogs kyi chos kyis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don sgrub par mi nus par nges par bzung ste ;🔽/ gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar bdag dang chos brtags pa'i skabs su gzhan gyi phyogs 'ba' zhig la grags pa'i phyogs kyi chos kyis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i don sgrub par mi nus par nges par bzung ste ; / gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Previously, in the context of the examination of the self and phenomena, he ascertained that a subject that is renowned to the opponent alone is incapable of establishing the object of affirmation.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs la ma grub pa bzhin pas /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs la ma grub pa bzhin pas /
translated: He said that because it is not established for either of the two parties, it is like a subject that is not established for the opponent.

original: rjes su dpag pa 'gal bas bzlog pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid nyams pa med do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'gal bas bzlog pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid nyams pa med do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Those who wish to demonstrate that the object of imagination does not exist🔽should accept the master’s🔽statement that the Madhyamaka way is tenable.🔽Because the master has stated that the very essence of the object of expression is negated, the engagement of the mind and words in that object of expression is stopped.🔽Those who wish to demonstrate that the object of imagination does not exist🔽should accept the master’s statement that the Madhyamaka way is tenable.🔽Because the master has stated that the very essence of the object of expression is negated, the engagement of the mind and words in that object of expression is stopped.

original: kun brtags pa'i don yod pa ma yin par ston par 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i don yod pa ma yin par ston par 'dod pa ni /
translated: Those who wish to demonstrate that the object of imagination does not exist

original: slob @276a * //
analyzed: slob @276a * //
translated: should accept the master’s🔽statement that the Madhyamaka way is tenable.🔽Because the master has stated that the very essence of the object of expression is negated, the engagement of the mind and words in that object of expression is stopped.🔽Those who wish to demonstrate that the object of imagination does not exist🔽should accept the master’s

original: dpon gyis dbu ma pa'i tshul 'thad pa dang bcas pa bka' stsal pa nyid 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: dpon gyis dbu ma pa'i tshul 'thad pa dang bcas pa bka' stsal pa nyid 'dod par bya ste /
translated: statement that the Madhyamaka way is tenable.🔽Because the master has stated that the very essence of the object of expression is negated, the engagement of the mind and words in that object of expression is stopped.🔽Those who wish to demonstrate that the object of imagination does not exist🔽should accept the master’s🔽statement that the Madhyamaka way is tenable.

original: brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa kho nas yul de la yid dang tshig gi brjod pas 'jug pa ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gang dag kun brtags pa'i don ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par ston par 'dod pa dag gis ni
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa kho nas yul de la yid dang tshig gi brjod pas 'jug pa ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bas ni gang dag kun brtags pa'i don ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin par ston par 'dod pa dag gis ni
translated: Because the master has stated that the very essence of the object of expression is negated, the engagement of the mind and words in that object of expression is stopped.🔽Those who wish to demonstrate that the object of imagination does not exist

original: sngar slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis bdag dang chos brtags pa'i skabs su //🔽brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //
analyzed: sngar slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis bdag dang chos brtags pa'i skabs su // brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //
translated: should accept the master’s🔽statement that the Madhyamaka way is tenable.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: Because the master has stated that the very essence of the object of expression is negated, the engagement of the mind and words in that object of expression is stopped.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: Those who wish to demonstrate that the object of imagination does not exist🔽should accept the master’s

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: statement that the Madhyamaka way is tenable.🔽Because the master has stated that the very essence of the object of expression is negated, the engagement of the mind and words in that object of expression is stopped.

original: zhes bya ba dbu ma pa'i tshul 'thad pa dang bcas pa bka' stsal pa nyid 'dod par bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dbu ma pa'i tshul 'thad pa dang bcas pa bka' stsal pa nyid 'dod par bya ste /
translated: One should accept the statement of the Madhyamaka system together with its logic.

original: der las nyon mongs zad pas thar //
analyzed: der las nyon mongs zad pas thar //
translated: There, through the exhaustion of karma and afflictions, there is liberation.

original: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
translated: Karma and afflictions arise from conceptuality.

original: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
analyzed: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
translated: Those arise from mental fabrication.

original: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs pas spros pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la ;
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur // zhes gsungs pas spros pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la ;
translated: Mental fabrication ceases through emptiness.

original: de ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ba'i rigs pa ni /
analyzed: de ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ba'i rigs pa ni /
translated: Since it is said that mental fabrication is the imagined nature, the logic that it ceases through emptiness is as follows.

original: brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog pas te //
translated: The object of expression is stopped.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: The domain of mind is stopped.

original: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: Unarisen and unceasing,

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //🔽zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs // zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The nature of phenomena is like nirvana.

original: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag la //
analyzed: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag la //
translated: Mental fabrication ceases through emptiness.

original: de yang brjod par bya ba ldog pas 'gag go //
analyzed: de yang brjod par bya ba ldog pas 'gag go //
translated: Moreover, it ceases through the stopping of the object of expression.

original: brjod par bya ba ldog pa de yang sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog pa de yang sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: That stopping of the object of expression is through the stopping of the domain of mind.

original: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa de yang ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa rtogs pas ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir des ni theg pa chen po dbu ma pa'i tshul gyis kun brtags pa'i don ngo bo nyid med
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul ldog pa de yang ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa rtogs pas ldog par 'gyur ba'i phyir des ni theg pa chen po dbu ma pa'i tshul gyis kun brtags pa'i don ngo bo nyid med
translated: And that cessation of the domain of mind is a cessation due to the realization of the reality of non-production and non-cessation that is equivalent to nirvana.

original: pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i tshul bstan to //
analyzed: pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i tshul bstan to //
translated: That demonstrates the way of establishing the reality of the imagined to be realitylessness by the way of the Mahayana Madhyamikas.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med do zhe na ni zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni med de /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid med do zhe na ni zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni med de /
translated: The words “If you say that the imagined does not have a reality” are the words of the Yogacaras who say that the imagined does not have a reality,

original: phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is erroneous.

original: dper na sdong dum la mir 'khrul pa bzhin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: dper na sdong dum la mir 'khrul pa bzhin no zhes zer ba'i tshig yin te /
translated: For example, it is like the error of a stump being a man.

original: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag kyang chos can dang / bsgrub par bya ba chos dang / sgrub pa'i chos dang / dpe yin par go rims bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: Those are the subject, the predicate to be proven, the proof, and the example, respectively.

original: dper na sdong dum la mir 'khrul pa ni phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na sdong dum la mir 'khrul pa ni phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir med pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, a stump mistaken for a man is nonexistent because it is erroneous.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang phyin ci log @276b yin pa'i phyir med pas de'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid kyang phyin ci log @276b yin pa'i phyir med pas de'i phyir kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni mtshan nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes zer ro //
translated: Likewise, the imagined characteristic is nonexistent because it is erroneous. Therefore the Commentator says that the imagined reality is identity-unreality because of identitylessness by intrinsic identity.

original: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de'i lan du 'grel pa byed pa nyid kyis /
translated: In response to that, the Subcommentary says:

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: The meaning of the reason is not established.

original: ming ni gzugs dang 'du byed du gtogs pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag kyang rnam par shes pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ming ni gzugs dang 'du byed du gtogs pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid dang / rtog pa dang / rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag kyang rnam par shes pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Because name is included in form and compositional factors, and because the concepts of intrinsic reality and the concepts of imagination and memory are included in the aggregates of consciousness and compositional factors.

original: des ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni med do zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: des ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gi kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid ni med do zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: This means that the reason “because the imagined nature does not exist” is not established for the Yogācāra.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kun brtags pa ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du ming du 'dogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pas sgro 'dogs pa yin pas /
analyzed: kun brtags pa ni chos rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par du ming du 'dogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pas sgro 'dogs pa yin pas /
translated: The imagined is the essential nature and the distinctions of things that are imputed by names and are imputed by conceptualization.

original: de la ming ni sgrar brjod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de la ming ni sgrar brjod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since names are not said to be sounds,

original: gzugs kyi phung por yang gtogs la sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed yin pas 'du byed kyi phung por yang gtogs pa'i phyir sdong dum la mir 'khrul pa ltar phyin ci log ma yin pas med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung por yang gtogs la sems dang mi ldan pa'i 'du byed yin pas 'du byed kyi phung por yang gtogs pa'i phyir sdong dum la mir 'khrul pa ltar phyin ci log ma yin pas med pa ma yin no //
translated: they are included in the aggregate of form and are also included in the aggregate of formations because they are mental formations that are not associated with the mind. Therefore, because they are not mistaken, like mistaking a stump for a man, they are not nonexistent.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa gsum ste ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yin la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang rnam pa gsum ste ngo bo nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa ni sgo lnga'i rnam par shes pa nye bar gnas pa las byung ba yin la /
translated: Conceptualization is also threefold: Essential conceptualization arises from the five sense consciousnesses.

original: rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa tshol ba pa dang / 'du byed sems pa yin /
analyzed: rtog pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa tshol ba pa dang / 'du byed sems pa yin /
translated: Conceptual thought is the mental consciousness and the formative force volition.

original: rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nges pa dang / sems las byung ba'i chos dran pa yin pas de dag kyang rnam par shes pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dran pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa nges pa dang / sems las byung ba'i chos dran pa yin pas de dag kyang rnam par shes pa dang / 'du byed kyi phung por gtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: Recollective thought is the mental consciousness and the recollection of mental factors.

original: sdong dum la mir 'khrul pa ltar phyin ci log ma yin pas med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sdong dum la mir 'khrul pa ltar phyin ci log ma yin pas med pa ma yin no //
translated: Since these are included in the aggregates of consciousness and formative forces, they are not non-existent, unlike the non-existence of a man in a stump.

original: des na kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag 'dod pa ltar kun rdzob tu yang mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag 'dod pa ltar kun rdzob tu yang mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, as the Yogacaras believe, the imagined identity is not non-existent by reason of identity-unreality even conventionally.

original: kun rdzob tu gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam lta bur yod pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam lta bur yod pa yin no //
translated: Form, mind, and mental functions do exist conventionally, like illusions, mirages, and dreams.

original: gzhan yang tha snyad pa'i rjod pa 'jug pa ni brjod par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi yul can yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang tha snyad pa'i rjod pa 'jug pa ni brjod par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi yul can yin la /
translated: Moreover, conventional expressions engage the nature and attributes of objects of expression.

original: don dam par brjod par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par bkag pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa'i nyon mongs pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: don dam par brjod par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par bkag pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa'i nyon mongs pa mi 'thad de /
translated: Since the nature and attributes of objects of expression are refuted in the ultimate, it is untenable that they are objects of attachment and affliction.

original: skyes bu 'byon ma pas gzugs su byas pa'i @277a * //
analyzed: skyes bu 'byon ma pas gzugs su byas pa'i @277a * //
translated: It is like a man who has gone to a brothel

original: na chung la bdag med pa nyid du rtogs pa bzhin pas /
analyzed: na chung la bdag med pa nyid du rtogs pa bzhin pas /
translated: and realizes that the young woman he has paid for is not a self.

original: ming gi dbang gis don la mngon par zhen par mi rigs te /🔽tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las rigs so zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: ming gi dbang gis don la mngon par zhen par mi rigs te / tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las rigs so zhes bya bas ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag na re kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Therefore it is illogical to cling to objects through the power of names.🔽Since it is illogical to cling to objects through the power of names, it is illogical to cling to objects through the power of names.

original: de ltar yod pa ma yin yang ming don la 'jug pa las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar yod pa ma yin yang ming don la 'jug pa las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is illogical to cling to objects through the power of names, it is illogical to cling to objects through the power of names.

original: ji ltar ming don la 'jug pa de ltar byis pa rnams de'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen par byed do zhes kun brtags pa'i ming gzhan gyi dbang gis don la 'jug pa'i sgo nas don la mngon par zhen cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro
analyzed: ji ltar ming don la 'jug pa de ltar byis pa rnams de'i ngo bo nyid la mngon par zhen par byed do zhes kun brtags pa'i ming gzhan gyi dbang gis don la 'jug pa'i sgo nas don la mngon par zhen cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro
translated: Thus, through the power of other-dependent names that engage objects, childish beings conceive of their nature and become thoroughly afflicted.

original: zhes zer ba de mi rigs par ston te /
analyzed: zhes zer ba de mi rigs par ston te /
translated: This is taught to be illogical.

original: ji ltar mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rigs she na /
translated: How is it illogical?

original: ming don la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad pa'i brjod pa 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: ming don la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni tha snyad pa'i brjod pa 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The so-called engagement of names in objects is the engagement of conventional expressions.

original: de ni brjod par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi yul can yin la don dam par brjod par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par bkag pa'i phyir skyes bu 'phyon ma pas gzugs brnyan gyi na chung la bud med kyi
analyzed: de ni brjod par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi yul can yin la don dam par brjod par bya ba'i don gyi ngo bo nyid dang khyad par bkag pa'i phyir skyes bu 'phyon ma pas gzugs brnyan gyi na chung la bud med kyi
translated: It is the subject that is the nature and attributes of the object that is to be expressed.  But because the nature and attributes of the object that is to be expressed are refuted ultimately, it is like a man of loose morals who has intercourse with a painting of a woman.

original: ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa na de la 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mi skye ba bzhin pas don dam par ni ming don la 'jug pa las don la mngon par zhen cing /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med par rtogs pa na de la 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa mi skye ba bzhin pas don dam par ni ming don la 'jug pa las don la mngon par zhen cing /
translated: When one realizes that there is no intrinsic reality, one does not generate the afflictions such as attachment.

original: kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la /🔽kun rdzob tu ni ming don la 'jug pa las /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur la / kun rdzob tu ni ming don la 'jug pa las /
translated: Thus, ultimately, it is not tenable that one becomes thoroughly afflicted by attachment to objects due to the engagement of names and objects.

original: don la mngon bar zhen cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: don la mngon bar zhen cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar mi rigs kyi /
translated: Conventionally, it is not tenable that one becomes thoroughly afflicted by attachment to objects due to the engagement of names and objects.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las don la mngon par zhen cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar rigs so //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las don la mngon par zhen cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar rigs so //
translated: It is tenable that one becomes thoroughly afflicted by attachment to objects due to improper mental activity.

original: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis /
analyzed: de ltar na rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis /
translated: Thus, the Yogācāra assert that the imaginary nature is identity-unreality.

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin par brtags pas de gal te yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid kun brtags pa yin la de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni yid la brjod pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin par brtags pas de gal te yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid kun brtags pa yin la de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni yid la brjod pa dang /
translated: If you say that the imagined nature is the nature of mental discourse and verbal expression, and that it is realitylessness due to realitylessness of character, then mental discourse and verbal expression are the relative reality, and it is unacceptable to say that it is realityless due to realitylessness of character,

original: tshig tu brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po yin pas de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes brjod na gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur bas mi rung
analyzed: tshig tu brjod pa'i ngo bo nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po yin pas de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhes brjod na gzhan gyi dbang gi dngos po la skur pa 'debs par 'gyur bas mi rung
translated: because that would be a deprecation of the relative reality.

original: ngo // ji ste yid la brjod pa dang tshig tu brjod pa de gnyis kyi don gang yin pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: ngo // ji ste yid la brjod pa dang tshig tu brjod pa de gnyis kyi don gang yin pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: If you say that the object of those two, mental discourse and verbal expression, is the imagined nature,

original: de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin @277b no zhes brjod na ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin @277b no zhes brjod na ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med par mi 'grub ste /
translated: If you say that it is realitylessness because of the realitylessness of the characteristic, then the imagined reality is not established as realityless.

original: yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa de gnyis kyi don gang yin pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: yid la brjod pa dang / tshig tu brjod pa de gnyis kyi don gang yin pa ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin te /
translated: The object of those two, the verbal and the conceptual, is the relative reality.

original: de ni dper na thag pa la sbrul du kun brtags pa'i don med kyang sbrul nyid la sbrul du kun brtags pa'i don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar🔽mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni dper na thag pa la sbrul du kun brtags pa'i don med kyang sbrul nyid la sbrul du kun brtags pa'i don med pa ma yin pa'i phyir de mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: For example, although the object of the imagined snake in a rope does not exist, the snake itself is not nonexistent as the imagined snake. Therefore, it is not correct to say that it is realityless because of the realitylessness of the characteristic.

original: phyi rol gyi yul med par kun brtags pa'i 'khrul pa'i blo skye'o zhes bya bar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi yul med par kun brtags pa'i 'khrul pa'i blo skye'o zhes bya bar yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is also not correct to say that the erroneous consciousness imagining the external object arises without an external object,

original: yul med na thag pa la sbrul du 'khrul pa'i blo skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: yul med na thag pa la sbrul du 'khrul pa'i blo skye ba bzhin no zhes bya ba'i dpe mi 'grub ste /
translated: because the example of the erroneous consciousness imagining a snake in a rope does not exist if the object does not exist.

original: thag pa'i yul la sbrul du 'khrul pa phyin ci log yin pas med kyang thag pa'i yul nyid med pa ma yin pas phyi rol gyi yul med pa la kun btags pa'i 'khrul pa'i blo skye'o zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: thag pa'i yul la sbrul du 'khrul pa phyin ci log yin pas med kyang thag pa'i yul nyid med pa ma yin pas phyi rol gyi yul med pa la kun btags pa'i 'khrul pa'i blo skye'o zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: Since the error of a snake in the object rope is erroneous, it does not exist, but since the object rope itself does not not exist, it is not tenable to say that the erroneous mind of the imagined arises in the absence of an external object.

original: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i mtshan nyid phyin ci log yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the imagined characteristic is erroneous,

original: sdong dum la mir 'khrul pa bzhin du mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: sdong dum la mir 'khrul pa bzhin du mtshan nyid ngo bo nyid med pa nyid kyis ngo bo nyid med do zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: it is not tenable to say that it is essenceless due to the essencelessness of characteristic, like the error of a person in a stump.

original: ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu ming du 'dogs pa dang / blos rnam par rtog pa dag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba yin pas de dag tha snyad du sdong dum la mir 'khrul pa ltar mtshan nyid med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bye brag tu ming du 'dogs pa dang / blos rnam par rtog pa dag gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba yin pas de dag tha snyad du sdong dum la mir 'khrul pa ltar mtshan nyid med pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the designation of names as entities and attributes and the conceptualization of the mind are form, mind, and mental factors, they are not, like the error of a person in a stump, conventionally essenceless due to the essencelessness of characteristic.

original: ming don la 'jug pa las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: ming don la 'jug pa las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro zhes byar yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not tenable to say that one becomes thoroughly afflicted due to the engagement of names with objects,

original: ming gis don brjod pa las don la mngon par zhen cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar mi rigs kyis /
analyzed: ming gis don brjod pa las don la mngon par zhen cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar mi rigs kyis /
translated: It is not reasonable that the meaning is fully afflicted by attachment to the meaning from the expression of the meaning by name.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las don la mngon par zhen cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa las don la mngon par zhen cing kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur bar rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable that the meaning is fully afflicted by attachment to the meaning from improper mental activity.

original: de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis brtags pa'i tshul mi 'thad pas /🔽'dir theg pa chen po dbu ma pa'i tshul ni tha snyad du kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam lta bu rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bya ba byed nus pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis brtags pa'i tshul mi 'thad pas / 'dir theg pa chen po dbu ma pa'i tshul ni tha snyad du kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i lugs rnam par gzhag pa ni phyi dang nang gi dngos po sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / rmi lam lta bu rgyu dang rkyen gyi dbang gis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bya ba byed nus pa dang /
translated: Thus, since the method of investigation by the Yogācāras is untenable,

original: mi nus pa'i tshul gyis yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin par brjod pa yod la /
analyzed: mi nus pa'i tshul gyis yang dag pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin par brjod pa yod la /
translated: here the method of the Mahāyāna Mādhyamikas is that conventionally, the system of the truth of the relative is posited as the external and internal things that are like illusions, mirages, and dreams, which are dependently arisen by the power of causes and conditions, and which are described as real and unreal in terms of their ability or inability to perform a function.

original: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas /
analyzed: de la tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pas /
translated: And in that regard, the meaning is fully afflicted by attachment to the meaning from improper mental activity.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par @278a * //🔽brtags pa las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la sogs par @278a * // brtags pa las kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: the imputation of things and nonthings, etc.

original: de dag nyid don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mthong na /
analyzed: de dag nyid don dam par ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mthong na /
translated: But when one sees that those very things are ultimately essenceless,

original: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba yin pas theg pa mchog gi tshul 'di 'dod par bya'o //🔽da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gzhi nyid du kun rdzob dang /
analyzed: rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba yin pas theg pa mchog gi tshul 'di 'dod par bya'o // da ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid skye ba ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gzhi nyid du kun rdzob dang /
translated: one becomes purified. Therefore, one should accept this way of the supreme🔽vehicle.🔽Now, in order to demonstrate that the assertion of the Yogacaras that the

original: don dam par yod pa nyid du btags pa de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa nyid du btags pa de mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: dependent nature, which is the essence of the dependent origination of phenomena, is the basis of affliction and purification, and which exists both conventionally and ultimately, is untenable, the second🔽consequence is raised:🔽So too, what is this

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de yang gang yin zhes brtag pa gnyis pa smras te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de yang gang yin zhes brtag pa gnyis pa smras te /
translated: So-called dependent nature?

original: des ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de yang gang yin zhes brtag pa bstan to //
analyzed: des ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de yang gang yin zhes brtag pa bstan to //
translated: This shows the analysis of what is called the “other-dependent nature.”

original: chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gzhi gang yin pa de zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gzhi gang yin pa de zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: “That which is the basis for the dependent origination of phenomena, the basis for both affliction and purification” indicates the definition of the other-dependent nature taught by the Yogācāra.

original: de la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par byung ba'i ngo bo nyid rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dag gis dbang bya zhing bskyed par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi mtshan nyid ni chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par byung ba'i ngo bo nyid rgyu dang rkyen gzhan dag gis dbang bya zhing bskyed par bya ba ste /
translated: The definition of the other-dependent nature is that which is the dependent origination of phenomena, which is to be produced and controlled by other causes and conditions.

original: de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i gzhi yang yin la /
analyzed: de yang 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa rnams kyis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i gzhi yang yin la /
translated: It is also the basis for affliction by the afflictions such as attachment.

original: ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba rnams kyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i gzhi yang yin te /
analyzed: ma chags pa la sogs pa dge ba rnams kyis rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba'i gzhi yang yin te /
translated: It is also the basis for purification by means of the virtues such as nonattachment.

original: gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa de'i tshe na ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe kun nas nyon mongs par gyur pa de'i tshe na ni /
translated: When it is defiled,

original: kun rdzob kyi bden par yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden par yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: it exists as conventional truth.

original: gang gi tshe rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe na ni don dam pa'i bden par yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnam par byang bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe na ni don dam pa'i bden par yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: When it is purified, it exists as ultimate truth.

original: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig med par gyur pa na gzhi med pa dang / rgyu med par kun nas nyon mongs par byang bar mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba dngos po 'ga' zhig med par gyur pa na gzhi med pa dang / rgyu med par kun nas nyon mongs par byang bar mi 'gyur bas /
translated: If the socalled dependent nature did not exist as some entity, then defilement and purification would not exist without a basis and without a cause.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the dependent nature certainly exists.

original: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'thad pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the logic of that, he says:

original: btags pa rgyu mtshan bcas phyir dang // gzhan du gnyis po med phyir dang // kun nas nyon mongs dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: btags pa rgyu mtshan bcas phyir dang // gzhan du gnyis po med phyir dang // kun nas nyon mongs dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: Because of the designation and its causal image, because the two do not exist elsewhere, and because of the observation of defilement,

original: gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan dbang yod pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: The other-dependent is accepted as real.

original: ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: btags pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang / snam bu dang / sangs rgyas bcom @278b ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i bar du ming dang brdar tha snyad dang rnam par rtog pas glo bur du sgro btags pa ste /
analyzed: btags pa zhes bya ba ni bum pa dang / snam bu dang / sangs rgyas bcom @278b ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i bar du ming dang brdar tha snyad dang rnam par rtog pas glo bur du sgro btags pa ste /
translated: The imaginary is the adventitious superimposition of names and conceptual thoughts, such as pot, cloth, up to and including Buddha Bhagavat.

original: kun nas brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //🔽de ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: kun nas brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do // de ni rgyu mtshan dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: It is the imagined nature.🔽It is accompanied by its reason.

original: rgyu dang bcas /🔽gzhi dang bcas /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas / gzhi dang bcas /
translated: It has a cause.🔽It has a basis.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas /
translated: It has a sign.🔽It has a mark.

original: mngon rtags dang bcas pa yin pas de'i rgyu mtshan de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: mngon rtags dang bcas pa yin pas de'i rgyu mtshan de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: Its reason is the other-dependent nature.

original: de la gang gi phyir gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg bya'i skye mched bzhi'i rgyu mtshan la brten nas bum par btags pa gdags par bya zhing /
analyzed: de la gang gi phyir gzugs dang / ro dang / dri dang / reg bya'i skye mched bzhi'i rgyu mtshan la brten nas bum par btags pa gdags par bya zhing /
translated: In this regard, the imaginary should be designated as a pot in dependence on the reason of the four sense bases of form, taste, smell, and tactility.

original: rgyu spun gyi rgyu mtshan la brten nas snam bur btags par gdags par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas su byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi chos rnams la brten nas sangs rgyas su btags pa'i bar du gdags par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu spun gyi rgyu mtshan la brten nas snam bur btags par gdags par bya ba dang / sangs rgyas su byed pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi chos rnams la brten nas sangs rgyas su btags pa'i bar du gdags par bya ste /
translated: It is imputed in dependence on the reasons for the name “cloth,” from the reasons for the name “vase” up to the reasons for the name “buddha,” from the reasons for the name “cause” up to the reasons for the name “thread,” and from the reasons for the name “cause of the thread” up to the reasons for the name “cloth.”

original: bum pa dang / snam bu dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bar du btags pa gang yin pa de ni tha snyad du kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: bum pa dang / snam bu dang / sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi bar du btags pa gang yin pa de ni tha snyad du kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: That which is imputed, from the vase up to the cloth and the Bhagavat Buddha, is the imagined nature that is conventionally imputed.

original: de gang la brten nas gdags par bya ba'i rgyu mtshan skye mched bzhi dang / rgyu spun dang sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos rnams kyi bar gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de gang la brten nas gdags par bya ba'i rgyu mtshan skye mched bzhi dang / rgyu spun dang sangs rgyas su byed pa'i chos rnams kyi bar gang yin pa de ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yin pas /
translated: The reasons for imputation, from the four bases of imputation up to the causes for the name “thread” and the phenomena that make a buddha, are the dependent nature.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu mtshan la brten nas gdags par bya ba de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu mtshan la brten nas gdags par bya ba de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the imagined nature is imputed in dependence on the reasons for the dependent nature, the dependent nature does not exist.

original: gzhan yang / gzhan du gnyis po med phyir dang // zhes bya ba de'i phyir yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang / gzhan du gnyis po med phyir dang // zhes bya ba de'i phyir yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, because of the absence of the two in the other, the other-dependent essentially exists.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med du zin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med du zin na'o //
translated: “ In the other” means if the other-dependent nature did not exist.

original: gnyis po med phyir dang zhes bya bas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyis po med phyir dang zhes bya bas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis med pa'i phyir te /
translated: “ Because of the absence of the two” means because of the absence of the two, affliction and purification.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med du zin na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid med du zin na kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba gnyis med pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa yin no //
translated: Because of the error that the two, affliction and purification, would not exist if the other-dependent nature did not exist, the other-dependent nature exists.

original: yang na / gzhan du gnyis po med phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la gzung ba dang / 'dzin par gzhan du brtags pa gnyis po med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na / gzhan du gnyis po med phyir dang // zhes bya ba ni byis pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid la gzung ba dang / 'dzin par gzhan du brtags pa gnyis po med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, “because of the absence of the two in the other” means because of the absence of the two, the apprehended and the apprehender, imagined by fools in the other-dependent nature.

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
analyzed: yang dag ma yin kun rtog yod //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal exists.

original: de la gnyis po yod ma yin //🔽zhes bshad pa'i tshul gyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba @279a * //
analyzed: de la gnyis po yod ma yin // zhes bshad pa'i tshul gyis yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba @279a * //
translated: In it, duality does not exist.

original: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni yod la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni yod la /
translated: In the manner explained, the imagination of what is unreal, which is the mind and mental factors of the three realms, is the dependent nature.

original: de la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gzhan du brtags pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa gzhan du brtags pa kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid ni yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ni yod pa yin no //
translated: The imaginary nature, which is the imagination of the unreal as the duality of subject and object, does not exist in it. Therefore, the dependent nature exists.

original: gzhan yang / kun nas nyon mongs dmigs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang / kun nas nyon mongs dmigs pa'i phyir //
translated: Moreover, because the afflicted views exist,

original: zhes bya ba de'i phyir yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba de'i phyir yang gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
translated: the dependent nature exists.

original: gang gi phyir gzhi med pa mo gsham gyi bu mo'i lus lta bu la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dmigs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhi med pa mo gsham gyi bu mo'i lus lta bu la ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dmigs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because, without a basis, the afflicted views such as attachment do not occur, like the body of a barren woman’s son.

original: yul gyi bzang mo'i lus lta bu gzhi yod pa la ni 'dod chags la sogs nyon mongs pa dmigs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa yin pa nyid du 'dod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: yul gyi bzang mo'i lus lta bu gzhi yod pa la ni 'dod chags la sogs nyon mongs pa dmigs par 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid yod pa yin pa nyid du 'dod do zhes zer ro //
translated: The dependent nature is the basis of the afflictions such as desire, because desire and so on occur in relation to it, just as desire occurs in relation to the body of an attractive woman.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gzhi gang yin pa yod par 'dod pa'i tshul de skad zer ba de la 'dir dbu ma pas bshad pa /
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba chos rnams kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i gzhi gang yin pa yod par 'dod pa'i tshul de skad zer ba de la 'dir dbu ma pas bshad pa /
translated: The Yogācāra say that the dependent nature is the basis of the afflictions and the purifiers, the reality that is the dependent origination of phenomena.

original: 'di la yang gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs par 'dod na ni de 'dod la rag ste /
analyzed: 'di la yang gal te gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs par 'dod na ni de 'dod la rag ste /
translated: The Madhyamaka respond to this by saying that if the dependent nature is asserted to belong to the conventional truth, then that is acceptable.

original: de ston pa don med do zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de ston pa don med do zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: But if it is taught as the ultimate, then it is pointless to teach it.

original: 'dis ni gal te rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba phyi dang nang gi dngos po thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rgyu dang rkyen brgyud pa gzhan gyi dbang gis bskyed pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tha🔽snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa yod par 'dod na ni de 'dod la rag ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni gal te rnal 'byor spyod pa pa dag gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba phyi dang nang gi dngos po thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i rgyu dang rkyen brgyud pa gzhan gyi dbang gis bskyed pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba tha snyad kyi bden par gtogs pa yod par 'dod na ni de 'dod la rag ste /
translated: This is saying that if the Yogacaras assert that what is called the dependent nature is the dependent origination that is produced by the power of other causes and conditions, which are external and internal things that have no beginning and no end, and that it belongs to the conventional truth, then we agree.

original: de ston pa grub pa la sgrub pa yin pas don med de ;
analyzed: de ston pa grub pa la sgrub pa yin pas don med de ;
translated: But if they are proving that the dependent nature exists in an ultimate sense, then their proof is pointless.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: kho bo cag kyang tha snyad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir dang / mtho ris dang / byang grol thob par bya ba'i phyir dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba rnams yod pa nyid du bka' stsal pa de 'dod de /
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang tha snyad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rgyu dang 'bras bu la skur pa 'debs pa rnams kyi mngon par zhen pa spang ba'i phyir dang / mtho ris dang / byang grol thob par bya ba'i phyir dngos po rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba rnams yod pa nyid du bka' stsal pa de 'dod de /
translated: We also accept that the Bhagavan said that things that arise from causes and conditions exist in order to abandon the misconceptions of those who deprecate cause and effect and in order to attain high status and the definite goodness of liberation.

original: 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor 'di dag thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis rab 'byor 'di dag thams cad ni 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du yod pa yin gyi /
translated: In this way, the Bhagavān said, “Subhūti, all of these exist as mundane conventions,🔽but they do not exist ultimately.”

original: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pas de grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin pas mi rung ngo //
analyzed: don dam par ni yod pa ma yin no zhes gsungs pas de grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon chags pa yin pas mi rung ngo //
translated: Since this is established, it is not suitable to have the fault of proving what is already established.
